Name: PapalaCup
Summary: Relaxed choice with a retro ambiance serving comfort brunch classics, plus sandwiches & schnitzels.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews:
['First time trying this place, very positive impressed! We liked everything: good quality food, cozy atmosphere, very prompt and friendly staff. Totally recommend it and would definitely come back!
Thank you! And keep up the good work!', 'Loved breakfast here. Great service as well as good food. I would definitely come back again.', 'Literally cannot fault this place. Service was above and beyond, breakfast was amazing, and the cheesecake truly rivalled a NYC NY cheesecake.

Pablo was also a treat❤️🐶']

Name: Burger King
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Well packed take away and friendly staff.

I had a take away meal and it’s well packed.

The staff there was very friendly and nice.

The burgers tasted just like usual, nice whoppers!', 'The kassen were not working, apparently workers are lazy. The self service machines were also out of order, only 2 out of 4 works', 'Ordered two double whopper menus and received two out of four burgers and the wrong sauce... great place']

Name: Ming Dynastie Jannowitzbrücke Berlin
Summary: Chinese restaurant with a wood-paneled dining room, dark wood tables & seasonal riverside terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM
Reviews:
['I think this restaurant is better southern Chinese cuisine such as dim sum. We ordered spicy- sour fish which is a typical sichuan dish, and it is not so great.
However the eggplant is excellent.
Potato is so so.
Service is great, food comes rather quickly and waiters are friendly.', 'Yang Zhou : The complete fried rice and the best one in Berlin.
What I like the most about it is, it’s not greasy at all unlike the fried rice at every other Asian place.
The right amount of seasoning and a fulfilling perfect meal.
Must try at both their centres.', 'As an Indian, i always love to try food from different cultures and countries, so while doing a project management course, our project was to visit different restaurants, according to me, the food they served was sooo good, mainly, fried noodles, rice, rind(beef). M. Zwiebeln was so good, chicken with gong bao was also soo good, and also we had a Chinese beer, with different taste from our normal Berliner kindly 😜, although it was so fun, only the cons are that the waiters have a kind of attitude, also not responding much to our requirements.... Apart from that everything was cool 😎']

Name: Katerschmaus
Summary: Stylishly presented grilled meats & fish dishes, plus Spree River views from outside tables.
Reviews:
["we didn't have a reservation, luckily we found two tables.
very nice place, full of details, staff always attentive to the customer.
I can say that in addition to the location and the staff, we were super enthusiastic about the food. Placing, flavours, contrasts, colours, super, everything was to our liking. I want to give an extra point to the octopus, I rarely eat such a well cooked octopus.
Will be back and highly recommended", 'Totally unique experience. Setting is beautiful right on the river, food is delicious and one of a kind, and the service is warm and kind and welcoming. Two of us went for dinner and had oyster mushrooms (in oyster shells), octopus with lentils, and gorgeous steak.
The restaurant is set in a fun and lively outdoor social area, super fun hangout for the warm months.', 'Very nice restaurant. Bit pricy, rather small portions but good taste. Would recommend it anyway. Good place to be in, also the area around is quite cool to explore🙂']

Name: Trattoria La Bruschetta
Summary: Comfortable restaurant specializing in classic Italian dishes, including pasta & pizza.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['This is a perfect restaurant. The food is just perfect. The waiters helps you by choosing and explains the differences. The waiters are all Italian and love to tell about their home place. Service is perfect. When you buy a bottle, and your glass is empty, they refill for you. But before they refill the glass for my girlfriend they ask if it is ok to do so. Typical Italian! Decorations is just perfect. You better make a reservation, it can get full very quickly. Its not a big restaurant, what i like cause it has more athmosphere. You just want to go here if you are in Berlin', 'I had dinner twice at this restaurant. I tasted Pizza, Pasta, Tiramisu, Wine, and Espresso. Those were quite delicious and thanks, I'd just say 4 out of 5.

The drawback: If you're alone at the dinner, the service is reduced apparently. The waiter also didn't even look at the table or at me when I order sth. Imagine, people look at each other's eyes when they toss beer and say "prost!". Afterwards, the same waiter went to the other table 4 and even made a welcoming small talk.

If the bill is important to have a warm attitude, I already paid 28 Euros for pasta, wine and tiramisu. Probably almost 1.5 times more than a usual table with 1 person at this restaurant.

Attitude is as important as the taste of the food. I don't think I will visit this place again.', 'Super nice food and kind staff. Definitely try the bruschetta and tiramisu!
The pasta is homemade, so that’s really great.']

Name: Tasty
Summary: Unpretentious venue with sidewalk tables, prepping Italian classics such as pizza & pasta.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM
Reviews: ["Decent.  NOT a neapolitan style pizza, just the average pizza you get everywhere because that's what the Germans want. Bit disappointed, a real italian can do better.", 'So good. I wish I took pictures but forgot. Two guys working were so nice and patient with me placing a to go order. I had caprese, tiramisu, margarita pizza (heads up international folks - just a cheese pizza), and the penne fungi pollo or something like that. All were phenomenal. Tiramisu feels like someone’s grandma made it. Just so good. 10/10\n\nAlso the space has great lighting and lots of windows! Sat at a table while waiting for my food.', 'Not great, not terrible. Food is just okayish, and I would not label it Italian. Stylised as Italian - this is a more accurate description. More a canteen than a proper restaurant. Service is very nice and this is the biggest plus. No alcoholic beverages is unfortunately  also a downside.']

Name: Holzmarkt 25
Summary: Park known for its riverside views, dotted with bohemian bars & food stands for pizzas or burgers.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews:
["What a great place to hang out for a few hours! The only thing I'll say is that some of the staff cam across like they could not be bothered being nice or in fact engaging but all in all at very interesting place to sit by the river or just chill with our friends.

Great selection of food, drinks and all outdoors.

Great fun!", "We absolutely loved this place. It has a unique charm that's hard to find elsewhere. It's the perfect spot to grab a drink and watch the sunset near the water.

The variety of food and drinks is impressive, with options ranging from pizzas and bread to Peruvian, Mexican, Indian, and Taiwanese cuisine. They offer both alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. The hygiene of the toilets is acceptable.

You can even get a tattoo on site, adding to the unique experience. With so many options available, you're guaranteed to have a great time here, especially with good company.", 'The most incredible atmosphere I’ve experienced in a market. The selection of cuisines was endless and there were lots of places to sit. Prices were reasonable and the food was delivered relatively quickly. There was even a small park for the kids to play in. The best part about this was definitely the waterside seating where you can sit right at the lake and watch the sunset (if you want to guarantee your spot to do so, I recommend going early as it gets busy VERY quickly).']

Name: Wurstpate
Summary: Offbeat window-serve snack stand doling out hot dogs & currywurst with a homemade sauce.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 – 6:30 AM, 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 6:30 AM, 12:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews: ['With lots of curry wurst options across Berlin, I wanted to try a more authentic place and this was it. It was popular too so knew it would be good.  Very tasty!', 'Wurstpate perfectly embodies the idea of Berlin street food! Excellent prices, very good food and kind service. The Kettwurst definitely deserves a shot!', 'Best place I had curry wurst when I was traveling in Berlin. Was walking back from the East Gallery when my nose caught the smell of some good food. Small tented area to sit down at and some stand up tables. Cash only here.']

Name: Restaurant Ambrosius
Summary: Unpretentious German dishes, plus breakfast, in a wood-lined, country-style dining room.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Amazing authentic German restaurant! This little gem was just around the corner from our hotel, we decided to give it a try. It's 30 degrees Celsius in Berlin today and there's no A/C inside so we had to sit on the patio, but it was lovely atmosphere out there.

Server's English was "not so gut" (his words) but they had an English menu so it was all workable with our "not so gut" German. The rest of the family had various schnitzels (yum!) and I had the turkey steak with pepper sauce (super yum!), even though there's hundreds of restaurants in Berlin we're already talking about coming back again. Absolutely excellent!', 'If you desire traditional German cuisine in a warm, inviting environment, this is the place to visit. They have a seasonal menu as well as a standard menu in multiple languages. I had the goulash to start and the pork knuckle as the main. The food is delicious and the servings are large.

The staff is welcoming and friendly. It felt more like a family environment and we will be back!', "Stayed in a nearby hotel and managed to steal some me-time from an otherwise hectic programme. A positive review of their pork knuckle caught my attention. I must say that this is probably the best pork knuckle I've had. The flesh was amazingly tender even though it looked dry. The red cabbage was just the right level of sweetness and sour, while the dumplings were lighter than the usual. Everything came together well. Managed to finished everything, except for an inch of crackling which would have tipped me over the edge! Well worth a try if you are nearby, and possibly even a detour to enjoy both the quality of the meal and the warm service."]

Name: Taverna Athene
Summary: Moussaka, gyros & classic meaty grills at a simple, family-run dining room with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:45 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:45 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:45 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:45 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:45 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:45 PM
Reviews:
['Yamas! Took my friends whom were visiting Berlin and we had a really fun evening here. Overall dining experience was excellent. The atmosphere is low key elegant and dimly lit. It’s family owned so the space and service provides a intimate yet personal touch.

Food quality portion and size + value were all very good. Star dishes: grilled anchovies, walnut cake, moussaka.

Highly recommend if you love Greek food and Ouzo.', 'The food was amazing, musaka and mixed plate were absolutely great, one of the best greek restaurants we have been to. Staff is very kind and service is really good and fast.', "I had a great experience overall at this restaurant. The food was delicious, and the atmosphere was enjoyable. If you're looking to try tasty Greek dishes, it's definitely worth a visit. However, the only downside was when we tried to pay with a card. The waiter seemed reluctant and was unwilling to split the total amount, so we had to figure it out ourselves. It was a bit disappointing, as the reason for this behavior was unclear."]

Name: Kindercafé Kreuzzwerg
Summary: Colorful global-fare cafe with stations & attractions for kids, like a ball pit & sandbox.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['Superb recommendation! Our daughter was the happiest playing there as we had a nice time while talking with the staff. They were also super helpful when we needed help after our kid felt a bit sick. 100% recommended!', 'Absolutely lovely. I can not recommend it enough. It is delightful, my baby had a blast and us adults enjoyed breakfast. 10/10 ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐', 'Amazing place! There should be more cafes like this. My son had the best time and I enjoyed delicious drinks and food. On Sundays they have a huge brunch offering. It’s not cheap but for what you get it’s worth paying a bit more than the usual. I have a lot of respect for the staff too who manage to dodge tiny people while carrying hot drinks and plates. I’m not sure why there are some negative reviews here, would you expect staff to constantly smile while working in such a loud and busy environment? They do very well. I will happily come back']

Name: Sehraya Shisha Lounge
Summary: Laid-back Egyptian-themed hangout featuring cocktails, bar bites & flavored smokes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 2:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 2:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 2:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 2:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 2:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 2:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 2:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews:
['I am writing to express my utmost satisfaction and appreciation for the exceptional experience I had at your café recently. I feel compelled to commend you on the outstanding level of customer service, delightful ambiance, and remarkable quality that I encountered during my visit.

First and foremost, I would like to extend my gratitude to your staff for their exemplary professionalism and excellent demeanor. From the moment I entered the café, I was greeted with warm smiles and a genuine willingness to assist. The employees were attentive, responsive, and went above and beyond to ensure that my needs were met. Their courteous and friendly nature truly made me feel valued as a customer.

Furthermore, I must commend you on the ambiance and atmosphere of your café. The tasteful decor, comfortable seating arrangements, and soothing background music created a tranquil and inviting environment. I found it to be the perfect setting for relaxation, socializing, and even productive work. The attention to detail in designing the space is evident and greatly contributes to the overall positive experience.

In terms of service, I was thoroughly impressed by the promptness and efficiency with which my orders were taken and delivered. The waitstaff was knowledgeable about the menu offerings and provided helpful recommendations based on my preferences. The food and beverages were served in a timely manner, and each item exceeded my expectations in terms of taste and presentation. The culinary delights offered at your café truly showcase the mastery of your talented chefs.

Lastly, the overall quality of the experience was exceptional. From the freshness of the ingredients to the precision in preparation, it is evident that your café places a strong emphasis on maintaining high standards. The attention to quality is evident in every aspect, from the ingredients used in the dishes to the skillful execution of each recipe. It is refreshing to find a café that consistently delivers such excellence.

In conclusion, I would like to express my sincere gratitude for the remarkable experience I had at your café. The exceptional service, inviting atmosphere, and top-notch quality have left a lasting impression on me. I will undoubtedly recommend your café to friends, family, and colleagues, and I look forward to returning soon to enjoy another outstanding visit.

Thank you once again for providing such an exceptional experience.', "Saturday service was so bad and impolite that they almost threw us out just because  we didn't have a big order in the first round  of orders  . We were a group of 11. The first time the waiter came, we were not ready. We asked for 6 dileinks and told the waiter we would order again  later as we are staying for long .. he got the manager, and they spoke with us in a very disrespectful .. so we left to another place to enjoy our gathering .
We were happy with the music show and were planning to stay till 2:00 am .. it was not our first  time in that place .. the previous time each one ordered at least 2 drinks + food and snacks... so I'm not sure what their problem was", 'Great hookah/shisha lounge, super friendly staff. The gentlemen who helped us were very kind through a slight language barrier, and made sure we were comfortable. Two stories, but they brought out chairs and a table for us to sit outside. Had a very good experience here for a late night smoke sesh.']

Name: Clash
Summary: Buzzing alternative bar & club, with a beer garden & weekly menu of global bites.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['This place rules. PLENTY of space, inside and out. Good bier list (one of the only places in Berlin that serves a good Snakebite), plus pinball, pool, and foosball. The music selection is EXCELLENT, not too loud as some reviewers have said', "There were two cocktails and it was good that they were recommended. The music is rock and funky and it's a closed space.", "This classic old-style pub in Berlin is a cool spot with a vibrant crowd. However, the loud music can make conversation a challenge, requiring you to practically scream. The tables could use some more attention as they are often left uncleared. The presence of billiards and table soccer is a plus, and the mix of middle-aged folks, bros, and punk individuals adds to the unique atmosphere. The bar itself is good, and the beer is both nice and reasonably priced. Just be prepared for the high volume of the music, and don't expect a quick game of billiards, as the queue can get quite long!"]

Name: Mustafa's Gemüse Kebap
Summary: Popular, hearty chicken kebabs with grilled veggies, doled out from a tiny kiosk.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 2:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
['Mustafa’s Gemüse Kebab used to be my favorite kebab spot ever. Coming all the way from the Netherlands, we knew exactly when to go to avoid the long lines. We would always order two kebabs each, sometimes having them for breakfast and other times as a late-night snack. The memory of enjoying the perfect kebab for just 3 euros (back in the day; now it’s €7,10) still lingers as one of my fondest food experiences.

Unfortunately, the flavor and quality have declined. The kebab just doesn’t hit the same way anymore. The dash of lemon no longer gives that refreshing kick, the meat is not as flavorful, and the bread has become dry. My partner and I recently returned to Berlin and tried it again, only to look at each other and nod in disappointment. This kebab just isn’t the same anymore.

I don’t mind paying a more for a good meal, especially at a beloved spot like Mustafa’s, but it’s disappointing when the quality doesn’t match what it once was. Mustafa’s Gemüse Kebab no longer holds the same place in my heart—and my taste buds—as it used to.', 'A must visit place in Berlin. Very nice and friendly place to eat traditional duner in a casual atmosphere. Thoroughly enjoyed the view and food sitting at the walk way edge. People are crazy about this place and the time we left there was a long queue and everyone was waiting desperately. Very economical but full of mouth watering taste.', "Queue was extremely long, food tasted just like potatoes 😆 - Not worth the wait, but if you want to experience it, go for it.
The staff was really nice, points for it.
The portion size was also  good, but the taste just didn't cover up enough."]

Name: Amici Amici
Summary: Comfy kitchen offering Italian classics & Sicilian specialties in cheerful, traditional surrounds.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['We had lunch here on a Sunday. The food was quite good. The restaurant was very full, with all tables inside and outside being completely occupied, which overwhelmed the staff. We waited a long time to get drinks and then the food. Apart from that, the staff was friendly and tried their best. We sat outside by the street, which was extremely loud as the restaurant is located on the cross section of main roads. Police cars, cars horning, etc. tainted the atmosphere.', 'It was pretty good but the food was a little bit too spicy. They have a very delicious bread with great olive oil. The staff was very nice and friendly.', 'Lovely food and good atmosphere, all dishes were really nice. I was served by Riccardo which was very attentive and friendly. Great service and food.']

Name: Blue Nile Restaurant
Summary: Relaxed stop for Ethiopian specialty stews & injera bread, plus traditional coffee ceremonies.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ["It's a true Ethiopian restaurant in Berlin! There's a good choice of different dishes, although the portions are not that big. Prices are although very low. The waiters were extraordinary nice and the location is so pretty!", 'I really like this Ethiopian restaurant as it is close to my house. For the first time I ordered a salad and was a bit disappointed as it was nothing special, could have been done better at home and for the price it is not worth it.\nHowever, the main dish was super good. I took the mix plate with lamb curry and 3 vegetarian dishes. It was super good and really filling.', 'Visited this cozy restaurant on a Saturday evening. Location is a little far from our hotel but we felt like eating Ethiopean food and this one had good reviews. The food is indeed well spiced. We chose the menu for 2 which consisted of beef goulash, lentils, 2 chicken drumsticks, feta, cabbage and salad. We paired it with South African white wine and Djuju Mango. Good service, nice ambiance with the candles.']

Name: Cancún Kreuzberg
Summary: Restaurant serving a variety of Mexican dishes as well as offering cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Reviews: ['It started off amazing. We ordered some cocktails which were super tasty. There is a great selection of them. The food portions are very large and our starter tasted great. The issue was one our mains came there was clearly flies in both of our salads. When I informed a waitress working there she said I was wrong and it was not a fly. This put a large downer on the mood. I checked again with a waiter who acknowledged and apologised immediately and replaced for fresh.', 'It was an amazing experience! Very friendly staff, they still prepared a meal for me when the kitchen was about to close and even recommended an excellent dessert! I can assure you will have a great time here :)', 'The food was very nice and very well decorated. The quantity was good as well (I ordered mixata)\nA bit pricy but I guess it is worthy for the location, specially in summer. Recommended at least once']

Name: Veggie & Vega - Restaurant Berlin
Summary: Straightforward eatery with a casual vibe specializing in vegetarian & vegan South Indian cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Incredibly delicious vegan dishes! Waiter was friendly, service was surprisingly quick given the many clients and single waiter. They play fun music to make for a good vibe. So happy I chose to try this cuisine, definitely inspired to try southern indian again! 10/10 would recommend to anybody with a love for elaborate tastes.', 'I feel mean giving this a three - the staff were lovely and attentive, the atmosphere was nice once you found it tucked behind the shop, the price is great and my food (bindi masala) was good. However, the samosa pastry was too thick and a little undercooked, and salad seemed a weird side to serve with all the curries. The bindi masala was very salty, so although nice left me feeling very dehydrated. My friend who got the palak paneer was very disappointed, said it tasted strange and the paneer was quite like halloumi rather than paneer. But the staff were very keen to please, and the menu was huge - almost too much choice!', 'really cute! it‘s tucked away inside a store and you order at the cash register, food came fast and the portion was pretty good for the prize, but it could’ve been hotter for my taste']

Name: Bar Centrale
Summary: Creative spins on classic dishes & carefully chosen wines at an intimate venue with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ["I've been a regular for over a decade now, and it never disappoints. Their monthly menu offers a great deal with two appetizers, a main course, and dessert, all at reasonable prices. The Amarone, Marion, is fantastic, and they have a great selection of Italian sparkling wines too. Despite being busy, the service is attentive and friendly. I highly recommend giving it a try!", 'We go here regularly and truly enjoy the service, food and the calm ambiance. Food is consistently served with high standards and wine selections are reasonably priced. Kreuzberg has allot of restaurants but few with consistent quality and classic service. I definitely recommend this restaurant to visiting friends, neighbors or to ppl who like a eat bit more sophisticated Italian food in Kreuzberg.', 'High class Italian without any compromise. Recommended']

Name: Belle Alliance
Summary: Global breakfast fare plus coffee & cocktails at a chic brunch spot with a flower-lined terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['Had a fantastic breakfast at Belle Alliance today. Service and food were excellent. The owner, Rodi, came out to greet and say hello. I had the Spicy Baked Beans and it was delicious! Very large portion.\n\nHighly recommend coming to Belle Alliance for breakfast or brunch.', 'Good place, nice interiors, friendly staff. The food is good, maybe not just for my taste (little too many spices for my taste). The food is presented beautifully. It was quickly cooked. I didn’t quite enjoy the bread though, I prefer the softer one. The place slightly on the pricey side.', 'One of the best cafes we encountered in our Berlin trip. The staff were very nice, the place was really cute and the food was absolutely delicious. 100% recommended!!!']

Name: Split
Summary: Traditional Croatian sausages, steaks & beer in a long-standing, refined restaurant.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["A hidden gem near the center of Berlin! The food was fresh and the restaurant was very clean. Berlin isn't known for having a ton of traditional German food, so try some food from their strong immigrant history. Gibe this place a try!", 'On first glance it doesnt look like anything special but the food is amaizing. The seafood tasted very fresh and there were vegan options for traditional croatian foods. There were many options for sides and a salad was included in the price!', 'Good food in an authentic atmosphere. However, the service was very slow and unmotivated, which affected the overall experience.']

Name: Kreuzberger Himmel
Summary: Hip eatery with a terrace dishing up traditional Syrian food like fattoush, fatteh makdous & kibbeh.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['I was here a couple of years ago and loved the food. But this time (couple years later), it was a bit disappointing.
It definitely is overpriced now, 9 Euro for Babaganoush which was missing a bit of taste. It was not bad and fresh, but def not worth the price. Also the main dish felt more like a starter because of the size and came at 13 Euro.
Wouldn’t mind the price if the taste and everything would be exceptional, but sadly it was only good.', 'The waiter from Afghanistan needs more training, he wasn’t very professional. Our main courses took way too long as well. However, the food is super yummy and very authentic.', 'I came here as I thought the concept was great, plus I’m a huge fan of Levantine cuisine having spent months working in Lebanon and having visited Syria in 2019.

This said, everything was a disappointment: starting from the shared table with another couple (though I booked a table in advance — no privacy) and the room was extremely cold and had to eat with my coat on. Tablecloth was spotted and dirty in many places, this isn’t fine for a medium price range restaurant, no doubt about this.

The food: I would only save baba ganoush, sadly muttabal wasn’t available as many other dishes. So I ordered koussa bil Laban and the portion (see picture) was embarrassing small for the price.
There was hardly any meat in the zucchini.

My mum got kibbeh. I tried them. They were tasteless, completely lacked of spices. I could only taste the bulgur from the shell. She couldn’t finish them.

The service was not attentive at all.
I sadly won’t be back, one star cause 0 isn’t an option.

Good Levantine food is somewhere else in Berlin, at fair prices and with Levantine portion sizes, not children’s ones.']

Name: Little Tibet Restaurant
Summary: Quaint restaurant presenting Tibetan, Thai & Indian fare, with halal, vegetarian & vegan options.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['We went to this place today and tbh it was one of the most delicious dishes I ever had in Berlin. Fresh and very tasty. Only downside was that it took very long until food was ready but the taste was worth the wait 3x.', 'Great food, tasty and big portions. The main dishes were amazing, but the starter was a bit dry.', 'The hospitality by the staff is what tops the experience in my opinion. The food is definitely good, but the welcoming staff takes your dining experience to a new level!\nI had the TSE pakoras and momos (veggie options), 10/10 recommended.']

Name: Casalot Restaurant
Summary: Relaxed, exotic restaurant serving Middle Eastern & Arabic specialties, with a shisha lounge.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Our new favorite place in town. Went for a Sunday lunch, was epic! The portions are big, so we packed half away and still walked out full! Meat is just so delicious and aubergine dish is fantastic. Of course there is also the fluffy bread, top notch! The service also super friendly and efficient and food was flying out! Highly recommend!', 'Best Arab food I’ve had outside Palestine and Syria! The lamb cutlets are grilled to a very sweet point of tender, together with delicately grilled baby potatoes and fabulous garlic sauce. The Aubergine-vegetables also amazed us, with the aubergine cooked to the right degree of softness and soaked with the tomato-paprika sauce. The rose water lemonade is very refreshing.
Lovely staff and relaxing environment as well. Would recommend 10/10, worth the price!', 'Food is fine, the staff asked me aggressively "how much would you like to tip? X% or Y%?" instead of asking me politely "would you maybe like to tip?"

As I was paying on behalf of someone else, I was not sure if I could tip, and I told the staff so. Then the staff's face turned very unfriendly or even mad. Excuse me, are we in the US now?  Are those staffs underpaid from the salary or what?

We were 5 people and spent between 240-250, including multiple rounds of drinks, I believe we were not stingy customers.

Eventually I topped up to 260, which is around 5-10% tip, and the staff was still unfriendly and did not reply me when I told him thank you in the end, very impolite and disrespectful.

Unless you don't mind being asked for tip aggressively, or you don't care about this kinda negative vibe at all, I would recommend somewhere else. The food is definitely fine here, but not too difficult to find similar and cheaper places. Most importantly, my whole experience was ruined in the end.

Hope this sharing helps.']

Name: Mediterraneo
Summary: Old-fashioned restaurant with outdoor seating offering pizza, pasta, steak & other standards.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews:
["This is such a great location and it's a shame about the food. Both of us ordered pasta and neither of us were very satisfied. I won't say this is the worst carbonara I've ever had, but it comes close. Barely any ham, lacked seasoning, very sure it was roux based instead of just cream and egg. Tasted more like a stodgy Alfredo and the majority went back to the kitchen uneaten.", "We got there 20 minutes before the kitchen closed, but I don’t think that should excuse the quality of the pasta dishes we got. I ordered the carbonara, which is my favorite pasta dish, but it really didn't taste or look like any carbonara I've had before. My partner had the bolognese, and honestly, we’ve had better from a can. The portions were big, but that’s the only positive thing I can say.

Also, our server never even asked if we liked our meals, which kind of says it all.

Usually, I read reviews thoroughly before trying a new restaurant. But we were nearby for the Filmrauschpalast. My bad because, wow. I really wouldn’t recommend eating here. We certainly won’t come back.", 'The food was ok , nothing to complain about, beer 🍺 ist good also the dessert is very good ! Totally is not expensive, so I gave them 4 stars .']

Name: Saigon River
Summary: Standard restaurant with a compact terrace, serving Vietnamese & South East Asian specialties.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['We had excellent summer rolls, chicken pho, which was pretty good (needs more veg/herbs/sprouts but maybe Germans don’t use them?), Thai curry with crispy chicken (not particularly Thai, but very tasty!), and yellow curry (lots of great fresh veg). Great desserts & drinks! Nice atmosphere, and the man who served us was very kind to the kids.', 'Good Restaurant with quality food. We really love going to this restaurant, always nice service and food is very tasty. Everything we have ordered here were amazing. We live near to this place so have visited multiple times. Service is also very good. I would definitely visit this place to everyone.', 'We stumbled upon this restaurant after a visit at the Hamburger Bahnhof Museum.  The staff was quite and nice.  We had Bun fresh with Tofu Tempura and Tuna bowl.  Both are surprisingly tasty and quite a big portions for us. The prices are very reasonable here.']

Name: Café Anna Blume
Summary: Cafe-restaurant, connected to florist, with marble-topped tables, homemade cakes & terrace seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Was recommended to try this cafe & not disappointed. Had the Irish coffee & home made strawberry cake. Very reasonably priced but the best bit was the waitress who despite being busy didn’t stop smiling. Well worth a visit', '€14 for a soft-boiled egg on a slice of bread. Are you kidding me? The lentil soup is supposed to come with bread and butter, but they don’t bring the butter. I have to go and ask for it, and the waitress says, "But there’s no butter." I show her the menu, and she looks at it in surprise. To be fair, the food is good, but the service is incredibly slow (after 35 minutes of waiting to order the desserts, we decided to leave), and the prices are outrageous.', 'Service in Germany gets low stars because of the style. It’s not attentive but they are nice and the cake and coffee is great. Gorgeous outside seating']

Name: Girasol
Summary: Relaxed Mexican eatery with colorful murals & sidewalk seats serving tacos, enchiladas & margaritas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Tasty tortilla soup, but stay way from the nachos! Taste is not bad, aside from the nachos, nothing to blow your mind, though. Friendly and attentive staff', 'I was amazed by their presentation, attentiveness, portion size and quality! Really loved the Vegetarian burrito, and the baked cheese in it surprised me. Cherry on the top was the delicious watermelon flavoured schnapps to end our lunch. Hands down recommended for all.', "The stuff were really nice, the food was tasty, the portions were quite big and the cocktails were good (especially the mango colada) if you like Mexican food you should give this place a visit and when you come make sure you're hungry, one main dish and your full.\nWe are tourists but there was no language barrier what so ever, one guy even spoke my mother tongue which was a pleasant surprise.\nWould come again but we're in Berlin just for a week :)"]

Name: MarienBurgerie
Summary: Easygoing, colorful counter-serve with full-sized & mini hamburgers, including vegetarian versions.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Best burger for good proce in berlin super fast service 3 min for 2 burgers and fries', 'Delicious burgers for either lunch or dinner. This place seems really popular with the local work crowd for lunch time. So it may be difficult to get a seat (only a few benches to sit at). So you may want to consider getting take away. The staff are really friendly and nice. And the burgers are huge! Got two or the house special burger, two drinks and some chips for just under €20.', 'A small delightful place for you #burger lovers. There are many flavors and this a a very popular place. I love their burgers and its hidden gem are its potato wedges. Its yummy and crispy. They also have tasty baby burgers for kids. You can also sit outside and eat and enjoy the prenzlauerberg view.  Try these when you are around. #berlin #tasty']

Name: Bangkok Treffpunkt
Summary: Calm Thai eatery in a bright, cheerful space featuring traditional curries & stir-fries, plus wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Me and my husband always love visiting this restaurant. Perfect ambience, loved the food, and specially the service is awesome.

The owner (both husband and wife) are very friendly and treat you as a family. Very good atmosphere.

Tried many dishes, and loved everything.

From drinks, juices to starters to main course to dessert everything is perfect.

Recommend to try any coconut curry with Crispy chicken, it is amazing.', 'Very average food as well as sub pair ambience. Nice staff but I won’t go back. Better Thai (not sure this is even Thai) in town. The aquarium is… so bad taste to me.', '3.5 stars would be fair. A decent Thai eatery with a pleasant interior and nice staff. I wouldn’t recommend the hot and sour soup, as it was neither sour nor hot but rather sweet actually. The curry dishes are good here, although the spice level is extremely mild. I’ve had their spiciest dish and had to add half a container of chili sauce just to feel some heat. The prices are rather low but the portions are actually quite small.']

Name: Werkstatt der Süße
Summary: Contemporary patisserie with a striking light installation, offering colorful tartlets & pralines.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
['After buying our birthday cake from here for the last few years, we were very excited to order our wedding dessert from Werkstatt der Süsse. They offer a tower of little cakes topped by a bigger cake to be cut together, as it is tradition. We worked with Bea, who was lovely from the start. She let us choose 4 different flavours based on our personal taste. We went for white chocolate maracuyá for the top cake, and raspberry, peach and chocolate for the little ones. The team even delivered the cakes safely to the venue.
We got a lot of compliments from our guests and really enjoyed all 4 flavours ourselves. Unbeatable!
Thank you so much Bea 🤍', 'Very high quality cake! Was not over sweet and with delicate flavor and texture. I want to try other cake too!', "Cakes are wonderful!
Very tasty indeed.
They are pricey though but totally worth the taste.
I have only picked up the cake from there and didn't dine in, so am not sure about the general atmosphere and staff.
But it generally didn't feel warm and welcoming as the cakes :)"]

Name: Zula Restaurant
Summary: Unfussy cafe specializing in Israeli-style hummus with toppings, plus grilled meats & homemade pita.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Quiet location.
Hummus was delicious.
Friendly staff.
Oh.. the fresh orange juice was amazing.', 'Been there yesterday for dinner.
The food was amazing, everythings come together. The price affordable.
The service excelent!! The waiters with glasses super nice ❤️
will come back again and recomended to everyone.. ❤️❤️', 'Pita sandwich was good, chicken soup and humus were great. Their coffee is the best we tried in the city - beats many popular coffee shops.
Highly recommend']

Name: Cenacolo
Summary: Cozy trattoria with exposed bricks & a busy terrace, known for classic pizzas, pastas & fish dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Very good italian cuisine, we were very satisfied. Nice to try it ..', '+ pizzas were delicious. The ingredients were very fresh.
+ the waiters were very fast and friendly.
+ good price / quality ratio
- I can’t think of any negative points.', 'Just discovered this restaurant and had a wonderful evening. Delicious food, fast Service and good price. We were 4 persons, all happy. Will definitely come again ! 👍']

Name: No Fire No Glory
Summary: Buzzy cafe using freshly roasted beans & organic milk with wood-topped tables & hanging lamps.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews:
['Amazing place in a really nice neighborhood!
Enjoyed our breakfast here a lot, definitely recommend pancakes and BBQ pulled beef Benedict. I think best in the neighborhood so far.
Coffee is very tasty as well. Finally a place that serves cold brew tonic 😍', 'Amazing cafe in Prenzlauer Berg Berlin. I stop in several times a week for breakfast and the most amazing cappuccinos. Gets very busy during the weekends and on public holidays, so reservations are recommended. The staff is very friendly. Please be mindful that food and drinks are made to order so you can’t be in a hurry to eat and run. This is such a great neighborhood cafe and truly worth a stop if in the area!', "It's a great place to relax in peace and quiet.
I wouldn't recommend the coffee, though.
When I order a cappuccino, I always want to get a smooth, rich foam, but the foam was grainy, shallow, and unskilled, and the iced coffee tasted like water, not cold.
And while I don't mind a few chipped plates,
I wish they would take better care of any broken coffee or drink cups that come in contact with my mouth."]

Name: Liebling - Café & Bar
Summary: Artisan coffee, cakes & salads, plus wine & beer, in a compact, relaxed venue with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['We just arrived in Berlin and found this welcoming nice spot. Beside the nice drinks they also provided us with some late night snacks. The humus is really good!', 'Delicious breakfast.. eggs were just perfect.. Will be back!!', 'Unbelievably rude behavior from the waiter- don’t ruin your night there
Sometimes the only thing that you ask is to find a place to enjoy peacefully a drink and catch up with your friends. So simple! But unfortunately for some people it’s not as simple.

We were 5 friends going there to get a drink. It was not our first time visiting this bar. The drinks took actually quite some time to arrive..almost half an hour after our drinks arrived and just when he saw that one of the 5 drinks was over the waiter came to ask if he should bring new ones. We said kindly not yet. We can call you if we need something. This behavior happened 3 times in half an hour!! And every time he was more intense. Just before we all finish our drinks he came and said that there are people waiting and we should leave to free the space! because “we didn’t drink fast and enough”. What?!! It’s even more surprising that they think they can treat people like this and nobody will react against this unacceptable behavior. He even said with pride and irony that we can complain to his boss and even what his name is if we want to use it for a review. Such a behavior definitely worth 0 stars. It’s quite dangerous how some bars feel strong and powerful because we -the people- have supported them and then they treat the customers with arrogant disrespectful behavior feeling untouchable. But even little reviews can inform others and at least rescue them from ruining their night

Edit: apparently the response of the owner below that accepts the complaints, apologizes and offers a free brunch IS NOT goodwill neither valid since google forwarded to me the complaint for defamation!!! And applying access restriction because of expressing my complaint against the unbelievable rude behavior of the waiter. Proof that is extremely important to share any experience']

Name: Red Dragon
Summary: Unassuming eatery offering Chinese, Thai & Vietnamese classics, with a vegan menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 3:30 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Very not tasty pho I’ve evert tried. I came in just because it’s nearby and I was too tired to walk further, but i guess I wouldn’t come back again cause the food is….the meat is so hard to chew and in overall, it’s…..anyway, gotta go. Peace. ✌️', 'A friendly place with great food, I would particularly recommend the flavourful green curries!', 'The price is relatively reasonable and the food is worthy to eat as lunch or dinner.']

Name: Al Hamra
Summary: Bright corner cafe for Middle Eastern meze, wraps & salads, with a weekend brunch.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Location is their saving grace with a decent drinks menu. Service is warm if absent (better to walk up to them to get things like cutlery in a timely manner, after food arrives). Local competition on hummus and flat bread left me feeling disappointed, this was notably basic.', 'I loved this place. It was some of the best hummus I’ve had. The environment is a beautiful welcoming environment with amazing decor. There were people of all nationalities ages and cultures here and the food was perfect for what I needed at the time. I had a great pomegranate salad and a chicken and rice dish that was beautiful.', '"Hands down one of the best bars in Berlin! The staff is incredibly friendly, always ensuring top-notch service. The vibes here are unbeatable, creating the perfect atmosphere for a great time. And let\'s not forget their fantastic Arak selection – a definite must-try! Can\'t recommend it enough! 🍹🎉"']

Name: Delizie D’Italia
Summary: Warm, informal Italian restaurant featuring checkered tablecloths, outdoor seating & daily menus.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["Great pasta and even greater service. They really treat you well, they enjoy what they do, they want you to have a good time. Will come here more often.\n\nYou can really feel that it's a family run business.", 'Very authentic Italian food. We had the liver which was amazing and the truffle and ragu pastas too. The staff was also super nice to us', "Very good Italian food in Prenzlauer Berg. Pesto Sauce is one of my favorites for sure! The pasta is always al dente, and good quality. The staff is friendly and the environment is cozy. Don't forget to try the Tiramisu."]

Name: Birra - Italian Craft Beer
Summary: Informal hangout with outdoor seating offering bottled & draft Italian craft beers, plus panini.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ['This is a small Italian pub with 10 types of beer on tap. Here you can try the rare smoked stout, rye beer, or raspberry beer without syrup, which are hard to find in Berlin. In addition to Italian beer, you can also enjoy German and French varieties. The staff is very welcoming. Seats fill up within the first 10 minutes after the bar opens, so make sure to arrive right at 6 PM. The prices are affordable. We will definitely come back here again.', "They have really good snacks and paninis, the beer options are very good. Usually you can't find many places in Berlin where you have good tap beers and finger foods.", 'The vegan sandwich is amazing, and the beers as well. The service is great because the people that work there are smile and nice. The prices are fair. I recommend.']

Name: BRYK BAR
Summary: Creative cocktails & housemade gin at a sleek contemporary bar with a fireplace & a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Amazing cocktails! We were served by a very sweet and polite bartender.\nNone of us thought we would ever enjoy popcorn with dill, but to our surprise it was actually nice! Definitely going to come back.', 'Cocktails are very good but service incredibly bad. The girl serving us last Friday night were really unfriendly in all ways possible. She made us wait when we came in, what I can understand but the way she talked and treated us was really rude. When we ordered the bill, we were the only table inside and she started to clean up and do 1.000 other things making us wait until she decided to bring the bill. I suggest to spend your money in other places where at least they have friendly staff but not here.', "one of my favourite cocktail bars in pberg. Famous for their smoked gin and tonics, the rest of their mixologists' creations are also really fantastic. In winter there is a lit fireplace that makes the place super cosy for a date or a girls' night out."]

Name: Kaffeehaus SowohlAlsAuch
Summary: Gateaux, cheesecakes & strudels, plus savory dishes, in a classic coffeehouse with tables outdoors.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Came here because it was basically the only dessert place still open at 10PM, and honestly exceeded all my expectations. It felt more like a restaurant, but they have every variety of coffee, a bunch of teas, shakes and more, on top of a wide selection of delicious cakes. The slices are also pretty massive, great stuff!', "We decided to grab some coffee and brunch here and couldn't have been happier with our choice. The food was absolutely amazing, and the staff were amiable. On top of that, the location is fantastic, and you can relax outside with your coffee ☕️. We ended up staying for nearly 2 hours. I'd definitely suggest this place to anyone who wants delicious food and a wonderful time with loved ones 💯", 'Food Quality: very good and fresh ingredients. The orange juice is freshly pressed daily, cheeses are fresh, and eggs done to perfection.

Portions: as can be seen in the pictures, good big plates with a wide selection.

Drinks: good variety of hot and cold drinks.

Price: $$ very reasonable prices for the quantities and quality.

Service: very friendly staff. Can also speak English if needed.

Atmosphere: cute little place inside, huge terrace when the weather is good.

Highlights: amazing brunch options and the huge terrace. So good to sit outside and enjoy the fresh air while having a good breakfast.']

Name: Mitho Cha! P-Berg
Summary: Quaint, country-style restaurant with housemade Nepalese & Tibetan cuisine, plus a take-out option.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Pretty good restaurant for Nepalese cuisine. The dumplings were just OK, the Paneer Chilli was delicious and the vegetarian noodles were quite good. The service is quite friendly and the portions were decently large. Reservations are recommended since the tables are usually booked out.', "Delicious food, especially the coconut chicken & alu poda. We originally came here for the Nepali momos – they were decent in taste but felt too floury.

The service was exceptional, our waiter made sure we had everything in time.

The vibe both indoor & outdoor is great. It's also ideal for bigger groups.

And yes, their mango lassi was delicious too. I also loved the thalis they used to serve the food.", "One of the best restaurants I've visited in Berlin. Not only they have super nice customer service but also the food is so good, you will want to try the whole menu. I suggest making a reservation before arriving and try to be here at 18:00 if you don't want to be around a lot of people, after 20:00 this place is full of people.

I ordered so many things, because i was in love with their concept, i had my dinner like they normally do, floor sitting. An impressive experience. The MoMos were the Best."]

Name: Mangiarbene da Giancarlo
Summary: Italian favorites like pasta, pizza & salads turned out in a cool, informal setup with edgy murals.
Address: Platz vor dem Neuen Tor 5, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 6:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Easy going place, perfect during the day. Giancarlo is a great man, great chef and great taste in music! Pasta or Pizza are best in the house. It is also a nice place to book for parties or just to hang for a beer. Bravo!', 'We had an excellent lunch here, the design inside is really appealing for any rock fan.🙂 Friendly staff, tasty food and cool design. Can only recommend.😊', "I've been there with my family some months ago and it was very tasty, good price and really friendly crew."]

Name: Porta-Nova
Summary: Traditional Italian dishes in a bright, straightforward dining room or at outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['We had business lunch and both ordered fish. It was served with bread and salad. It was white type of fish 🐠 served with sage butter and with fresh vegetables and potatoes. It was good and tasty. The service was quick and efficient. We also had cappuccino to end our lunch. It was very good, too! All in all, very nice dining experience. Thanks!', 'The most RACIST experience I've ever had to endure as an Asian student. They thought I couldn't speak German, and calls me "Chinesisch = Chinese" on the way to serve me food. Thinking I may have misheard, I call the waiter and ask him what that means. He says he doesn't know, until I say I heard him call me that. And he says, "I don't know your name though, that's why." Then keeps me waiting for over an hour until I have to stand up and wave my hand for the check.
Horrible, outrageous, education at its poorest. I gave him 3 bucks as a tip, and I told him its for his knowledge & politeness.
Don't go to this place.
I ate here on the 31st of August, 2024. From around 8:30 to (while waiting) 10:10.', 'Excellent homemade food, for a very reasonable price. Only shame is that the waiter automatically assumed the change was his tip and never came back with it.  But then again, the food was worth it.']

Name: REINHARD BÄR restaurant und café
Summary: Breakfast, desserts & international dishes served in a relaxed, airy destination.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Waiter was very rude. Unwelcoming atmosphere, especially if you’re learning German. Looks like an airport lounge.', 'Was there for lunch on a rainy Tuesday afternoon.
Very warm and welcoming service. Nice cocktails and lovely decor.
I had the gnocchi, it was fried I think? A little strange for me, but I finished it anyways!

I would recommend this place for cocktails and nice place for chitchat if you are in the area.', "I had a great time! The place was awesome, the food was so good, and the staff were super friendly. If you're looking for a cool spot with delicious food and a welcoming vibe, this is the place to go!"]

Name: Wildes Fräulein
Summary: Airy destination with a contemporary vibe & a terrace offering a menu of rustic mountain cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Reviews:
['Maybe you think I overrated this place.   In hindsight the restaurant deserves my 5-star rating.  We arrived hungry and wanted German food, and voila! Here it is right next to our hotel.   German restaurants are not that easy to find in Berlin these days.', 'Nice place to grab a bite to eat. We stopped here for lunch while dropping off our daughter at the train station. I had the salami sandwich with radishes. It was good and it hit the spot. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. Everything arrived timely and was fresh. The view was also very enjoyable. We sat outside since weather was very nice. If you haven’t been here then go. If you have, then go back. We know we will.', 'We stopped here by chance as it is located close to the railway station.
The menu is limited; mostly German meals are offered. Overpriced.
I ate pesto spätzle ( type of pasta), 14 euro from daily menu. Overcooked spätzle, industrial pesto ( supermarket quality). Big portion, boring taste, overpriced.
We ordered a piece of sausage with an egg on top: too simple.
Inattentive service.
Overpriced.
Plus: close to the station; tables outside.
I cannot recommend. There is a better place in the neighbourhood.']

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Subway in Hauptbahnhof Berlin

Today my daughter wanted to have a sandwich in Subway because it happens that we were in the Hauptbahnhof Berlin.  As we entered the place the personal were playing football and a boy hit my body by accident.
It is a very bad experience', "Do not recommend. Don't go there.

Rude staff, not considerate at all. Seem to be stressed. Listen to aggressive music dring service.
There were a few guests, so staff tried to hurry everyone. They even told me to move on to the next station, even though there was no space.
In addition they pulled the sandwich out of the oven after a view seconds. -> sandwich was cold and cheese not melted. (Unfortunately I only realised after I already left).
Standardized subway food helps keep a minimum quality.", 'I recently had one of the worst experiences at a Subway restaurant, which I feel compelled to share. On the morning of August 16th, I visited the branch at main train station in Berlin, and unfortunately, it did not meet the usual standards I’ve come to expect from Subway.
First and foremost, the staff members seemed unfriendly and appeared to be exhausted, which negatively affected the overall atmosphere of the place. Customer service is an essential part of any dining experience, and I felt that this location was lacking in that regard.
Additionally, the quality of my sandwich was far from satisfactory. The bread and salami were nearly burnt, giving my meal an unappealing flavor. As a result, the sandwich turned out to be excessively dry, making it almost inedible by the end. I found it quite disappointing, especially since I usually enjoy my meals at Subway.']

Name: Sasaya
Summary: Japanese restaurant with a sushi chef preparing maki, nigiris & rolls in front of onlooking diners.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Our experience at Sasaya was delightful overall. The sushi was exceptional, and we were impressed by the variety of good and authentic Japanese dishes offered at reasonable prices. However, we found the interior could use some improvement to enhance the dining atmosphere. Additionally, the booking process, which involved stopping by the place a week before, could be more convenient with online options. Despite these minor drawbacks, Sasaya is definitely worth a visit for its delicious Japanese cuisine.', 'I usually love everything I eat here.  But today, traditional sushi plate was just okay.  Toro was great.  The squid skewers was also just alright.
Spinach salad was good.  The buckwheat soup with shrimp tempura was nice.  The nato an interesting flavour to try. And the the fermented squid was also nice. :)

My usual is the plate for two with the chefs recommendation which is normally amazing. The gemaincha is a true delight.

Service always really sweet.  All those women are incredible.   Atmosphere also warm, simple and straightforward.

I obviously don’t have all the pictures.   But here are some.

Love this place on the whole.', 'I loved this place. Delicious food, fair prices and lovely service (so peaceful 🥰). A glass of tea is offered upon arrival. Booking is necessary as the restaurant gets crowded rapidly and is visited by many regulars. Credit card accepted.']

Name: Prater Beer Garden
Summary: Seasonal, self-service beer garden with 600 seats under chestnut trees, for locally brewed beers.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['My first beer garden experience, and it was everything I could have hoped for! So much seating, lively atmosphere, and 1L pints of beer. Food was good. Would like to spend more time here.

At my time of visit: when ordering beer you have to stand in one line, food in another. You have to pay a few € extra as a deposit and they give you a token, and when you return the glass and token you’ll get your deposit back (another line for returns).', 'Prater Beer Garden in Berlin is an exceptional spot for enjoying a lively and vibrant atmosphere. The crowd, full of energy and enthusiasm, adds to the enjoyable experience.
The beer garden offers a fantastic selection of food and beer, all of which are delicious and satisfying. With tables occupied well into midnight, it’s clear that this is a popular destination.
Whether you’re planning a team party or a casual meet-up, Prater Beer Garden provides the perfect setting for a memorable time. Highly recommended for its great ambience and delightful offerings!', 'I love a good beer garden on a sunny summer day and this place ticked all the right boxes. It has cold beer, warm food and a laid-back atmosphere: an ideal place to sit and chat.']

Name: Meena Kumari
Summary: Warm Indian restaurant & bar with modern decor, wooden flooring & a photo of the eponymous actress.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["It's one of the best indian restaurants in Berlin, I would say. They serve authentic mutton and chicken dishes with real indian Spiciness. Definitely recommended!!!!\nI ordered mutton rogan josh and garlic naan(it had lots of garlic 😍), It completely satisfied my taste buds! The staff was so polite during the service.", '*Cash Only*! A great experience! The mutton bhindi was particularly delicious, while another mild dish we got was good but unremarkable. Excellent atmosphere and good service. We were almost caught out without enough cash on hand as we didn’t realize in advance, would love for a heads-up next time.', 'Have great experience with Meena Kumari food and service is outstanding 👌 I honestly recommend it']

Name: Wohnzimmerbar
Summary: Light bites, coffee & cocktails in a stylish bar with retro armchairs & mismatched furniture.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 2:30 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 2:30 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 2:30 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 2:30 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 2:30 AM
Reviews:
['I love hanging out at my favorite bar in Berlin! There’s always plenty of seats, so you never have to worry about finding a spot. The interior is stunning, with a mix of styles that make it feel both cozy and chic.

One of the best parts is the variety of vibes and seating options. Whether you want a quiet corner to relax or a lively spot to chat with friends, they’ve got it covered. Plus, there are lots of charging stations, which is super handy.

The music is always amazing

All in all, it’s a fantastic place to chill, chat, and enjoy great drinks. Highly recommend!', 'Vibrant bar with amazing interior, service and music. Positive atmosphere and attitude that you get infected with after stepping in. Amazing coffee and vines. Can only recommend❤️☕️🍷', 'Vibes💯. Decent espresso Martini, you could improve it by putting a little black pepper on top🍸. Drinks took a long time to get, but the staff is nice. I love the furniture inside, it truly does give this place an old school living room vibe. Outside the red light at night creates a unique atmosphere. It was super full on a weekend night when we came and I understand why.']

Name: Trattoria Felice
Summary: Truffle pasta, thin-crust pizza & stone-grilled meat & fish at a cozy venue with terrace tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["Overpriced food. Small portion. Pasta was too salty while the vegetables for the other course were not seasoned at all. You can literally taste the 'original flavour' of the carrot and the beans. The pan fried beef, on the other hand, was overcooked and tasted like rubber.  For some unknown reasons, everything tastes a little bitter.", 'Had a beautiful dinner here with a lovely wine suggested.  The pasta was perfectly cooked, the mushrooms succulent and gorgeous!  Cozy, romantic ambience.', 'Pretty good! Both dishes we ordered were very good but not exceptional. The espresso and Tiramisu were fantastic as well. I would come again for dinner and try the pizza and pasta to get a full picture but overall it’s quite good. Prices though are a bit high for the offering. Nice vibes and good service too.']

Name: Les Valseuses Restaurant
Summary: Classic French bistro cooking & wines offered in relaxed quarters with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["I always come here with my French friends when we want a good meal, good wine, and a catch-up. The quality of food is incredible, the staff are friendly, and we always have an amazing night.
It's a small menu, but perfectly cooked.
The fries are the best in Berlin", 'Gorgeous little place. The food was amazing and the server was very sweet (and hilarious). I will definitely be returning! I can especially recommended the chicken with romesco and asparagus and the steak tatare.', 'A bit biased about my experience: loved the starters, the duck and the meat but didn’t like french fries a homemade mayo as much. Nice vibrant atmosphere and good service in general.

Noise level was way above average, we could hardly have a conversation and it felt like you’re surrounded by a cloud of voices coming from neighbor tables. This was the first time I ever had a problem with it since I’m not very sensitive. Might come back and just pick a table in the front room next time']

Name: Juki
Summary: Korean BBQ with meats grilled at the table, plus rice dishes & soju in a relaxed setting.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['I ordered Mandu, Samgyoebsal, Kimchi jigae, and Bibimbab. They are so good and taste the same as in Seoul! 😍 I highly recommend Sangyoebsal and Bibimbab. The staff is also very kind and high standard of hospitality. This would be my first favorite Korean restaurant in Berlin. Don’t forget to order some Soju or Makgeolli to stay in the vibe.', "Just ordered to go from here. And now what? I opened my food and smelled like it had gone. I tasted it and realized this food was gone. It may not be popular for selling but you should take care of your food quality. And they don't accept card payments under 50 euros.", 'Visited this Korean BBQ Restaurant and had an amazing experience! The staff was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting.\n\nThe meat was fresh and flavorful, and the DIY grilling at the table added to the fun. They had a great variety of sides and sauces to complement the meats. Would recommend.']

Name: FRANNZ Club
Summary: Buzzing club venue with a bar menu & expansive beer garden, hosting concerts & trivia nights.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 – 6:00 AM, 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 AM, 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["We attended the Ghostly Kisses concert and thoroughly enjoyed the club's ambiance. It’s Really cozy.", 'Great beer and vibe! Service was pretty good and we enjoyed the music playing from a live performer for a birthday party. The food looked great and looking forward to trying some of it also. But we were all happy with the beer offered and the overall experience of the place. It can be crowded so potentially book a place ahead.', 'I went to a rock party on the 29 of June 2024. I left this club after 5 minutes, though I  paid 10 euros. There was almost no people, was very hot, the ventilation worked bad or didn’t work…I like to visit new places, but I will never come back. Not recommended.']

Name: Zum Schusterjungen
Summary: Homestyle German classics like pork knuckle & schnitzel, plus beer, in an old-fashioned venue.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['This was one of the best lunches I had in Berlin. I had the schnitzel with creamy mushroom and potatoes with bacon bits + beer on a summer afternoon in Berlin. Their terrace is great, it was so calm and chill to watch the intersection & enjoy a very yummy meal. The food was honestly simply perfect. Service was great, the server was polite, efficient and nice.

Restaurant is cash only like many others - not that big of a deal, just come prepared.', 'Genuine German kitchen, served by super-friendly staff. The authentic, traditional taste speaks for itself, while the prices are still quite reasonable. Portions are large enough for likely anyone.

Note the place is sadly cash-only. The nearest ATM charges some absurdly high commission, so you might want to visit one of those located at Sparkasse branch near Eberswalder Str. station first.', 'Nice Eckkneipe offering a delightful selection of classic, old-fashioned dishes. The ambiance is undeniably relaxed, evoking a nostalgic charm. The staff is both knowledgeable and welcoming, enhancing the overall experience. The Buletten and Schnitzel were particularly impressive. With a spacious dining room and a cozy corner for drinks and snacks, this Eckkneipe is a must-visit for anyone seeking an authentic taste of old Berlin.']

Name: ZAZA Diner & Drinks
Summary: Sleek bar with an extensive menu of cocktails, plus Asian nibbles like sushi & dim sum.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Great Sushi Bar! Good location next to a tram and a subway stations. There are a lot of tables, low and high - plenty of room. The variety of drinks is huge, aswell as the food choices, which are plenty. Some sushi sorts are pretty exotic and may seem as not very authentic. Still, they all taste great!\nHave been there for a private event with ~100 people.', 'Amazing cocktails and a lovely staff! Happy hour from 6pm till 8pm. The food gets to the table fast and is delicious! We loved it. Definitely coming back.', 'Small bar, with a lot of choice of drinks and nice vibe\nKiss']

Name: Restaurant Lorbeer
Summary: Elevated German food & a big array of beers at a stylish, convivial brewery with a sidewalk terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Although we found the portions a bit on the smaller side, the flavour was phenomenal!
Absolutely delicious schnitzel and gnocchi.
The beetroot gnocchi was filled with a cream cheese, something I would definitely go back for.

Service is so friendly and nice, we were really happy with that too.

I would consider this one of the best veal schnitzels in berlin.', 'The food was amazing, I had the Schnitzel and it’s absolutely one of the best I‘ve tried.
The service was super friendly and they speak English too.
the restaurant was very clean, something that’s important for me.
I would absolutely recommend the place.', "Asparagus was good. The eistees were quite strong in flavour. I liked it but some might feel it's too strong. Staff was friendly and spoke English as well."]

Name: Zaika
