Summary: An extensive menu of tandooris, biryanis & curries at a low-key, colorfully decorated venue.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Great food, great staff and a great atmosphere to watch the European Championship 2024.', 'Visited specifically for their special Sunday menu. Tried out the mutton haleem and nihari. Amazing food with an authentic spicy flavour. Would definitely recommend along with namkeen lassi (chhaas).', 'The food was really nice and delicious. Specially the lam seekh kebab which was very well marinated and done and couldn’t be better. Definitely should be tried if you eat meat.']

Name: Thüringer Stuben
Summary: Beef goulash, apple strudel & Thuringian beers at a traditional tavern with bench seats outside.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["I had a great German meal here. Pumpkin soup was great, cucumber salad was great. Sausage with potato was very full portion and great taste. The pasta dish wasn't amazing. Dog friendly also indoors.", 'Very good, traditional food. We tried the Eastern special dishes: lamb, rabbit, goose. Everything was perfect. Here you can have real German quality beer. Around all this good stuff to eat and drink, a nice and cozy atmosphere is built to make you feel a bit less in Berlin and a bit more in the heart of Germany.', "The staff it's so nice and the food incredible good and typical. If you want some of the best local stuff this place is higly recocmend\nWine and beer stunning as well"]

Name: Frau Mittenmang
Summary: Charming, dark restaurant with a terrace presenting imaginative global dishes & desserts, plus wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Some of the best fine dining in Berlin.  Amazing bread as a starter and great staff. You have to get their attention as they are attending everyone, and it gets packed so make a reservation.', 'Food was amazing, and the wine selection perfection. Service a bit slow. Dress warm to sit outside... Cold when the sun goes down. Worth the effort to get there.', 'Creative and high quality food. Nice relaxed atmosphere. A bit on the pricy side but worth it.']

Name: Blackbeards
Summary: Pastrami sandwiches, Philly cheesesteaks & spare ribs at a hip BBQ joint with bench seats outside.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Solid BBQ spot where the food definitely hits. Brisket was tender, the beans tasted great and the pulled pork poppers were very flavourful too. Do think the portions are a little on the small side given the limited amount of sides you get, but overall honestly had a good experience!', 'Nice services. Very dark inside.\nChicken Wings were delicious, the ribs were tasty but a bit hard and dry for the end pieces. Suggest eat it when it still warm, when it cold, only taste full mouths fat and grease.', 'Everything was perfect. We had smoked beef and spareribs if I’m not mistaken. Sides were good, the service was 10/10. I would highly recommend it.']

Name: Pasta & Vino
Summary: Warm, relaxed neighborhood restaurant providing classic Italian dishes, wine & terrace seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Amazing Pasta and super friendly and competent staff.', 'The best. Incredible bruschetta, pasta is out of this world, service is fantastic and great wine. The risotto with Steinpilz mushrooms AND truffles is insane. Every bite a treat to be savored.', 'Tucked into a neighborhood, this little restaurant offers delicious antipasti and pasta dishes.

We had an arugula salad with peaches, pine nuts and parmigiana.

A warm salad of baby octopus, olives, tomatoes and garlic.

Gorgonzola Noichi with walnuts and pears.

The Noichi was excellent, the texture of eating scallops.

I like that the menu offers a more diverse pairing of flavorful sauces for the pasta that features, sweet, savory and texture.

Nice atmosphere with outdoor seating.']

Name: CHAY UMI VEGAN
Summary: Plant-based Pan-Asian specialties are offered in this easygoing, brick-lined restaurant.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['This was one of my favorite meals in Berlin. We literally were walking right by and stopped in.

My friend and I shared a few items together.

The bao bun was amazing. And we also shared one of the assorted plates which was perfect for the two of us. The crunchy roll was absolutely to die for. And the eggplant was good.

We both ordered one of their teas/sodas which was totally refreshing and delicious.

I highly recommend you come here for a meal so good and did not disappoint.', "This place is a gem. The food is exquisite, the drink was amazing and the dog that lived under one of the tables just made me even happier to be there. The vegan crispy duck taste so much like meat it was crazy. If you don't like imitation meat I might steer clear of that. My only regret is that I got so full that I had no chance to get dessert.", 'Amazing vegan food, great tastes, we love it so much!
The crispy duck is very recommended!']

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM
Reviews:
["Once upon a time, I would get Subway for lunch once a week. Then the pandemic hit.
Recently I purchased one sandwich at this location. The dailies were well priced but I was intrigued by a special with no listed price. While I could choose the bread, I was not allowed to make any other changes like cheese or salad toppings. I thought that was the entire point of Subway but like a Boomer I find myself out of touch with the harsh realities of the modern world.
The staff did not really speak German. There were doing the best they could with the tools given to them. The price was a surprise at over €13 for only the one sandwich.

I have such strong memories of Subway. The first time one opened in my hometown, first job for some friends, dozens of business lunches. It's all gone now. Lost fondly to time. I loved Subway and my experience at this establishment has estranged me from visiting another in the foreseeable future. The sandwich was pretty good though!", 'I ordered from this restaurant today on Uber Eats. When the food didn’t arrive I tried the number in the app which was out of service and the number linked here which was switched off. When I went to the restaurant there was no apology, the employee simply told me he was never going to make it because it was incorrectly set up as the restaurant delivering themselves (obviously not my fault). He had made no effort to cancel the order, nor inform Uber Eats nor me, he was happy for me to just sit waiting for it at home. Rather than accepting any responsibility, he told me to “order on lieferando next time, it works there”. Horrific service from a very rude employee.', 'Absolutely shocking rudeness from a woman server who would not disclose her name. Had streaks in her hair and a nose piercing. When I asked for an amendment, she was rude and threw the food down very unprofessionally. I then addressed the action and she said that she does not have to smile to please the customers (valid point, but don’t take your anger out on me). Sub in itself was very basic and there very little on the sandwich. First bite was literally just bread.']

Name: Zur letzten Instanz
Summary: 2-floor bar/restaurant, dating from 1621, with wood paneling & tiles, German cuisine & beer garden.
Reviews:
['A very local old restaurant, the food is highly recommended. We had the best ever pork knuckle here. Very busy and all full, only one waitress we waited about long until our food was served. It was worth waiting.', 'One of the oldest restaurants in Berlin, but the food is definitely modern, balanced, and delicious. The service was on point. Beers from the tap were refreshing. First time I had SpreeWasser - beer with lemonade!

The pickled vegetables, stuffed cabbage, meatballs, and pork knuckle were all a big hit!

Recommended.', "It was OK, I wouldn't go back though unfortunately. It's one of those places you try once.
White Asparagus were good and the white Asparagus soup was also good, wished it had less salt.
Meatballs my boyfriend had had too much salt and it was disappointing.
Apple strudel wasn't apple strudel, it was more a Danish, they probably forgot about it in the oven because the edges of my Danish was bitter caramel."]

Name: The Brooklyn
Summary: Classy American steakhouse with beef sourced from the U.S., plus a cozy dining room & outdoor seats.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Fabulous meat. Perfectly cooked. Great sides, good portions. The service could be leveled up a little bit, however, they were\nvery lovely and when the waitress wasn’t sure of what wine to recommend she quickly got someone to assist in recommending a delicious wine to a decent price. It was our last night in Berlin, super happy! If I had to give one improvement it would be to get better outdoor seats for summer and for the staff to describe better size portions and concept.', 'The best steakhouse restaurant in Berlin! We tried the beef fillet black Angus, the NY strip loin and the Ribeye! All of them were very tasty! The first one was very juicy, the second one had an excellent balance of flavour and tenderness and the third one had a really we special smoked flavour! We also choose the Barbecue sauce and the Pepper Sauce! The second one was an excellent choice for our steaks ! The salad with spinach and arancini was also very tasty! The service was very helpful and attentive! The atmosphere was very nice! I totally recommend it!', "We had an amazing dinner at The Brooklyn. The service was very neat. I came here for my boyfriend's birthday and they served the dessert with a cute candle. The food was amazing of course. Thank you so much for everything to have a wonderful night 💛\nWe will definitely come back."]

Name: Ännchen von Tharau
Summary: Classic German dishes & seasonal specials in a relaxed dining room or on a riverfront terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Reviews:
['I had a cappuccino and apple cake here, both tasted bad.
However, the service was nice.', 'There is nothing special about the kalbsschnitzel pfiff for 23.90. The mushrooms are not flavorful and salty.

Black Kostritzer beer is good.
Personally, I would not return to eat there.', 'No English menu and not everyone who works there speaks English. The food and service were both good. Nice outdoor seating and good coffee.']

Name: Marinehaus - Restaurant und Kneipe
Summary: Pickled herring, fried fish & schnitzel at a rustic, maritime-themed tavern facing the Spree River.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['The restaurant is located in a nice area near the river - my partner and I, along with a group of friends visited the restaurant in June, and since the weather was nice, we could enjoy the outside area.\nThe menu includes both fish and meat, and we went for a entrecôte with potatoes and a schnitzel which came with tzatziki and an egg on top (typical of the restaurant). The dishes were good, without being exceptional, according to our personal taste.\nThe service was very nice, and our water was super available with us, which made our experience pleasant.', 'Excellent restaurant in Berlin. It is located near the river, and has good views. The atmosphere is very welcoming. Most of the clients are local. The food is fresh and extremely tasty. The staff is nice and friendly. We stayed in Berlin for 3 days only but went twice to Marinenhaus due to the food and the atmosphere. The place is highly recommended!', 'Our first meal in Berlin and it didn’t disappoint. Great atmosphere, friendly staff who will do their best to communicate in both German and English. The service was exceptionally speedy compared to what I’m used to in most non- US countries. The food was a big portion and SO good. They even gave us a complimentary schnapps and espresso (partner doesn’t drink), on our way out. Paid with a card and was given the option to tip (but felt no pressure), which as an American was appreciated because it took the awkwardness out of “should we tip or not”. Would definitely recommend!']

Name: Republic Berlin
Summary: Relaxed beer garden fixing up local & global eats such as paella, pasta & burgers, plus craft beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ["Alot of self service which is all right but they should teach their staff to remove the stem-thingy of the tomato before serving it with the mozzarella. That's my only complaint, however they'd be so much better if they did that.", 'Nice cozy place with the huge bus haha. Food was really tasty and not crazy expensive!', 'What an unexpected hidden find .. a biergarden with a modern twist.. unexpected chill and ohhh food is great too! These cheesy German noodles to dry beef goulash and to wait for meatballs… besides the booze .. highly recommend!']

Name: Gittis Bier-Bar
Summary: Cozy, wood-paneled neighborhood tavern with classic decor, serving up draft German beers.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Looking for an old fashioned bar and found it here. Good quality beer at cheap prices with an  authentic feel to the place. Friendly barman and good atmosphere.', 'This bar is ace!! It is definitely one on its own! The first night we went in and tried to sit down at a table, some regulars looked at us and shook their heads in silence, to indicate we couldn’t sit there!! Hilarious!!!! We went in on a further three or four occasions with friends who had joined us  and they loved it too. Really authentic pub where people still smoke happily away- the beer is good and the licensee is a good sport though the interactions are on his terms!! Definitely worth a visit', 'Regular German pub. If you speak no to little German, stay away. Kit Kat club is near but this is on a completely different universe.']

Name: Zum Paddenwirt
Summary: Robust, homestyle meals served in a wood-paneled dining room or a large beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Located in a really nice area. If we did not find this restaurant we would not be able to explore the area surrounding the St Nicholas church.

Food was great and in big portions (normal Germany portion) and the service was good, efficient and fast.

We sat outside due to the stroller and since it is a garden, there were bees and flies wanting to taste our food constantly. Not the restaurants fault but next time I aim to sit inside.', 'Good traditional and no-fuss German restaurant combining a selection of Berlin specialties with other regional dishes, including from the South. Very nice beer garden in summer months overlooking the quiet and charming Nikolaiviertel in central Berlin. Service is friendly, rapid, and efficient. Portions are on the large side and prices are totally fair considering the area and the food quality.', "Best German food that I've had in Berlin! Comfortable and friendly atmosphere, kind staff, and delicious food."]

Name: UMAMI Sushi
Summary: Compact, informal stop for familiar Japanese dishes like sushi, teriyaki & udon, plus imported beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 2:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 2:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Excellent lunch! No nonsense and to the point restaurant. Tempura from big shrimps was super and our order of sashimi ( tuna and salmon), was combined in a beautifull plate. Rich portions with excellent price -quality. Taste authentic and mouth watering fresh big slices of sashimi', 'It’s so great I would love to gatekeep that place but it s unfair for his owner. Never ate sushis like that in Paris.', 'The Perfect sushi! Fresh, creative, delicious. The best we had in Berlin for sure!']

Name: Restaurant Z
Summary: Eatery with exposed brickwork & stripped wood flooring serving Mediterranean fare with Greek wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['A very nice restaurant. Real greek food, not expensive and very friendly personel geving a personal touch to the experience. Recommended!', 'I spent a nice time here with three friends.  Good starters, very good main courses, professional service, very nice.  the only drawback is the coffee that nobody liked and I drank coffee from all over the world, but this one did not taste good to me.', "Great restaurant, waiters very helpful but without bothering you too much. Proper Greek food. Probably the nicest calamari I ever had( didn't have better in actual Greece). Highly recommended for anyone looking for some Mediterranean cuisine in Berlin."]

Name: Restaurant Austria Das Original
Summary: Classic Austrian dishes in a long-running, wood-paneled tavern with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Can’t say about other dishes but the Wiener schnitzel with asparagus (seasonal menu) was delicious, and so was the red wine they suggest pairing with it!
We got recommended by friends as “the place” to try wiener schnitzel in Berlin and it didn’t disappoint…
Portions are also HUGE, even when you order the “small size”.', 'My favorite Austrian restaurant in Berlin. An institution in the Bergmannkiez. This place has been around forever. I love to sit outside in summer as well as inside in Winter. Very cosy , wooden atmosphere.

Service is good and the portions huge. I think I always go for the traditional Wiener Schnitzel. But I always get a different appetizer. I was never disappointed. Prices are ok too.', "Simple and very good. You should know what you get there for, not a huge selection, but you don't need more than that. We tried the original Wiener Schnitzel which was excellent, top-notch. And the prices are fair. Solid choice if you have been fed up with all the vegan-fusion-new age Berlin restaurants and you want something simple but excellent at the same time. Well done"]

Name: Pagode Thai Kitchen
Summary: Classic Thai curries, soups & rice dishes, served in an unfussy dining room with a giant fish tank.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['It was okay. But not really authentic in my opinion. I don’t get the hype. It’s like every other fast asian kitchen place. Self service. If you’re looking for a cheap meal and be satisfied then it’s the right place. Other than that it’s mediocre. There are much better places in Berlin to eat Thai food.', 'How does this have five stars! This is the most expensive and worst Thai food I ever ate. I ordered with Garnelen and it came with tofu. The pad Thai was just noodles in ketchup sauce and cost €17!! Avoid this place at all costs', 'I was used to order from this restaurant on Uber Eats and planning to visit in person. What a wonderful place, the food is even better on-site. It will be a regular spot for me from now on!']

Name: Sarod's
Summary: Classic Thai curries, noodle dishes & spicy soups at a contemporary venue with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Very small portions, but good location and nice environment inside. You can try a lot of Vietnamese dishes, and they have a nice vegan menu. But I think it’s not amazing, but normal if you want eat something quick. But if you want alternative with more taste any more delicious food, try to find out anything else)))', 'Hands down for the most authentic Thai restaurant in town…. I am asian and I approve the spices here, it’s proper. There is heat in some of the dish but it is the nice kind of heat…been coming back 2 times in a week. We love it here. Service is pleasant and atmosphere is nice, good for dates. Recommend!', 'I had a really yummy Lab Ped here, my partner asked if she could have it with Tofu which they were happy to do. The Coconut Dream drink was great too. The staff were friendly with us and especially with our small infant human.\nChild seat available! Wooo']

Name: Mokkabar
Summary: Brunch, coffee & specialties like stone-oven pizza & tarte flambée in a bright cafe with a patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Perfect staff, delicious food, cozy atmosphere. Only thing is that their portions are too big. ( but fair price )', 'Our food took an hour to come out because the waitress sent the order in 20 minutes after we already ordered and the were very neglectful of my boyfriend and I even after they forgot to send in our order. The food was okay but they even forgot some parts after all that. Did not feel welcomed there, maybe because we are tourists.', 'More beautiful inside than outside. It does have a terrace, that is, tables on the sidewalk. But Gneisenaustrasse is a busy street, even though quite green. The food was ok, coffee was ok, service was quick, prices were fine.']

Name: Felix Austria
Summary: Schnitzels, goulash & other Austrian classics at a laid-back setup with wooden seating & a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Foods were alright. Schnitzel was good but the beef in goulash was too hard and too dry to eat. We sat outside for almost 15 minutes without service and had to come inside and ask to be served. Price was expensive but justified by the large portion.', 'An absolutely lovely meal! We enjoyed all of our food and basically licked our plates clean. The Spätzle was outstanding. We also really enjoyed the Gurkensalat and schnitzel. Don’t miss dessert!! Can’t wait to come back', 'Foods were excellent, we ordered veal and goulash, they were great but they forgot to dessert after making us wait for 40 min and when we asked the waitress with the glasses , she sounded very condescending. Well , food were great but service was rather mediocre.']

Name: Pastarium
Summary: Italian restaurant dishing up pasta, pizzas & salad amid an easygoing atmosphere.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['We came here as a lunch at around 4pm. Of course the restaurant was half empty which suited us.\nThe pasta is really tasty, al dente and eye catching. I had the ragout (spaghetti bolognese)', 'The pizza dough was ok, but all that boiled garlic on a marinara is unacceptable. The mixed starter was sad. The carpaccio was frozen, the vitello tonnato very old.', 'Pasta al dente very good! Tried the truffle asparagus and it was very good. My friends also ordered other type of pasta and it was delicious as well. The female waiter was very nice but the male one was not that nice and didn’t make an effort to try to communicate with us. Also tried the red wine and it was good. The espresso was not that good but at the end we are in Germany, cannot expect amazing coffee.']

Name: La Piccola
Summary: Laid-back cafe with a patio offering pizza, Italian pasta & meat dishes & Middle Eastern bites.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Friday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['An impulsive pizza craving brought us here. The staf was so friendly to help us close to midnight. Now we are enjoying a pizza and focaccia.

Next time we will bring cash, so they would be more happy with us.

Till next time', 'Very tasteful food, menu offers variety of dishes, portions are big and in good prices.', 'I’m based in Italy so an Italian restaurant in Berlin is a little bit atypical for me! However we went here because we were starving. The menu is brought into a lot of non-Italian dishes too. The service is good and the waiters are really friendly, they check up on you quite often to see everything is working out smoothly but the wait is a bit long. We ordered the garlic soup which was good. The bruschette were made with fresh tomatoes and sapory olive oil. The pasta was a bit over cooked (I like it al dente) but I think you can easily ask them to cook it to your favorite extent. Overall, it’s a good place for decent food and reasonable prices!']

Name: Zhong Hua
Summary: Old-fashioned choice with traditional decor serving Cantonese classics & Thai options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Went in randomly because it had average ratings. I ordered a soup and a salad which have nothing to do with any cooking skills or Chinese cuisine. The soup is literally an instant soup with noodles you cook in the microwave, and pieces of not fresh chicken. The salad was some sad German kraut. They give you forks to eat with 🥲', 'This place is fire. I live in the land of 50 Chinese restaurant in a 15 km radius. No joke. This food is really good. Nice change from the other food here. Brovo.', 'I really liked this restaurant. Everything was good. It looks like a typical authentic Chinese restaurant and has the decor of one as well. The food tastes really good and the serving is good as well. Prices are economical enough for Berlin. The owner (and I presume the server) is very kind and friendly. The whole place has the vibe of a family run restaurant and not of a profit minded restaurant that’s just there for milking money.']

Name: Cafe Journale
Summary: Pasta, pizza & other Italian fare in an easygoing spot with a cozy vibe, featuring outdoor seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Friday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
["Nice place and nice staff, unfortunately the pizza was not that impressive and reminded a bit of a frozen pizza you buy in a grocery store.

Of course frozen pizzas can taste good, which this one did, but we had expected a little more. but the price was good and the beer was very thirst-quenching on a hot day.

Can recommend going there for a beer but maybe not for the food if you're not hungry and happen to be standing outside. this of course only applies to the pizza. no idea about the rest of the food", 'This restaurant deserves more guests than it has. It looked a bit empty when I came, regardless of the convenient location. But the food turned out to be really good. The atmosphere is also cozy, and the staff were very attentive. They even offered free wine shots after meal. The price is reasonable too. Overall good quality & service. I rarely write reviews but I do think this restaurant should have more people coming. I’ll definitely come back :)', 'beautiful little bar/restaurant. serves a great deal of german beer and others, good wine!
food is great! a nice amount of gluten free and vegetarian option. presentation of the food is lovely, and the service is amazing!! great menu and a casual, easy atmosphere.
don’t let the area deceive you!']

Name: Nobel Restaurant
Summary: Basic eatery offering burgers, pizza, pasta, salads & more, plus an expansive outdoor seating area.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["Good experience. Very nice pasta with a fair price.\n\nNeed to improve on a few things like the clutery cleaning. Both forks we took at first were completely dirty. The toilet is available to the public but it's also a place where some things are stored.", 'Very yummy dishes in fair price. Friendly staff. Kind of self-serving. Good for quick meal.', 'Very delicious food, good service, nice personnel and surprisingly cheap. Only the toilets are a bit uncomfortable but everything else is great! I absolutely recommend!']

Name: Café Dix in der Berlinischen Galerie in Kreuzberg
Summary: Globally inspired bites offered in a bright, modern space within an art museum with outdoor seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ["Nice, not great café but definitely decent. The soup was delicious, and nicely served with a drizzle of olive oil and herbs, I just wish they would've told me about the sour cream as I would've asked without it due to my milk intolerance. There was also no other gluten free food at all, just the soup, not even a brownie. The waitress did her best to be nice but also seemed very stressed, probably not her fault but more that it was probably understaffed.", 'Our pasta was really tasty (liked the spicy touch). The coffee and cake was also good. Service was friendly but a bit slow, probably because they are understaffed...\nWe definitely can recommend this place for a little lunch/ coffee break 👍☕🍝', 'Terrible sunday morning experience. Thet staff here is completely ignorant and arrogant. On a dark winter day I turned on the little table light and the waiter to turn it off again with a very bossy and unfriendly tone.\nFoodwise: the new york cheese cake was extremely small for its high price. The coffee was totally average. Never again.']

Name: KUMPIR CLUB fresh food & coffee
Summary: Relaxed, cool cafe featuring meals & snacks with local ingredients, plus coffee, smoothies & juices.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Tasty meals for lower price.
Many local people eat here.

The service was quick, and the staff were nice.
The food was tasty and fresh.', 'Amazing food and with a good portion size for 1 person ❤️', "Oh my goodness, YES!
This was the first place we tried in Berlin! Despite the beautiful door, you might know what to expect from outside.
Don't let that turn you off, we tried two baked potato salads and they were both terrific!!

And it fills you well to survive the day. We will definitely come back for more!

Edit: This is definitely our new lunch place! Once you've tried it once, you want to come back!"]

Name: Café Bakery Bonjour
Summary: Down-to-earth pit stop serving breakfast, sandwiches & pastries, plus classic brews.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 4:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 4:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 3:00 PM
Reviews:
['Had a delicious breakfast from here.
They open early in the morning, i get in around 6.30 am and had the big cappuccino, it was prepared very hot and was nice to sip in that cold windy morning.
Crispy Spicy chicken sandwich tasted really good too.

Ambience is clean & very nice , staffs are friendly and attentive', 'Pleasant locals cafe in a central area of Berlin. The price is good for the quality. Staff is friendly and spoke good English. The food was tasty and the toilets clean. There were tables outside by the sun. It has several options of sandwiches and healthy things. Not many options of meat. You also help yourself bring food from the counter to the table.', 'Breakfast was good: 3 eggs, orange slices, tomato, and cucumber slices. Comes with 2 breads. We also ordered the pretzel and another sweet pastry. Well made Chai latte with Tiger Spice flavour. Not expensive, fast service, so what else can you ask for in the morning.']

Name: Berlinburger International
Summary: Compact, hip burger bar with exposed brickwork & outdoor tables for home-made food & fresh toppings.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Great chicken burger. Great bun, juicy meet. Very good fries. Solid burger. Good deal 14.90 for 2 chicken burgers and fries. I will be back.', "This is the perfect spot to taste burgers with an overwhelming amount of ingredients that are impossible to keep track of! During my initial visits, the burgers were absolutely fantastic, and I would have rated them a solid 5 out of 5. However, on my most recent trip, the burger wasn't as excellent as before, for some unknown reason. Nevertheless, it was still a decent meal.", 'A nice small burger joint. The burgers are huge, and delicious. The meat is very well grilled, and atom of vegetables open the taste even more. Chili cheese burger has a ton of jalapeños, and it tastes great. BBQ burger and it’s smokey taste is also very good. Highly recommended!']

Name: Restaurant Hasenheide
Summary: Robust German food in an old-school tavern with arched ceilings, dark-wood accents & a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['The best Wiener schnitzel ever! Great sauce, fantastic potatoes served any way (mashed, roasted, fries, salad). The Kalbsleber (liver) was also delicious. Cocktails a plenty and service was awesome. Highly recommend this restaurant if in Berlin', 'I really appreciated the atmosphere at our table outside at this restaurant. However, besides that this was a poor experience.

Overall, the food seemed overpriced for what it was. We got a pasta which was pretty bland and a small portion size. Not worth the price. We also got a schnitzel from the kids menu and it was not bad for the price.

We also ordered a water for our table. When it came out I decided to check the menu and saw that it cost €6.50. As I looked at the bottle, I realized that there was no cap, the sticker was peeling off, and the glass the bottle water made out of was worn down, and scratched. As I tasted it again, it was evident that this was tap water that they put in a nice bottle. Very disappointing to discover the lack of integrity in this restaurant.

When this bill came out, we thought it looked like a little bit much even considering the expensive water. The staff had accidentally charged us for an espresso that someone else ordered. We only found this out because we requested the receipt that they otherwise would not have gave us. The only good part about the restaurant was the staff spoke English.

This was an unsatisfactory experience and I discourage people from going here.', "Superb food, traditionally German. Huge portion sizes, four of us had the pleasure of dining out here this evening. Wholeheartedly recommend the pork Schnitzel served with salad, roasted potatoes, salad and a fried egg. And the sharing platter starters were generous in size, fresh and tasty. And all this great food wasn't expensive! The terrace and inside tables were full of locals - which is always a great sign.
A wonderful dinner for our group. Than you so much!"]

Name: Café Bakery Süss
Summary: Informal stop for hot breakfast & lunch dishes, sandwiches, pastries, bread & coffee.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 4:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Reviews:
['I love wandering around Berlin with beers, my cameras, so simple street food & bakeries are a must for me. I got the crispy chicken sandwich & a cinnamon roll! They were on point!!! Enjoy a coffee & a delicious snack.', 'Stumbled in this place, looking for a nice coffee in the morning and was greeted with the warmest welcome by the waitress. We had the nicest mini breakfast!
It had a big variety of sweet and salty snacks for breakfast, a quick lunch or an afternoon treat. We immediately decided it would be the place to have breakfast in our trip.
The staff was helpful, available to make us comfortable, which created a good and happy environment.
We also got a few sandwiches for the day and they were absolutely delicious. I recommend the chicken with the spicy sauce. It was so goooood!!!
I think this is the place to start the day. I promise you will be well welcomed by the prettiest smiles of all time!
Thank you for the experience!', "Great place for a solid, abundant and tasty breakfast. We had combos number 7 and 8, and were thoroughly satisfied. The ingredients were high quality, and the service was quick and responsive. If you're looking for a real Neukölln place where locals get their first meal of the day, this is your spot. (The only thing that could be improved is the music. Party techno is not exactly the thing I'm looking for in breakfast. Something more calm would work much better.)"]

Name: Aldimashqi الدمشقي
Summary: Unpretentious eatery for Syrian mezes, plus grilled meats, doner kebabs & a huge range of juices.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['The food is great, but the service is not up to the task.
Ordering is chaotic and it took more than 30 min to get the dishes that we ordered while other customers that came after us got their food, finished it and left.
I had to complain twice to get my food.
I hope my feedback reaches you.
Your food is great just improve a bit on the service side.', 'Very delicious food i ordered 45 shish tawook and it was amazing , chicken breast cut into cubes and spiced and grilled. Basically melts in your mouth. I totally recommend this place.', 'Food was delicious and filled with amazing tastes and freshness. Also, price considering what we order was good we paid 29 euros for everything plus 2 soft drinks. I can definitely recommend the food in this place. Keep in mind you will probably leave this smelling like food though.']

Name: Hamy Cafe
Summary: Noodle & rice dishes of the day, specialty teas & shakes at a no-frills cafe with a deli counter.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['The food is really delicious, service was fast, not that friendly. Price to the value and quality you get is fantastic. Tables are shared with everyone, so you expect to sit with a stranger, but that’s lovely anyways.', "One of the crowded Vietnamese restaurants I have been to so far. Not fancy but authentic food. The menu is simple. Service is fast. Flavours are so good. Yummy and fresh. Prices are reasonable. Most of the dishes are below 10 euro. Serving is in a large bowl , quantity is very good for a person. It's a small place so it's not recommended if you wanna sit relax and have food.", 'A classic. Incredible quality price offer. It gets very crowded and it might take some time to get attended. The pho bo was very nice']

Name: Falafel Jakoub
Summary: Relaxed Middle Eastern restaurant serving up classic fare, including baba ghanoush & shawarma.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Amazing falafel and amazing dressing. The bread quality is very nice and Ahmed the chef is very nice and friendly. Highly recommended if you are in Berlin. I took one with Halloumi cheese and added extra hummus it was super delicious.', 'Best falafel in all of Berlin that I have ever had. Many menu options. All fairly priced. Very friendly staff. No alcoholic beverages. I highly recommend it.', 'Just happened upon this place and was drawn in by the 5,50€ price for a beef shawarma. We ordered two with garlic sauce and was really happy with the size and flavors but I did add a few dashes of olive oil and lemon since I love the combination. We got a can of Mezzo for 1.50€ (not bad for a restaurant) but the place us self-service. The bathrooms were okay, not super clean but I think a lot is just old. They don’t have paper towels for drying your hands, just an old air blower.

Flavorful food
Good prices
Self-service
Indoor and some outdoor seating
Cute ambiance

I look forward to eating there again and trying more dishes.

I l']

Name: Arethussa
Summary: Celebrity photos line the walls of this convivial spot featuring a terrace, Greek food & schnitzel.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ["Great Greek restaurant with plenty of options, including lots of veggie plates! I, of course, got a schnitzel and some mushroom sauce which was fantastic and my vegetarian date got the stuffed pepper. The service was very friendly and the atmosphere was about what you'd expect from the typical Greek restaurant. They were a bit swamped when we were there, so we were sat waiting for some time trying to flag them down. Other than that, a nice spot with healthy portions.", 'Really good Greek meat and food in general, in a nice informal place; special mention for the staff, very nice and friendly, also in offering Ouzo shot after dinner!\nRecommended!', 'Loved this place. Good selection of food, got a lovely bacon burger, meat very nice, and good value. Lovely staff, best of all a free shot of ouzo!']

Name: Asia Farmhouse
Summary: Dim sum, dumplings, soups & heaped noodle plates in a modern space with chipboard furniture.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Nice place with an interesting menu. Some combinations are quite strange like salmon with pork dumplings and mango curry. Prices are very fair and the atmosphere is nice. Overall I would recommend for a decent Asian fusion type dish but nothing to go out of my way for.', "Great place for Asian, some of the best, local style I've had in Europe. Literally stumbled across it and am so glad. Excellent food, great authentic flavours and a good price. Really recommended", 'As an Asian, me and my other Asian friends highly recommend this restaurant. The food is authentic, it brings us back home 🥹  ingredients are super fresh and high quality. Just with the simplest way to cook it, the best flavour will be sparked out.\nThe service is wonderful too. They can give you great recommendations to personalise the menu with the fresher seasonal dishes. 👍\nWho ever misses it, you don’t know what you are missing out !!!']

Name: Café bRICK
Summary: Salads, sandwiches, pastries & coffee served in a plant-filled space with vintage photos & a patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews: ['We went in for a breakfast with two toddlers. In general the food was good, especially the salmon bagel was interesting/tasty. Next time please be more conscious for parents visiting with kids (and provide them directly a toddlers-chair). All in all I would come in again to have a breakfast.', 'Fantastic breakfast plate for two. This is exactly what I want to experience when I go out to the restaurant for brunch. Good quality food, variety of options, served nicely. I really enjoyed my time here.', 'The place is cute, but really small, in the busy hour is better to reserve a table.\nI got the avocado-hummus toast which was good, but it took more than half hour before I got it. Smoothies are high recommended :)']

Name: Alaska Bar
Summary: Lively venue serving vegan tapas, plus coffee & cocktails, in a colorful dining room.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['I’ve been in Berlin for five days. I am vegetarian and my traveling companion is vegan. Berlin offers so much and we have experienced quite a number of vegan restaurants over these days. But this place really stood out.

Besides the really lovely staff that worked hard to fit us in without a reservation, the food was incredible. We had the eggplant and tahini which was perfectly melt-in-your-mouth delicious. And the watermelon dish was very good. But we were blown away by the vegan foie gras and the vegan lox on toast. The pate was made from a cashew base and was smooth and rich and all the umami you could want. The lox was made from thinly sliced roasted carrots with dill and just a little bit of seaweed to help you remember the ocean.

The crowd was happy and diverse. The staff was wonderful. I can’t say enough.', 'I’m not vegan but I love every dish I tried here! The highlights for me were potatas bravas, croquette, gazpacho and of course, churros.

The service was lovely but very slow so you have to be patient or go early when they just open. I think it’s definitely worth a visit!', 'The food was so good, but the service was so incredibly bad. After we put in an initial order of patatas bravas, we could not get anyone’s attention to order more food. In fact, people kept coming to take our menus away, and we would have to tell them we had not yet ordered most of our food. Since they took our menus away without us ordering, multiple times, we had to find menus lying in other places around the restaurant. To finally order our food, we had to be quite aggressive in calling the server over. When we wanted another drink, the same nightmare ensued in which we could not get anyone’s attention to order a drink. Our table was in the center of the restaurant, so the servers had to walk past us constantly. Overall, dinner took a very long time for no good reason, and we would have ordered more items if they had just given us more attention.

Despite the high quality vegan food, I would not return here.']

Name: Rutz Zollhaus
Summary: Elevated regional dishes & steaks, plus a long list of wines, in a historic canalside building.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Dining at Rutz Zollhaus was an unparalleled culinary experience, earning a perfect 10 out of 10, and one that we will cherish for a long time. Our evening began on the charming patio, where the beautiful weather added an extra layer of enchantment to the night.

From the moment we arrived, the staff's exceptional hospitality stood out. They welcomed us with genuine warmth and friendliness, immediately making us feel at home. Their extensive knowledge of the menu was impressive, and their eagerness to guide us through the culinary journey ahead heightened our anticipation.

We started our meal with the grilled butter lettuce, an impeccable choice that set the tone for the rest of the evening. The dressing was extraordinarily flavorful, creating a delightful balance that tantalized our taste buds and left us eager for the next course.

Next, we indulged in the beef tartar, which was simply perfect in every way. The texture, seasoning, and presentation were all executed flawlessly, making it a standout dish.

For the main course, I faced a delightful dilemma between the braised ox shoulder and the BBQ ribs. In the end, I decided to indulge in both, and it proved to be the best decision of the night. Each dish was cooked to perfection, with the braised ox shoulder melting in my mouth and the BBQ ribs offering a succulent, smoky flavor that left me craving more.

Rutz Zollhaus is a true culinary gem in Berlin, where every dish reflects the skill and creativity of Chef Marco Müller and his team. The entire dining experience was remarkable and memorable, from the impeccable service to the exquisite food. If you find yourself in Berlin, this is a must-visit restaurant.

Bravo to Chef Marco Müller and the entire team for providing us with such an unforgettable experience. This evening will be one we remember fondly for years to come.", 'Mt meal, shoulder, was dry and hard. But my companions enjoyed their chicken and pork chop.', 'We recently had our wedding celebration here and booked out the whole place. I don’t think we could have ever found a more perfect location. The restaurant and its wine garden are just so charming and made everything feel so magical. Everything was beyond perfect. The service staff were incredibly kind, super attentive, and very accommodating. The chefs produced truly beautifully presented and incredibly delicious courses for all of our guests. A special shout out to Pia who was our point of contact who organised everything for us and was so sweet. Truly an unforgettable experience. Thank you to everyone at Rutz Zollhaus.']

Name: A.HORN
Summary: Stylish, plant-filled venue for bagels, coffee & salads, plus a bakery selection & outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Tuesday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Wednesday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Thursday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Friday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Saturday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Sunday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM
Reviews:
["A much better place than the last time I went. Definitely upgraded inside. I love the fact that you can pay by card AND you can make a reservation online.
The pancakes! amazing, fluffy and fresh and tasty and I'll go back for more.
Nice bagels, nice coffee. You can check the menu by barcode and then it's self-service.", 'We had Pastrami Bagel and Pulled Chicken. Service was quite slow. Took around 20 minutes to just get two sandwiches. I had higher expectations with Pastrami Sandwich and expected something like New York deli food. However, pastrami was nothing but from a regular grocery. Very thin cut. Bagel flavor was so strong I barely got the taste of Pastrami

Anyway, pulled chicken was around 12€ and for that quality and service I would say it was overpriced l', 'We had a lovely brunch at A.Horn! There are several cool food options and it tasted great. The interior design is very cute and cosy. I liked the fact that you order your food and pay for it immediately. Of course, if you go during peak time, you’ll have to wait in the queue for a while and wait for your food to be ready, but the cosy atmosphere made up for it. The weather was beautiful and we walked along the water afterwards.']

Name: Parker Bowles
Summary: Pop-up kitchens for pizza, burgers, tacos & pan-Asian bites in a gray-toned, industrial-chic space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['been there a lot of times already and honestly at this point it’s like an addiction. the food there is amazing, i’ve had a lot of different dishes there and my all time favorites are the Kahuna Bowl with extra Chicken, the Chicken Katsu Buns, the lunch Sashimi Moriawase, the Chicken Katsu, the Jack Daniels BBQ Deluxe Burger, the Gyu Don and the NewYork NewYork Pizza!! With the amount of options on the menu and the 5 different kitchens there is no other choice but to come multiple times to try some of everything and you sure won’t regret it. Plus the staff is really nice and welcoming! Also drinks wise I recommend one of their homemade lemonades to go along your lunch. There’s also a café included in the restaurant which sells amazing cookies and some really good apple crumble cake so definitely don’t miss out on that either! Will definitely come again🫶🫶', "Food is ok, coffee too. But after spending 17 euros on food and drinks they refuse to give you a glass of water even in +25 degrees.  Apparently that's the official policy, the waiters say. Unacceptable way to treat your customers in the service industry.", 'Awesome place for lunch. The smash burger is great. And the service outstanding!!']

Name: Van Loon Restaurant Boat and Shipping Company
Summary: Smoked fish & fried seafood, served on a boat-top deck with panoramic views over the canal.
Opening Hours: Monday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Awesome place in summer. Beautiful view as well as chill atmosphere. I always spend at least one afternoon at van Loon when I‘m in Berlin. Usually I have a few beers and watch the swans and paddlers. Sometimes I also get a snack but never tried the real menu.\n\nPrices are very ok for the location.', "Awesome buffet for brunch. Thank you Van Loon team for such a service. Unfortunately on that day there was born gluten free bread. They said it's usually available. How is this possible they didn't restock for a Saturday morning?", 'Lovely place to have a romantic dinner at night ! Say hi to the swans when coming in the will appreciate ! 🦢']

Name: Adak Restaurant
Summary: Compact outfit with a casual vibe serving doner kebabs, kofte & other Mediterranean staples.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['It was the worst lahmacun I have ever eaten in my life. There was no meat in it. We ate an empty lavash and paid 2.80 Euro.', 'The food is very tasty, recommended!', "Ah, the good Adak... I used to live nearby, and I'd go get a dohner very regularly. Every now and then, when I visit Prenzlauer Berg, I still visit the place. Family run business, super friendly... 10/10"]

Name: Blume an der Hasenheide
Summary: Cozy stop for German-Mediterranean light bites, plus coffee, cake & lots of vegan choices.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM
Reviews: ["Nice and quiet place with lovely food and team. Don't miss it! Plenty of gluten free options.", 'what a place ! cozy and delicious food !! reasonable prices, and best thing is the staff, smiling and so friendly, ! it was my last breakfast in Berlin and I am glad I went there with my friends. !!! will come back again next time !! Thank you 💚🤍', 'Been there for their Sunday brunch buffet and back again for lunch. Everything is delicious and the attention is always great. Peaceful and cozy environment to work or read. The Spinat Käse Spätzle was amazing.']

Name: Lavanderia Vecchia
Summary: Whimsical Mediterranean eatery modeled on an Italian street scene with clotheslines & exposed brick.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["We've visited this place twice so far and both times it's been a great experience. We get the set menu which is about €54 per person and consists of 4 courses: 2 starters, a pasta, a meat/fish dish and a dessert. 2 drinks per person are also included in the price.

The food is interesting and tasty. Some of the dishes are more hits than others, but the overall experience is really nice.

The atmosphere is lovely, nicely decorated and the staff are super friendly and welcoming!

Make sure to reserve :)", 'Great atmosphere and amazing food. The restaurant is very well decorated with dim lighting and there’s a smoking room in the back for smokers.

The food was outstanding, and you get your money’s worth. Delicious Italian dishes and a very good house wine. The fix price includes 2 appetizers, 2 mains, fantastic bread, desert, unlimited sparkling water, a bottle of wine, coffee, and a digestif. We had the vegetarian menu which was a real treat.

Pro tip: if you go for dinner definitely skip lunch because it’s a lot of food 😋

The only cons I saw were:
-The open kitchen isn’t very well ventilated so if you’re sitting next to it you’ll have the kitchen grease smells. (Not that the food was greasy, but just that classic food-cooking-in-oil smell from big kitchens)
-Some of the dishes were slightly over-salted.

Overall it was a great experience and the perfect place to celebrate a special occasion such as birthday or anniversary.', 'Delicious 5-course Italian tasting menu with drinks included. Lovely seasonal food - octopus, peas, tomatoes. Homemade focaccia 😋. Everything was delicious. Served in family sharing style. Friendly staff, good service. Decor and style of restaurant is great, so much laundry memorabilia, open kitchen. Highly recommend this experience.']

Name: Berlin Tantuni
Summary: Busy, counter-serve place preparing tantuni & other familiar Turkish bites in a relaxed, cozy space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['3 Years ago my GF and I were searching for a place to eat at night and stumbled upon this Restaurant. We ordered Halloumi-Taschen and Kebap and it was literally the most delicous food we ever expierenced. 3 Years later and I still compare every place where you can buy Kebap with this place. So I traced this place back on G-Maps just so I can review it.
Great Place; literally a must-visit if you travel to Berlin.', 'The best tantuni in Berlin! Simple yet delicious, good quality meat, fast and friendly service. Their lahmacun is also quite good, nothing like tasteless weird Turkische Pizza. Absolutely recommended 👌', 'Yogurtlu Tantuni for 12.5.
Tastes not bad, but i would add more meat and dial it back on the yogurt side.

Keen to give it another try for other menu option.']

Name: Isla coffee Berlin
Summary: Clean, modern space for coffee, brunch & toasted sandwiches, with vegan options & a leafy terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews: ['Great atmosphere with super friendly, professional staff. A lovely outdoor area to relax and food to die for. The food was such high quality, fresh and interesting - not the usual brunch style fare. The herb and onion Kastenknödel was delicious with home made tomato chutney (again not like anything I had made or eaten); a super tasty mushroom on toast dish; delicious cakes like lemon drizzle & almond, cinnamon and yoghurt cake. Sadly I was only visiting Berlin - if not it would be my regular cafe!!', "Lovely place, but I have to give a special shout out to Sierra. Because..  wow. She is just incredible. You walk in and you're greeted by that cute friendly face and it makes your whole day. I had a hot chocolate here, made by her, and it was one of the very best hot chocolates I've ever had in my whole life.", 'Everything is really nice, girls are so cute and they offered a very good service🤩\nThe brunch and the coffee are amazing,  it’s the most delicious brunch that I ever had in Berlin 💕\nMUST TRY']

Name: MUTED HORN
Summary: Bottled lagers, ales & ciders, plus 22 on tap, in a minimalist tavern with bare brick walls.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Great place for craft beer aficionados. Good selection of European beers, few NAmericas. Brutalist atmosphere, nice people around. Good prices.', 'Best craft beer option in Berlin, impressive selection of beers in bottles / cans. Tap options also interesting. Nice staff', "Amazing beer place that will satisfy people with all kind of beer preferences. If I lived in Berlin or at least stayed there for longer time, this would definitely be my go-to beer place.
I liked the option of tasting trays that consists of 4 small glasses of specific beers that you put together from the current offer of tapped beers. Some beers for tasting tray are slightly more expensive, but the tasting tray is still the best option if you want to try more beers, or if you can't decide. I tried two tasting sets - one with sour beers, another one with stouts. Both were put together with recommendations from the guy at the tap, and I liked the final results a lot.
Tapped water to your beer is for free, which I find amazing, and staff speaks English.
No food offered, mostly just some beer snacks, so count with the fact that you won't have your dinner here."]

Name: Ristorante Monte Cristo
Summary: Relaxed, roomy venue serving Italian dishes like pizza & pasta, plus schnitzel & other comfort food.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["The service is real service here, the waiter we had is giving his heart to the place and you can tell he is rooted in this place for many years which makes this outing an encounter with the local history here.

I enjoyed the ambience for it's old beauty, most of all the freedom from running after new trends that you see everywhere makes me calm down and really relax at this place. It has a millennial interior charme with fake palm trees that feels effortless, it's kitsch but true.

The food is basics but good, tasty and incredibly cheap. Regarding the price you have to consider it excellent.", 'An ideal place to come and relax from all your problems.  The prices correspond to the quality of the kitchen and service.  I would like to visit this restaurant, at least because of the friendly and caring staff.  I was captivated by this place!', 'Perhaps the worst restaurant in Berlin. All is from the freezer. Waitress was cool, owner was threatening when we made a complaint. Hope I won’t get sick.']

Name: Klunkerkranich
Summary: Sprawling cultural venue featuring a roof terrace, casual food & concerts, plus a cocktail bar.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Gorgeous rooftop, and obviously pretty popular! We were there closer to sunset and it was jam packed, still we were able to find a place to stand and enjoy the vibes. The 8 € entrance fee is quite ridiculous though… Still, it’s a lovely place and quite spacious.', 'Such a fun place to visit with a nice view of Berlin,in an unexpected place.
It’s on top of a shopping mall on parking lot.the idea itself is brilliant and I loved it.
Has chill vibe with a nice crowd
The only problem is limited bar booths.
Queue can be very tiring.
On weeksdays entrance is free on weekends like many other places because of live music they also have the fee which is 8€ p.p.
Price of snacks and beers were decentlyaffordable.
I loved it and I recommend this place', 'Great spot for sunset drinks! It gets packed and you might need to wait in line, and maybe not find a table to sit. Overall fun and relaxed crowed, lots of tourist, not your local Neukolln people. Worth the trip once in a while .']

Name: Caligari
Summary: A changing menu of creative antipasti, pasta & Italian mains in a cool, rustic-chic setting.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['We waited around 20-30min to get seated despite having made a reservation. It also took them a very long time to bring us two bottles of wine.

The food itself was also a bit disappointing, many of our dishes were oversalted and masked the taste of everything.
This is sad cause it ruined the great taste of their homemade pasta.
I had to rub off all the sauce to at least appreciate something.
The dish with seafood just tasted like sea…

The place itself looked very cute and cozy, also the dishes were very pretty.', "A modern little kiez restaurant serving up some delicious Italian food from a changing menu.

The place is compact and lively with the front dining section facing a large open window and the inside having a rustic open brick wall. The open bar and kitchen adds the warmth of the place.

Service is always friendly and polite but can get a bit frantic when they're very full, but they'll take care of you nonetheless.

The menu consists of a few well made, rustic, entrées, mains and desserts. The tartare was an absolute win! Every dish was made with care and left nothing to be desired. The portion sizes are perfect for you to enjoy a 3 course meal.

The wine list is short but curated. They have an interesting collection of Italian wines are that uncommon but worth trying in Berlin.

All in all, it's a pleasure to have these establishments be a part of every kiez. It's a great place to bring your friends or even a date!", '😍everything was amazing! The service did it all very effortlessly and calm which made a beautiful atmosphere. The timing of the food was perfectly on point and it was all soo delicious! We had a table with 12 ppl and not one glass was ever empty we had a blast! Thank you soo much!!!']

Name: Trattoria Zoe
Summary: Stone-oven pizza, pasta, classic mains & Italian wine at an elegant restaurant popular for brunch.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['This is probably the worst bruschetta I have tasted. The way it is presented is also bad. I took a bite and threw the rest away.', 'The last minute of a great night, our tattooed waitress gave us the cold shoulder. For that I reward you with one star. Congratulations', 'Got the carbona after someone in the reviews raved about it. Ordered some bruschetta for starters. When that arrived I already started worrying about the place, it was on a piece of pizza bread, really basic and without any love for food. The carbonara was fairly bland but not a complete trainwreck. My partners scampi linguine literally tasted like cardboard. The couple scampi\'s were accompanied by supermarket precooked shrimps. I can\'t understand how people rated this as a good restaurant, the grumpy "Berliner Schnauze" waiter almost threw the plates on our table and the whole place just screams tourist trap.']

Name: Bu Kon
Summary: Family-run restaurant offering classic Vietnamese dishes in a cozy, laid-back atmosphere.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['The food was quite good and the staff was very friendly there. Authentic Vietnamese food.', 'Food was amazing! Everything was freshly made, prices not very high, nice choice of food and drink, the service was awesome', 'I love this place, quick service, food is always tasty, (I’ve tried maybe 1/4 of the menu at this point and have enjoyed it all), and really reasonably priced.']

Name: Restaurant Bricole
Summary: Sophisticated, high-end restaurant featuring innovative 5-course dinners with global influence.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Bricole truly lives up to its Michelin star rating! From start to finish, our dining experience here was exceptional. The dishes were expertly crafted and bursting with flavor, showcasing the chef's culinary prowess. Despite its prestigious accolades, the ambiance at Bricole is refreshingly casual, allowing diners to relax and enjoy their meal without feeling overly formal. Personal favorites included the snow crab, cauliflower, and beef dishes – each one a culinary masterpiece. If you're looking for a memorable date night dining experience in a laid-back setting, Bricole is the place to be!", "In short: all around great experience with minor drawbacks
The food was in line with what you'd expect from a 1 star place. Especially the beef and the crab-cake starter were real highlights for us. However, some courses had clashing flavours were elements of the dish completely disappeared which was a bit disappointing to see.
The portion sizes are also on the smaller side even for fine dining which was a little disappointing when you want to dig into something you enjoyed.
Service was friendly and attentive but the whole experience took us 3.5hrs. It seems that all courses are served at the same time for all guests so if you come early you better have a lot of conversation topics.", "The food here is excellent, and the wait staff was stellar. When I'm in Berlin again, this is the place I'll go to for dinner. Isabelle was my server and she was absolutely outstanding , great wine recommendations and a wealth of knowledge of the menu. The gilthead and Nebraska beef courses were absolutely out of this world . The mackerel dish was sadly quite fishy, and the dessert course was a little too sweet and didn't quite taste like a classic dessert, but other than that every other course was AMAZING. I am very much looking forward to coming back. This restaurant definitely earned its Michelin star."]

Name: Kanaan
Summary: Meat-free Israeli & Palestinian sharing platters with homemade pita & hummus in a laid-back space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['We had researched vegetarian restaurants before our trip to Berlin. This venue was highly recommended and we throughly enjoyed our visit. We booked a table in advance and we took a tram from the centre of Berlin and it was hen only a short walk from the tram stop to the restaurant. There were many people sitting around the pavements nearby eating food they had taken away from the restaurant.The food was excellent and the staff very friendly and helpful when we were deciding what to order, guiding us regarding portion sizes suitable for the size of our party. Were we to visit Berlin again, we would not hesitate to return to the restaurant.', 'Everything was amazing. Best hummus I’ve had in Berlin. The portions were bigger than expected', 'Our favourite Berlin restaurant - unfortunately you did not live up to our expectations this time around.

Tonight we went for the belly dancing show and set menu offer.

Positives first:
Very generous portions, be prepared for a big feast and lots of lovely flavours!
Their lemonade is very fresh and delicious, definitely recommended as a refreshing aperitif.
The belly dancer show was so energetic, excited that we finally got to see it! Great fun!

Our prior experience, both at the old location and new, has been nothing but positive. Attentive staff, busy vibe and amazing food. However, there were some issues this time around that has made us wondering if this was our last visit.

Our reserved slot was 18.00 to 20.00. We were welcomed and seated immediately upon arrival but then had to wait nearly 20 minutes before staff took drink orders. The starter wasn’t served until almost an hour after we arrived. To our knowledge at the time this left us possibly with only an hour to finish a 9 course meal. The dessert was served at about 20.00, so luckily it wasn’t as tight as feared.
Yet again when we had finished our meal we also had to wait a long time at the bar to get to pay our bill.

Unfortunately staff did not have time to pay much attention to our table during our stay. By the time we left staff had not taken a single drink-order from us, we had to make the request and generally it took some effort and waiting to communicate, as they were super busy running back and forth. Even presenting the menu and taking orders they appeared in a rush, talking very fast and «on the go».

Starter:
The seasoned bread was nice but dry. Some of the dishes that we expected to be served warm arrived cold at the table. Unsure if it was supposed to be like that, but the grilled cauliflower, falafel and roasted potatoes would have been nice served warm. The potatoes were somewhat chewy and falafel was not moist like before, unfortunately dry. The hummus was lovely, like before, however served with much added tahini now which camouflaged the hummus flavour and made it somewhat bland.

Mains:
By the time our mains arrived we were starting to feel full already. So great value for money, but quite overwhelming.

Dessert:
Coconunt pannacotta with pistachio crumble and a fruit sauce was lovely, but then again we were very, very full at this point.

All in all we spent the majority of our visit waiting, and less time enjoying the food and taking the time to process and taste the lovely foods and flavours. Such a shame.

The large portions are great if you have a big appetite and are a fast eater. We could’ve enjoyed half the size and therefore miss the opportunity of a la carte.

The belly dancer was definitely a highlight, thank you for the entertaining show and spreading love!

Edit: Would like to add that the staff was very friendly also this time. They were constantly running and probably did as best as they could given the number of staff available and dinner set-up, serving a full restaurant within a very short time frame.']

Name: China Restaurant Laoxiang
Summary: Dumplings, soups & a long menu of traditional dishes in an elegant dining room with Chinese motifs.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['Laoxiang is definitely one of the best Chinese restaurants in Berlin. We came for their Sunday brunch deal; 16€ per person for three dishes and free green tea. The food is authentic as you can get!! They are delicious and the portions are huge. I’d highly recommend to skip breakfast if you are planning to take the Sunday brunch deal.

Pro tip: you must come early around 11 am to get a table, otherwise you’ll need to queue.', "I ate here years ago and I think it used to be better. The soup dumplings were not very juicy,  The Kung Pao chicken was generous but the mildest I've ever had. Almost no chillies, really weak hints of Sichuan peppercorns and doesn't look at all like in the menu.
It wasn't bad but definitely not a place to come back to", 'Ordered mapo tofu for 14€, says with “pork and chili sauce”, but WHERE IS HACKFLEISCH ?!?! Was only garlic and chili powder, not a single meat.
Looks sooo different from the picture in the wolt app']

Name: Restaurant VOLT
Summary: Chic eatery with exposed brickwork & metallic hanging lamps serving modern, regional German cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Nice location. Slow service. Food is pointless, recipes are nonsense (eg a slice of tomato with some goat cheese on top at 19 €) with very few exceptions. The concept behind the menu is confusing and unclear (the menu starts with chicken breast, and continues with sturgeon: the idea behind is unclear). Hugely overpriced considering what they are offering. Not recommended', 'Modern restaurant serving modern German cuisine. Really interesting interior in what was once an electricity substation. Food was on the whole well presented. Cooked to a high standard and very tasty. Great wine selection and option of a craft beer. Very efficient service, in particular because we were a large group.', 'Lovely dinner in a beautiful building along the canal. Service was excellent and the food delish. Highly recommend.']

Name: Goldberg Bar Café Restaurant
Summary: Coffee & breakfast options, plus schnitzel & beer, in a laid-back venue with leather sofas.
