Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews:
['Amazing food and very friendly staff. One of the best schnitzels I’ve tried in Berlin.', "The first time I visited Goldberg I asked, what good to order here, and the answer was: everything. I hadn't really thought it was possible, but many visits later, it was proven true. I love the place because of the excellent food but there is a great simple atmosphere there where it's really comfortable to spend time.

And of course the best Schnitzel in town.", 'One of my favorite spots in Berlin. Always great food and friendly staff. Whether it’s coffee, juice and work, a glass of wine or a proper dinner, this place never disappoints!
P.s. hands down the best schnitzel in town!']

Name: Biergarten Jockel
Summary: Burgers, flammkuchen pizzas, beer & cocktails at an industrial-style bar with a large garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Bad service. You order three drinks you get completely different drinks. You order food you get wrong food. And everything takes very long. It looks like employees are not interested to serve the customers.

Obviously, because of the playing ground for kids and lack of similar places this Biergarten already starts to be ok, but then you visit the toilet….and you can’t lock the door!
This is a no go!!!!', 'Nice beer garden next to a playground and the river making it a good option for a family evening. The beer was decent while the food was standard (we just ordered the pizzas)', 'Perfect for meeting friends with the kids. Nice beer garden and great playground. Also next to the water. Food is good enough (chips, pizza, ice cream etc.)']

Name: Gobento
Summary: Bento is the house specialty of this Japanese restaurant serving a balance of flavors.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 8:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["This place is incredible. It's pretty small and will host max 24 people. It's BYOD (Bring Your Own Drink). The host is also the chef and he's very entertaining. And the food.. Holy sh*t the food is good. Like really good. The flavors are so different and so well combined that you'll love every bit of it. And even though it doesn't look like much food, you'll be lost likely good at the end of the dinner. Price wise, we're talking between 20-25pp, which goes a long way with the qualify of food that you're having. Just awesome.", 'Its superb experience as it was 3 courses menu omakase style (surprise menu by the chef on the spot). The food itself was japanese fusion and all was super yum. Here you supposed to bring your own beverage with glass, because they dont sell any beverages. But we could storage our beverage in their fridge :). Please do reservation as they only accept limited guests per night and keep in mind it starts at the same time (be on time).', "What a phenomenal experience. Really cool spot. If you're into an unconventional, raw experience where the owner is personally taking care of you from the reservation, checking dietary needs, preparing, cooking, serving and describing what is presented in front of you, and such tasty and elaborate display of food with 3 courses... then this is for you. Had a really fun and romantic evening with bringing our own wine. Thanks! Looking forward to our next visit."]

Name: Facciola
Summary: Italian wines & cuisine offered in a cool, relaxed space with a chalkboard menu & sidewalk seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['A cosy spot to enjoy few bottles of good wines and the cheese and cold cuts platter is the best! The staff was also very nice and took great care of us the whole time. We had their specials today, a slow cooked chicken with so much flavours! Definitely will come back!', 'Great food, great wine and great experience. A full round tour of Italy and Italian culture all in a single place! Auro the owner, and all the staff are nice and prepared, making you feel at home in a second. Truly a recommended place, especially if you fancy a good bottle of wine! 🍷', 'As an Italian, I can say we had an authentic Italian experience. Great food and wines selection, cozy atmosphere. We had so much fun :) Definitely one of my favourite places in Berlin.']

Name: Tischendorf
Summary: Shabby-chic cafe with an eco-conscious focus, offering cakes & plentiful vegan options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
['The salad was full of sand (very uncomfortable to eat), the orange juice full of seeds and pulp, I had already finished my dish when my friend finally got his food, and typical Berlin unfriendly waiters.
The salmon, bread and egg was tasty though.', 'Food was extremely delicious and prepared quickly. Each and every ingredient was tasty and created an amazing meal. Staff was very kind. We highly recommend.', 'Im sitting here and I am waiting for my coffee since half an hour but chatting seems to be more interesting to the girl behind the desk. Not busy at all today.
Does that mean she is waiting for the beans to be harvested by the local coffee producers or is she just in a mood where she doesn’t care about the tip she already got by me.. as this is self service I‘m thinking to go to the desk and take some of the coins. I am so hungry because I came here for paying money for a My of service that I do not get at home… still dreaming of coffee.
Now I have to pay a beggar but I gave all my coins to the girl behind the desk. I should have taken them back in the meantime. Now the beggar got nothing and.. oh the coffee is walking to my desk.
Finally.']

Name: Pipaso Pizzeria
Summary: Straightforward counter-serve joint in a narrow space offering pizza, pasta & meat dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Pasta pipaso iss very good. Also pizza is good', 'The pizza here is just okay. The prices also used to be better. Now it’s not such a great deal anymore. They are open late though and the wait for the food is usually quite short.', "Honest to goodness food. Authentic, unpretentious, plentiful, and always solid. If you like super creamy pasta sauces, this is it. Don't expect Italian pasta but rather straight up soul food that doesnt pretend to be anything it's not.\nAnd once you get the vibe, staff is actually friendly with the occasional jokester."]

Name: Mae Charoen Thai Imbiss
Summary: Simple snack bar serving classic staples like pad Thai & tom yum soup, with takeout options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["The ladies that assist here are super nice, the price is really affordable for the amount of food they give. The taste is good, it can be better, but it's understandable. Drinks are a bit high on price, but it is also understandable.\n\nI can see myself returning here if i want something different one day.", 'For the price and the taste nothing even comes close! Best Thai In berlin hands down! Ran by some cool older Thai ladies they take the order cook the order scream out your order you take and eat. Great “hole in the wall” place!!! Get the squid pad kropow soooo good', 'Unfortunately the pad thai was too sweet and less flavorful than expected. The ketchup was the dominating flavour. I missed also some crunchy peanuts bits that are normally served with the pad thai.']

Name: Hallmann und Klee
Summary: Innovative, seasonal dishes in a chic, airy venue best known for its breakfast & brunch offerings.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Amazing food, fantastic flavours and the alcohol free pairing was exceptional. This combination was simply perfect. The service team was knowledgeable and friendly. The whole experience was superb. It got kind of noisy when the restaurant filled up. But overall super good.', 'What a wonderful restaurant! It was one of my top culinary experiences in Berlin.
We had the non-veggie menu with alcohol-free drink pairing.
First of all the savoury courses were just amazing. Everything was very well prepared and balanced - but in combination with the drinks it all went up to a whole other level. The drinks complemented all dishes perfectly, big thanks to the sommelier for this amazing job. Really hard to say which dish was the best, all had their own twist.
We had the feeling that dessert is not their strength, compared to all the savoury dishes before but it was still good.
The service was attentive and really nice. We also liked the laidback atmosphere outside at the Böhmi.
I can 100% recommend this place and the star is more than well deserved :)', 'After quite a long time thinking about visiting Hallmann & Klee, we finally made it. If you think about it and are able to afford it: book it! We had a very very good time, food is amazing, wine pairing could be shared and is a must, menus could be adjusted on a course basis between veg and non veg. Service was attentive and spot on. Standout dishes were the scallop, the dove and the kohlrabi, which doesn’t mean that the rest was not also absolutely delicious. Thank you so much for this evening!']

Name: LoveBurger
Summary: Snug eatery serving vegan burgers & bowls made with area-sourced ingredients, plus smoothies & beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM
Reviews:
['We had two orders of the Deutscher Burger Beyond that come with potato wedges & loved them. The Deutscher is everything I look for in a vegan burger & I could easily have eaten a double serving of the fries. I’d give LoveBurger a contender status for having one of the best burgers in Berlin… That said, the one thing that keeps this review from being a 5 star rating is the fact that €36.80 for two burgers & fries is kind of outrageous. Being from the USA, I’m accustomed to the inflation impact & consumer gouging that happens in the vegan community, but this raised my eyebrows. We will eat here again because the food is bangin’, but we’ll likely order less or not arrive hungry.', 'Just perfect!!!

I had the “special” burger…. A lovely vegan burger with sweet potato Fries as sidedish

Not only the food was fresh and really delicious. The owner is also such a nice and friendly person!!! Love the vibe here!

I Will definately come back when i visit Berlin again!', 'This place is just amazing with bursts of flavours.. everything on the menu is so unique and just too good. They have seasonal burgers with different versions and those should not be missed at all. I highly recommend this place!!']

Name: Pizzeria da Izzi
Summary: Late-night pizzeria offering thin-crust pies, pasta & other Italian eats in a down-to-earth setting.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Reasonable prices and excellent service, but the food is terrible. Unable to get the basics like spaghetti bolognese and pizza Napoletana right. Frozen pizzas taste better.', 'The pizzas are delicious, at a good price. The staff is kind and welcoming. They all do a great job and I leave feeling good vibes everytime. A neighorhood favourite for me! :)', "The service here was very very good. Very helpful and kind staff. They were able to adapt and provide something for every single person in my group of 15! They were able to feed all three vegans in the team sufficiently without technically having any vegan options also. Though the food was relatively three star at best, the service really brings the overall score higher. If you need a quick bite to eat and this is where you end up, it's not a bad decision at all."]

Name: Il Sorriso
Summary: Refined pasta & grills, plus a long wine list, in a sophisticated venue with outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["Beautiful sitting area with great service, especially the handsome guy with tattoos.
Food was good, but it crossed that line of being more fancy than appetizing. Also the drinks menu suffered in the same way.

Was nice to try but wouldn't go again if I'm honest.", "Have been there twice, both times the service was excellent, and the food delicious. Last time got the seasonal dishes with chanterelle and the carpaccio was the best I had in a long time. The prices might be a bit higher than the average place but you definitely get your money's worth. The restaurant is very big inside so sometimes it might seem empty but don't let that discourage you from finding this gourmet gem.", 'My favourite restaurant in Berlin for sure! The staff is very attentive and welcoming and the food is top level. Both fish and meat dishes are done to perfection with close attention to detail. Will come back again and again.']

Name: Sakura Restaurant
Summary: Modern Asian restaurant with an all-you-can-eat buffet featuring sushi, dim sum & noodle dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['The cafe is a buffet, but the choice of food is very small. Several positions of similar meat in sauce, two waters of fried fish, there we no seafood, at least when we were there. Side dishes were also few.
The sushi were just awful, they were crookedly rolled, there were no options with salmon or tuna at all. Basically sushi were only with vegetables or with vegetables and crab sticks. There were only a two desserts and they were not tasty.

In addition you must order at least one drink, the prices for them are overhigh.

However, by Berlin standards - this is a pretty cheap place and the food is unlimited. So if your goal is to eat a lot for little money and the taste is not particularly important, then this is the place for you.', "Visiting Berlin for a couple of days with my 13 year old son who is very fussy about food so a buffet was a wise choice! We found the place very easily, a few minutes walk from Nollendorfplatz U-bahn station. We visited on a Friday evening and there was no waiting time. The food was fresh and there's a large selection of sushi, grilled meats, cooked dishes and a small veggie salad bar + deserts and ice-cream. The meat is freshly grilled before your eyes, everything we chose was delicious! The cake selection was small and my cheesecake and berry jello weren't very tasty but the ice-cream was lovely. There were two choices of noodles and they were more Chinese than Japanese style. There are no English labels for anything so we intuitively chose with our eyes! Our server was nice but didn't go out of her way to explain anything about how the buffet works but I guess is self explanatory if you've been before to similar places. The place is clean and has pleasant Japanese themed decor.  45 euros for two, with a glass of still water and a glass of sparkling water. I don't drink alcohol but they seemed to have a wide selection of alcoholic beverages, classic choice of soft drinks and a small cocktail bar. Definitely worth the time and the money. My son loved the food too and we had a good time. I would eat here again.", 'We went there at around 20:30
Unfortunately the food was not fresh anymore. Fried foods were too greasy. I suggest a different pricing for those late hours to be fair']

Name: Restaurant & Supermarkt Persepolis
Summary: Kebabs, grilled meats & stews, plus vegetarian options & traditional drinks, in a relaxed setup.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['This is a quite decent Persian restaurant. We were a group in f people and the service was really good. The staff were also very nice and friendly.

Unfortunately, I can’t speak of prices as we were invited.

The appetizers are pretty good and the food was also decent.', 'I had a vegetarian option which was tasty and plentiful.  They seemed to be short staffed and they need to improve a bit on their cleaning of the tables.  Also, if you’re bothered by cigarette smoke, people smoke in the outside section and the smell does penetrate the seating inside.  I would eat here again as my meal was good.', 'Very Yummy !!!
Salad & side dishes not very special But the main is Amazing. I expect grilled chicken may be dry but it is really really juicy and tastes just right. lamb is really good too.

Staffs sooooo nice and have smile always.
SOOO clean toilet as well !

Recommend you have to visit here 👍🏻']

Name: Ulrichs - Café, Küche & Kultur
Summary: Non-profit, volunteer-run cafe & eatery offering coffee, light German fare & cultural events.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Friday: Closed, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['They were super kind, the atmosphere of the local is very free and nice, and the personal was very friendly!!\nToday we were looking for a beer and a knife for making our pocket-lunch and we went inside for asking them. They were super kind and offer us a seat, two plates, butter and cucumber. Very suggested! If I came back to Berlin I will return here.', 'We ate some of the most disgusting Waffles in our whole lifes! Waitress decided to put her coffee on our table while she was smoking her cigarette near us. When we ordered we had to repeat our order at least 3 times. Cannot recommend, even to my worst enemy.', 'Cafe run by volunteers serving different dishes every day. Tried the red lentil soup today - it was basic but super yummy.']

Name: Oderquelle
Summary: Typical dishes like roast pork & tarte flambée at a rustic bar/restaurant with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['I love roast pork. We got lucky by coming in without reservation, but reserve a table if you want to come here.

My friend is vegetarian and he got several options. 💚', "We came here for a traditional meal on the last night of our honeymoon as we wanted something suitable for a vegan and a meat eater.

What a fantastic place! The vegan pretzel dumplings with mushrooms are superb; a truly unique meal I will be dreaming about for a long time. My husband's pork and potato went down a treat. The staff were superb, the location was easy to find and the ambience was perfect for a cosy Sunday evening meal.", 'I had schnitzel and potato-cucumber salat. It was perfect summer food!']

Name: La Buvette - Grill Français
Summary: Mussels, beef tartare & entrecôte steak, plus French wines, at a cozy, understated brasserie.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Went there today and was really happy about the spontaneous decision. The food was tasty and a proper portion, the service was friendly and professional. It is not cheap but adequate to the quality. Definitely looking forward to going there again.', 'Our second visit. This time we brought along sone friends who loved it, too! The menu is not very extensive but the food is very good! The vine card also holds something for everyones taste. We will be back!', 'Always a great night at La Buvette. The French staples are well interpreted, the wine list is good value and the the staff are unfailing in their desire to provide you with a great experience. Will always be back!']

Name: Burgerie
Summary: Casual stop for artisan burgers cooked on a lava stone grill, with an array of toppings, plus fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM
Reviews: ['Burgerie offers burgers for everyone. Whether you’re a meat eater, vegetarian, vegan or want to enjoy a gluten-free burger: they know how to satisfy their guests and their hunger for a good burger. I enjoyed the gluten-free Rabby burger, made from kohlrabi. It was tasteful, delicious but also nutritious. You can sit outside or indoors, depending on how you handle the street vibe/sounds. Big recommend to go here!', 'Burgerie is one of the best burgers in Berlin, particularly due to the flame grilled burgers. They also are a wonderful place to meet for friends with different diets, to include gluten free, vegetarian, etc. Highly recommend!', 'The go-to place for celiacs looking for a gluten free burger. Indoor sitting is quite limited, thus I would recommend reserving a table in advance. Has the "family-business" atmosphere. Would recommend the fried sweet potatoes on the side.']

Name: Café Krone
Summary: Sandwiches, brunch & pancakes served in a rustic, warm venue that has a terrace & vegan options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
['Definitely a gem in the neighborhood. I see a looong queue here a lot of weekends and now I understand why.

The food, staff, service, ambiance, all was great and we left with a smile on our faces.

The menu is extensive and we both love the savory and sweet plates.

We’ll be back to try more delicious food for sure.', "Loved the variety in the dishes they offer! We tried the pink beetroot soup, pistaciho pancakes and omelette toast and it honestly all tasted great. Also particularly loved the cold brew martini, highly recommend! They don't do reservations on weekends but do take card!", 'Although the café was really busy when we arrived, we only had to wait 10-15 mins and once sat down, our food and drinks came quickly (good job to the waitresses and chefs).
The tender surrender sandwich was easily one of the best sandwiches I’ve ever eaten 11/10!!!! My friend got the eggs benedict and said it was a great classic however considering the price, it could’ve maybe been decorated more. Would still highly recommend!!']

Name: Italian Food Berlin
Summary: Unpretentious canteen with outdoor seating, spotlighting an extensive pizza & pasta menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM
Reviews:
['Need an easy quick yummy meal? This is your place! Super cheap but good quality, the food serving was big and very filling. They accepted cash or card and the food came out pretty quick. We ate outside but they do have indoor seating as well.', "First of all, the SEO is unbeatable with a name like that. I've been visiting this venue for close to 10 years now and I'm yet to be disappointed. Reasonably priced yet unreasonably tasty. Can't go wrong with a plate of gnocchi with a side of pizza and some bread rolls for good measure if you're a big eater.", 'The lasagne is simply great. They customise the dish upon request. Large portions. And low price.
Pizza is not authentic Italian, but it has its own signature, and I liked it very much.

Overall I would definitely recommend.']

Name: Mirabelle
Summary: Regional dishes like tarte flambée, plus vegan options, in a laid-back cafe with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ['They have delicious German food with a fun vegetarian twist, as well as all the usual meat-based options.', 'The food took around 50 minutes to arrive, something really annoying considerably when you only order two simple dishes from the menu. The kitchen is very slow and the service is very slow. The food was not something spectacular for all the waiting time. no wonder..!!!', 'Exemplary German comfortable feel and cordial staff with a cutting edge (thus exceptionally delectable!) take on the cooking, particularly the soups. Strongly suggested.😍😘😘']

Name: Gaststätte Berliner Wappen
Summary: Down-to-earth tavern serving up big portions of schnitzel, steak & matjes herring, plus draft beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['As a foreigner who can’t speak German, I always feel so nervous to order food. But this place has good vibe, a lady offered me English menu. The food is delicious, taste like home made. With the cozy sunshine, I believe you will have a good time here!', 'Salt of the earth , true to its taste, all the dishes are amazing here. Particularly the peach with steak which I didn’t know was a killer combination . And the Salmon with Asparagus.With great Sparkling Wine options of-course. Kindly choose anything with pork.\n\nEven though I couldn’t speak much Deustch, everyone was trying to help and figure out me and my friends order.', 'Traveled here for the weekend with some friends - this is some of the best German food I’ve ever eaten. Fair prices and friendly owner.']

Name: Kos House
Summary: Greek meze platters, grills & ouzo in a cozy, brick-lined space with a covered terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ["Great place! The staff are lovely and we're very welcoming to us, and the food is delicious. Nice spot with outdoor seating away from the hustle.", "This restaurant is INCREDIBLE! So so cosy and well decorated, lovely atmosphere. The service is amazing (thank you Georgios for being a great waiter to us) and the food was truly out of this world. Super delicious! Wine was tasty too. I recommend buying lots of little dishes and sharing, it's the best way to sample lots of their delicious dishes. The broccoli is so worth trying as well, I would eat that every day for the rest of my life if I could :D", 'We visited this amazing restaurant today!\nEverything was just perfect, the food was delicious, the people so kind and friendly, they made our trip in Berlin even better!!!\nTotally recommend it, if you are in Berlin you should definitely go there for the best Greek food in town!']

Name: Acapulco Berlin
Summary: Quesadillas, burritos & grilled meats, plus margaritas & tequila, in a vibrant, plant-filled space.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['The food is super delicious! And we got it quite fast. Friendly staff. Recommended.', "Was a decent place with some decent food. Service was ok but not bad either. Caught a weird vibe from the server, not polite but not rude. The type of service you wouldn't complain about but wouldn't leave a tip either.\n\nFound the lighting to be a bit too dim.. still, it wasn't a bad experience despite how I'm writing here.", 'The reason for the bad review consists on the strange and suspicious behaviour of a waiter who was insisting to make me Jump into a Car when he found I was waiting for an Uber. I paid the bill and activated the app Still in side the bar. He left the bar to the corner where it is the pick up point and started to conduct me to this particular bolt car saying that in Germany the Car plaque sometimes does not match the one disclosed in the app. I ignored but I recommend attention for Women who eventually go to this bar and find someone from the staff with the same behaviour']

Name: Cafe & Bakery Kosan
Summary: No-frills place for breakfast, open sandwiches & pastries like the classic "Berliner" doughnut.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Sunday: 7:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ["If I stayed around here I would visit every morning. It's good priced, good taste, and different from the kind of breakfast that can be found in other places in the world. I'm not in Berlin to eat English breakfast or pancakes, so this was perfect.", 'I went for a long walk and started feeling cold. By chance, I stumbled upon this charming café on my way. I decided to step in and ordered a small coffee for 2 Euros. The owner greeted me with a warm smile and was incredibly welcoming. As I entered the café, I noticed a sign that truly warmed my heart. See attached picture :)', 'Finding a place to have a cup of coffee + WiFi early in the morning is not easy in Berlin but we were lucky with this cute place. Staff is very friendly and welcoming and they make great coffee. Breakfast is delicious - omelette with vegetables + fresh bagels. You can also have many different pastries and all of them seem fresh. Prices are reasonable and WiFi works great. 5/5 :)']

Name: OM Coffee & Brunch
Summary: Specialty coffee, breakfast & brunch place with a view over historic Frankfurter Tor.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['Fantastic place! It was really very nice and extremely delicious! We had eggs on bread and cottage cheese pancakes! Both dishes were very tasty! Cappuccino was nicely strong. You can pay by card there.', 'I totally recommend this coffee shop! They make awesome handmade cakes - always fresh and delicious. Staff always kind and nice. Simply perfect.', 'One of my favorite places for savory breakfast items, cakes and coffee!!\nVery satisfying flavors and atmosphere is good as well!']

Name: LION Burger & Steak
Summary: Creative burgers cooked on a lava stone grill, plus fries & homemade lemonade, in a US-style diner.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['None']

Name: Pizzeria Meyman
Summary: Quaint Italian restaurant providing wood-fired pizza, plus casseroles & pasta dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Ordered the 28. Pizza Mista (top) and 30. Pizza Maymen (bottom). Both were cheap, excellent, and large. For 2 people I would recommend ordering a single pie. Staff was very friendly and gave us some espresso for free afterwards. Highly recommend.', 'Pizza was freshly made on the spot, and the service was amazing\n\nOrdered Mista Pizza and Lasagne Bolognse, and they were good', 'Unbelievable pizza and at cheap prices. The staff were patient whilst we chose what to order. Honestly this has spoiled pizza for me now because it will never be as good as it was here.']

Name: Mp3 Bar Berlin
Summary: Pizza, schnitzel & cocktails in an unpretentious, laid-back setting with sidewalk tables.
Reviews: ['Very good drinks, delicious food, nice and friendly staff, very good atmosphere, clean WC ... And cheap! Recommended !', 'Very relaxing pub with amazing service. Lovely in-keeper. A bit expensive in comparison to surrounding pubs, however it is definitely worth it, taking it all into consideration.', "Super friendly staff/waiter/cook. Good place to watch football. If they had the volume turned up it would be great. The food is alright for a pub like this. In my opinion it's above average. The cheerful staff stands out and turns this place into a great experience."]

Name: rembrandt-burger
Summary: Hip, exposed-brick eatery rustling up hefty burgers with thick, skin-on fries & housemade dips.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['I am speaking only of delivery experience, but nevertheless the food was just awful. I ordered a bbq burger with beyond patty, which actually costs more, but ok. So the burger came SUPER dry, the patty was almost burned! The bacon crumbled of the same reason, the cheese was so small, you could barely see the little square on the burger. The bread also was dry. The spice tasted like supermarket one… the fries were on the same level. 20 eu went to garbage and I couldn’t finish this burger even though dead hungry. Never again.', 'Good food, quick service. Quality was great, prices maybe on the higher end for the portion sizes but tasty food and definitely a recommended spot. We enjoyed the dips, the truffle-mayo was definitely a highlight and the fries were really good.', 'One of the best chicken burgers in Berlin, served with tasty fries. Cash or PayPal. Friendly staff. Higley recommended']

Name: Jäger & Lustig
Summary: Hearty traditional dishes are served at this rustic, old-timey restaurant, which has a beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['We stumbled upon this place, and loved everything about it. The outside seating is shaded and cool, our server Jack was funny and entertaining, and the food was out of this world. My husbands’ “homesick” platter was big enough to share. And the roasted pork was probably the best food we’ve eaten all week. The duck fricassee was a little disappointing; it lacked the rich flavor of the other dishes. But overall, ten out of ten', "We booked a table for two, hoping to enjoy some traditional German gastronomy. The food is fine, but the dishes are rather more simple than what I would have expected. The portions weren't too large. The meat is OK, overcooked with tons of butter to make it more tasty.
Only based on the food, I would probably give the place four stars. But our experience here was quite bad. I did my best to communicate in my poor German, but thankfully there was a waiter that sort of understood English.
Unfortunately, the waiter that served our table ignored us several times, left us waiting for quite some time and when we asked for some advice regarding the menu, the guy simply misled us. After being ignored for more than half an hour with our dishes empty on our table, when we finally managed to order dessert, the waiter informed us that the kitchen was already closed.
It was very obvious to us that we weren't welcome in that place and we sincerely regretted ever choosing it for our dinner. The place has some excellent reviews and several food blogs recommend it. But when it comes to sharing dinner with someone, food is not the only thing that matters.", 'Such a contrast between the “biergarten” and “restaurant” area.
The garden part is comfortable and beautiful, the service is always super lovely and the rotisserie chicken is absolutely delicious and perfect to have with your beer.
On the other side, the service in the restaurant couldn’t be worse. I’ve come here a million times and the waiters have always been rude, stuck up and snobbish.
Sometimes they don’t even acknowledge you exist. They apparently don’t like if you’re not German and under 50 years old. Funny attitude for a place in the heart of Fhain.']

Name: Föllerei
Summary: A creative fusion of German & French cuisines with an organic focus at a cool, cozy venue.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['This is a gem in the streets of Neukölln. Wonderful kitchen, modern twist to German ingredients, wonderfully salty, savoury enough, just perfect. Lovely staff, good wine. We will come back ❤️', 'Small restaurant with delicious food - very fine - in a relaxed neighborhood, small street. Had both outdoor and indoor seating. Staff was quite dry and had a very noisy dog. Only possible to pay with cash', 'Super friendly staff, good food, cosy atmosphere... We will definitely come back!']

Name: Knödelwirtschaft
Summary: Variations on knödel dumplings, including vegan options, in unpretentious surroundings.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["My absolute favorite restaurant in Berlin! My first visit to Knödelwirtschaft was actually 7 years ago when I was last in Berlin, and I have thought fondly about my meal there ever since. I had the pleasure of visiting Berlin again last week and coming back to this restaurant was my top priority.

This time I tried the beef goulash with 1 liver dumpling and 1 paprika dumpling (paprika was the special dumpling of the day). Both dumplings were incredible and the beef goulash was even better than I expected. My boyfriend had the boiled veal with a cheese, a bacon, and a spinach dumpling. It was the perfect meal to enjoy together for our last evening in Berlin.

In addition to the yummy knödels, the atmosphere is super cozy and the staff are very warm and welcoming. I love this spot because even as a visitor from New York, it gives the feeling of dining as a local at home in your own neighborhood.

I highly recommend Knödelwirtschaft (both this location and the second 'North' location which I also visited last week) to anyone looking for a delicious and memorable meal in Berlin. I am already looking forward to my next visit!😋", 'Absolutely spectacular. I’m here in Berlin for the first time, and the first time in Germany as well. If you want to eat traditional German food, you can’t miss this place. It’s located in a quaint but lively neighborhood, and the vibe inside the restaurant is incredible. Large wooden tables and warm candle lighting, extremely friendly staff (who speak great English as well). We had no idea what to expect, and wow was the meal incredible! In 2, we split the plate of beef goulash with 1 dumpling added, and it was definitely enough for two people. The sauce was delicious, the dumplings full of flavor, and the meat was so tender that it fell apart with just a fork. The meal came with a salad plate of pickled veggies: cucumbers, sauerkraut, beets, etc. I wanted to try dessert too, but I was too full. I would highly recommend checking this place out, the only thing is that it is cash only, but so is most of Berlin, so make sure you bring cash!', 'Very authentic food and atmosphere, one of the best German restaurants in Berlin. Condensed menu makes it very easy to select correctly.']

Name: Eins44
Summary: Creative European fare in a high-ceilinged old distillery with bare boards & tiles, plus a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Amazing place. The atmosphere and place is super unique and pleasant. Being a little hidden in a court makes it very special. The food was really good and fresh, taking the wine pairing truly makes the experience complete. The service was perfect, they paid attention to every details and change thing according to our preference and dietary restrictions.', 'Our dining experience at Eins44 was incredible. I highly recommend coming to Neukölln for a visit. We were able to be seated on a weeknight without a reservation.

It’s a bit tricky to find, as it’s around the corner on the inside side of a building, as a former rum distillery. Once inside, it’s a beautiful, innovative, high-ceilinged tiled space, with lots of wood, green, and industrial elements.

The servers are extremely knowledgeable, friendly, set in ensuring your experience is excellent, and yet laid back. Great music too.

I highly recommend the 5-course menu with wine pairings.  The menu changes with seasons. They source exceptional local produce. The wines are mainly Pfaltz/German, and some from Austria and France, especially Alsace and Burgundy.

We can’t say enough about our excellent evening here.', "We had a very good time in Eins44. The atmosphere is a little industrial chic and it's still kind of laid back, although fancy. Service is great and not too reserved, fun to interact with. The food (we had a four course menu) was delicious and had a nice variety. The wine was good. The whole experience was just not exceptional, as you would hope for that price category. Therefore 4 stars in total."]

Name: Beuster
Summary: Deli platters, steak tartare & mussels, plus creative cocktails, in a hip space with retro stylings.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['The frozen rose in summer is fantastic, but the food is nothing to write home about. Advise against getting the tartare, which is quite chunky and chewy. The pulpo and ceviche were nice, but I was generally unmoved by the rest of the menu. Service and ambiance are great, can def recommend for drinks with friends. But maybe eat dinner elsewhere.', 'Mussels & frites are a great combo and perfect to share. The aioli is incredible. Good wines and service.\nThey take bookings.\nGood for a date or with friends', 'Tasteful and Cozy interior, good service. A reservation is needed, otherwise as a walk-in you get a 2 hours limit, which can be tight, if you want to have also more drinks. The food was really good. The duck-leg especially was great. And the tartar was good. A bit too small portions, but this is unfortunately always the case in most fancy restaurants. Card payments also possible.']

Name: Kalle Klein
Summary: Classic & creative pizzas, plus flammkuchen & pasta, at an industrial-chic spot with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ["It's a really nice place. I went there at sunset  and they have benches outside and in front of the restaurant their is a river. It was an amazing experience. The drinks were  very good. They also have an see through kitchen too. The waiter are not the best but overall experience is nice☺️", 'We can only recommend this location for a spontaneous dinner or for a larger group. We had a reservation for a party of over 50 adults and 20 kids and the experience was great - staff was very friendly, they were really flexible with choice of food and beverages served for our group. It was a perfect location with kids, opposite of a wonderful playground.', 'Service was very friendly, food unfortunately very poorly executed. Asparagus soup was very fatty and had little flavor, mozzarella salad unfortunately very poorly seasoned. Given the prices they charge, the quality was below average so I am disappointed.']

Name: Sorrel
Summary: Cozy bistro with a stylish vibe serving coffee & pastries, plus locally sourced seasonal fare.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews:
['Chill atmosphere, with a minimalist style offering tasty small plates to share. Everything we tried was delicious, although a bit on the pricier side. Service was super fast, we instantly got a bottle of water along with the menus, and the server, and food later came out really quickly.
This place does get really packed on the weekends and evenings so make sure you get here earlier.', 'This place has a unique menu which i really love. Food was delicious, service was amazing. Love the ambience. 10/10

P/s i highly recommend the fried potatoes!!!', "This brunch meal is truly exceptional. The flavors are perfectly balanced, never overwhelming, and the sweetness is just right. The presentation is charming as well. If possible, I would return daily, as the service is incredibly friendly and inviting.
They have seasonal menu and I’m not sure if the croque madame is fixed or seasonal, but if you see it in the menu please try it! Same for the French toast!

Edit:

I couldn't resist coming back to this amazing restaurant just three days later. I had cravings for their French toast and wanted to try their schnitzel. This time, I brought a friend, and we ordered one of their breakfast options for two. The food was just as good, if not better, than my first visit. Even though I was visiting Berlin for only five days from New York, I made sure to dine here twice. I highly recommend this place—it's a must-visit if you're in Berlin."]

Name: dots
Summary: Contemporary locale offering organic breakfast, lunch & cakes, plus vegan & gluten-free options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 5:00 PM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews: ['Cute café, good service, and good food. The Monte Cristo Panini was great, nothing special tho, didn’t come with salad.', 'Had the gluten-free pancakes and they just tasted like fluffy eggs. Basically a fluffy omelette in flavour 🤢 unfortunately I don’t like eggs so I couldn’t eat them. Left unsatisfied and it was super expensive too! Bummer because I was hoping to find a good gf local.', 'Incredibly overpriced. The iced cappuccino (4,10€) was okay, the iced matcha (5€) mediocre at its best but super average plain guacamole bread slices with some salad leaves on the side and the tiniest tomato salsa for 16,50€?! In other places you get a full meal for less than that. Gentrification at its best.']

Name: Life Berlin
Summary: Noodle soup recipes & cocktails are offered in this pared-down Japanese restaurant with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM
Reviews:
['I did not expect to find such good authentic ramen in Berlin.

I wish they had other types of noodles like Abura Soba or Tsukemen as well.

But all in all it was delicious. Staff was nice.

Will come back for more.', 'Biggest regret was not to come sooner. 2 years ago our Japanese friend brought us here to eat Karaage saying that it was the best Karaage in Berlin. We always wanted to come back, but we never got the opportunity.

We’ve returned today and oh my god is this place good. We had a bowl of Shoyu ramen and a portion of Karaage. The Karaage still amazing, really crunchy and juicy.

However, the ramen was the surprise. Nice umami without to heavy. It wasn’t too salty either and the noodles had a great bite to them. Cashu was very tender and juice and had a nice flavour to it.

However, the only component I didn’t like is the eggs. I prefer my egg yolk more in the jammy side and less on the hard boiled.

Overall, amazing spot.', "best karaage i've had in a while, the sauces very good (i recommend you get the tartare sauce as well). vegan tantan has the depth i've missed in many other places. would like the topping to be a bit more flavourful than just crumbled tofu, and i personally would like it spicier."]

Name: Antica Roma Treptow
Summary: Traditional Italian restaurant prepping pizzas & pastas in casual surrounds with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Overall the food are really delicious. The place was clean and beautiful. Just one thing, the server needs to smile more :)\n\nWorth to try! And we will come back ❤️ keep the good work!', "Horrible experience. The place was full, I get it, but we ordered sparkling water to drink and still it took the waiter around 30 min to bring that (after being reminded of it, of course). Then we waited for another 20 minutes to get the food we ordered. The pasta I ordered was honestly terrible. Tasteless. Very bland. Then another 10-15 minutes to get the check and pay. I'll never set foot on the place again. The only good thing about this place is the location :( (right in front of Treptower Park).", 'Came and asked if we could just have a beer, they said they were fully booked even though they were completely empty at 4:40pm. I pointed out there was nobody there and they said we could have a beer if we were out by 5. We then decided to have a diavolo pizza which was ok. Ended up leaving around 530pm and the place was still empty. Offensive phrases on the menu. Overall really unpleasant service and not worth it.']

Name: Mauersegler Berlin
Summary: Down-to-earth beer garden dishing up burgers, fries & currywurst amid a lively ambiance.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["Visited Mauersegler Berlin during the Champions League final in 2024, and it was an incredible experience! 🏆⚽️ The place is an open-air venue, which added a unique and enjoyable atmosphere to the event. 🌳🍻 There were plenty of good drinks available, and the space was more than adequate for watching the game comfortably. 🍺📺 The ambience was fantastic, with a vibrant and energetic crowd that really made the night special. 🎉👏 If you're looking for a great spot to enjoy sports events or just have a good time with friends, Mauersegler is definitely worth a visit! 🌟🏟️", 'Hi,

Thanks for your reply. First of all, I want to clarify that we were not under stress, so it's disappointing to see that assumption made about us. If your staff was feeling stressed, perhaps they need more support or a break, but that doesn’t justify being rude to customers.

To clarify the situation, we visited your place yesterday and ordered four drinks: two beers and two house lemonades. We intended to pay by card, as we only had €5 in cash. Since you require a deposit for the glasses, we needed an extra €3. However, before we were even served, a staff member impulsively insisted that we pay the deposit upfront.

My girlfriend then went to ask our friends if they had any extra cash. During this time, one of your "friendly staff" started mocking her and even called her a "gröserlig."

This kind of behavior is unacceptable, regardless of how busy or stressful the environment might be. We understand that everyone can have an off day, but we expect a certain level of respect when we visit an establishment. I hope you can address this internally so that future customers don't have a similar experience.

Thank you for your time.', "I visited this bar last week with my husband and small child, and our experience was highly disappointing. After buying drinks, we were sitting there for half an hour when, five minutes before the Germany game started, they abruptly kicked us out. They claimed the area we were in was reserved for their friends, despite there being no reservation sign and the place being semi-empty. We even asked everyone around if the seats were free, and no one indicated otherwise.

Our child was very upset, and we had to leave despite there being plenty of space available. To make matters worse, they only accept cash payments, which raises some questions in this day and age.

Most importantly, the staff showed zero empathy for a family with a small child who was clearly distressed about being kicked out. This is simply unacceptable behavior. If you're a family, avoid this place at all costs. They are neither family-friendly nor child-friendly, and their actions were downright horrible."]

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["I've been to maybe 10 Subways in different countries by now and this one had one of the best choices I've seen. The bread was pretty fresh too. Overall good.
On the other hand, my bread was torn before being used and it would have been better if the employees had changed it, but they didn't which made eating it a bit difficult. But nothing major.
Most of the staff spoke English too, so that's a plus.", 'Better than American Subway by far! There are so many options for the sandwich toppings including potatoes, chicken nuggets, and fancy sauces. The options also seemed nice and fresh. However, I wish they sold regular Doritos, but that’s not a major deal. As always the food was prepared quickly and it was easy to communicate as a non-German speaker.', 'Very delicate bread and filings.
Excellent service.
Music is not too loud.
The only thing missing is the toilet.']

Name: Domino's Pizza Berlin Brunnenviertel
Summary: Delivery/carryout chain offering a wide range of pizzas & a variety of other dishes & sides.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['I ordered Dominoes Delivery tonight and was extremely disappointed by the pizza that arrived. I asked for pineapple,corn and chicken in a make your own pizza and they did not put any pineapple. Unfortunately the pizza is also burnt :(
Additionally I also ordered make your own and put pepperoni on the pizza and the whole pizza was burnt and I wasn’t even able to eat it.

Please be aware if you order dominoes to go as this was extremely disappointing for me.', 'Frankly, the service is what takes off a star. 20 minutes waiting for a pizza. Not busy, just nobody at the counter. Otherwise, the pizza is great. The flavors are great and the taste never leaves me feeling like anything was lacking EXCEPT: MORE MEAT PLEASE. I feel like they do skimp a bit on the protein. Not good. Hence, 3 stars.', 'This is my third time but today The gnuner garden pizza was horrible and dry , no cheese..sorry to say but really disappointed !! Would like to have a replacement. You can clearly see in the picture thie pizza slices are hard and dry, such a waste of money and time.']

Name: Nguyen Kitchen
Summary: Sushi, noodle dishes & other Asian fare in a contemporary, family-run venue with outdoor seats.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['This restaurant serves delicious Vietnamese food. The atmosphere is pleasant and cozy. The staff is friendly and attentive. Moreover, the washroom facilities are impressively designed, reflecting a high-class approach to both style and cleanliness, adding to the overall quality of your time at the restaurant.', 'Great Vietnamese place. Quite cheap by European standards (10€/lunch), large portions, very good.\n\nOn pics are udon and avocado-something from the lunch menu and those were delicious. I eat quite a lot and a lunch portion was enough for me.', "Food is sure more fast-food (overbacked, etc.), but quite good, but service is very bad. Once the waiter was too lazy to wipe the table after rain for me. Today I asked the waiter twice to place an order, but they simply ignored me. The atmosphere is so-so, with a lot of people, from Wedding, and Gesundbrunnen, if you know what I mean. I won't come here again."]

Name: Taverna Hellas Wedding
Summary: Ancient Greece-themed venue with pillars & statues, for typical Greek grilled meats & baked dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["I stumbled upon this while looking for a good Greek restaurant.  so I drove to wedding from Berlin-Mitte.  The location is wonderfully kitschy as you would imagine.  I like that. Unfortunately, the food wasn't really special, just average.  The prices were pretty high, especially since the location is outside the ring.  Service was good.  In the end, the experience wasn't good enough to revisit.", 'Great food with vegetables and tasty rice in addition to meat. Plus they are super friendly and have lots of neighborhood history on the walls.', '10 out of 10 stars for this perfect nice clean restaurant. The food was delicious  even better that the one I tried in Greece.']

Name: Corallo
Summary: Relaxed restaurant with sidewalk tables featuring a long menu of homestyle Italian specialties.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['I appreciate that they offer gluten-free pasta! The service was a bit slow but nothing too bad, the food was delicious.', 'The pizza and pasta was delicious, the staff really cool, except the waiter who allowed himself to keep the change without giving me the opportunity to tip him.  So I asked for change without leaving him anything. Therefore, 4 stars instead of 5.', 'Great service and atmosphere! Most of the food (pizzas, spaghetti scampi, tiramisu) was excellent although some dishes e.g. tortellini were not so good']

Name: Osteria da Pino
Summary: Pizza, pasta & other Italian classics served in a venue with dark-wood chairs & exposed brick walls.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['A Family-owned authentic Italian restaurant with amazing service. You don’t have to wait too long for your meal and they have really good house wines. Overall i had a good experience here and i would be definitely visiting again.', "Very nice place with friendly atmosphere. Everything was tasty, but I'd like to highlight the grilled squid as it was very tender. A dinner for two with drinks and desserts was around 70€", 'Lovely little Italian place hidden in Sprengelkiez. I discovered a dish I did not know existed in Italian cuisine, shrimps in spicy chilli garlic olive oil sauce (real nice spiciness level). They have of course the usual pastas, pizzas, lasagna, etc. There is a bar which also serves good coffee. The atmosphere is nice and cozy. A good place for groups friends and/or family to share dinner time.']

Name: Pamfilya Restaurant
Summary: Rustic-chic establishment with a long menu of Turkish specialties, including doner kebabs & grills.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['First class Turkish doner restaurant serving many other typical dishes. Excellent.', 'Best döner kebab in Berlin. Amazing beef flavour and bread made in-house.', 'Best kebab veal meat quality I have tasted so far in Germany.

Bread was a bit to mushi on one point.   Sloppy toasting.
I suggest to take extra meat with your döner order.

And with 5.50 a bit on the steep side.

The ayran was fresh and tasty.

Overall really really good.   Almost perfect.  Actually 4.5 stars.']

Name: Shikgoo
Summary: Snug, offbeat restaurant specializing in bulgogi, bibimbap & other traditional Korean dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["The cutest Korean place I've ever been to! It is nice and cozy, with a little bridge inside the restaurant and a charming koi fish pond surrounded by plants. Upstairs, you sit on the floor and need to take your shoes off, making it a truly authentic experience. The food is delicious, and the service is both special and entertaining. The atmosphere is perfect for hanging out and chatting with friends.", "Incredible little gem!
I live around the corner and had never thought of walking in. It is a whole world of its own inside!
Not to mention how delicious the udon was...
Probably the best I've ever had (not an expert, though).
Keep in mind that spicy is spicy :) (but delicious and I would order it spicy next time too!)
I'll definitely be back", "It was super quite when we visited on a Sunday night had the entire room to ourselves. You can tell they dedicated some time on the interior. The food tastes pretty good as well as the rice and side dishes. Price wise it's few euros more expensive than other Korean restaurants around the area."]

Name: MARS | Küche & Bar
Summary: Light-filled hangout serving locally sourced cuisine for lunch, weekend brunch & evening snacks.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 9:30 PM
Reviews: ['Once you get over the fact that this is (inside/annexed/next to) a Crematorium AND a Cemetery, it is one of the most delicious brunches I’ve had in Berlin! The coffee (Americano) was exceptional, balanced. The vegetarian (Green breakfast) has a clear oriental influence and everything was delicious. The savory waffle plate was also a perfect balance of flavors. The interior is surprising; open and cozy. Still thinking about this place and unique vibe. The food was outstanding', 'Loved the atmosphere! Super friendly staff and food tastes great. Not your typical brunch menu as it combines different flavors but so nice on a summer day.', 'The atmosphere is really cool but the stuff was slow and the food is mediocre. Iced latte tasted like milk. Had to order an extra espresso shot to taste some coffee.']

Name: Lorenz Adlon Esszimmer
Summary: Elegant restaurant with creative cuisine, as well as views of the Brandenburg Gate.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["The quality of ingredients was good, but there seems to be a lack of empathy towards the guests' experience, particularly in terms of orchestration of flavours and textures between courses.

The location is impeccable, offering a direct view of the Brandenburg Gate. I guess that a significant portion of the price I paid was for the view rather than the food itself, though.

Overall, despite the high quality of the food, considering the price and the reputation, I was anticipating a more harmonious dining experience that delights the palate with a cohesive story through its dishes.", 'Incredible meal on New Year’s Eve. All the staff very knowledgeable about the (many!) beautiful unusual wines served with each course. It was all fabulous.', "Fancy dining experience with great views of the Brandenburg Gate. The food and service are fantastic, It's a bit pricey but worth it for a special night... How do I explain this better? -The food will cost you more than your flight to Berlin ;)"]

Name: Käfer
Summary: Fine-dining space on the rooftop of the parliament building, with city views & a modern German menu.
Reviews: ["Everything was totally top notch. Service was excellent and the roof top views cannot be beat. Food was beautiful and we'll presented but could have used a little more assertive flavors. Definitely make a reservation for a delightful lunch.", "It's not cheap, but it was well worth it. The food was fantastic! Remember to book in advance, arrive early, and bring your passport! You can also explore the Reichstag building roof afterwards.", 'A bit pricey, but worth it for access to the Bundestag (with a skip the line perk!) and the view of Berlin. The apéro meal had a preset menu, with a choice of dessert. I chose the pistachio cake which was good. The presentation of the dish was cute and chic, and surprisingly filling for being the cheapest thing on the menu. The apéro also came with a Prosecco drink. I was sat right next to the window with a view of Berlin and the TV tower in the distance. After having just done my audio tour of the dome, this was a great, calm spot to relax in the afternoon.']

Name: HABEL am Reichstag
Summary: Regional classics with Mediterranean spins, plus German wines, in a veteran, brick-vaulted locale.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 – 10:00 AM, Sunday: 7:00 – 10:30 AM
Reviews: ['Fantastic food and really lovely atmosphere', 'Interesting restaurant close to the Reichstag. I thoroughly enjoyed the meal with very tasty food in a brick cellar decorated by wine bottle chandeliers. The accompanying wines were delicate. As there were some lectures, the only con was the noise of the nearby underground, what made the speaker hard to understand. Nevertheless, a Berlin restaurant worthwhile visiting.', 'Place looks luxury, but surprisingly very cheap and delicious. Must have to visit!']

Name: Volver Tapas
Summary: A long tapas menu, plus wines & beer, in a colorful setting with a pueblo vibe & a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['I personally enjoyed the atmosphere and design of the restaurant. However, the tapas was too greasy for my taste which made me feel a little sick after. It wasn’t a bad experience but the food could be better for the price.', "Almodovar made a great movie of this name, but not a disappointment as this was. The place is nice enough, and the service is friendly if not a tad slow. All would be forgiven, and a favourable movie comparison made if the food was at least ok. Apart from the decent chorizo and the braised lamb (both very good), many standards of the region were let down. The sadly under heated and probably overcrowded oil fryer turned the patatas bravas into limp, pale, oily pieces. The calamari were perhaps beyond help before they hit the fryer, but these tiny critters (love to know the country of origin) emerged almost beyond edibility, so hard were they. The tiny prawns seem immersed in an oil that doesn't appear to be olive, and while not well flavoured, are in part raw, as the oil again is too cool to move. The bread is so far from the terrific bread of the origin, it's sad. No olive oil is offered with it. The peppers are similarly fated to oil death, though more edible than the other elements. It all sounds irredeemable, but I hope this was just a slow night...though seeing the smoking owner and dog just inside the kitchen area gives me pause. So should you.", 'Volver is a place that I often go to as I enjoy the ambiance there, from how the resturant is decorated to the love that is put in making the food. Is for sure not an average place with low prices so expect to spend some money when you go there. As well as the dishes are not huge, but that is the point considering is tapas -this way you get to taste so much good food. My most favourite are: the fried baby octopus and fried sardines, together with the green peppers , the tuna stakes and many more.
It takes some time for the food to arrive as the place is always packed with people, but from my experience, the food that takes more time to be prepared is food that is done from scratch and much better than many places that just heat up frozen food to serve.
I am a big fan of the starters they always offer, as the aioli and olives have the same amazing taste since the first day I visited Volver, which underlines the originality of the place. The wines are of very good quality as well and go very well with each dish you will be trying.
100% recommeding!!']

Name: BURGERWOOD
Summary: Compact pit stop with an unpretentious vibe offering fast-food standards, with vegan options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['I don’t know German so I could not tell the ingredients and i was in a hurry to explore the city so I asked for an Elvis Presley and when it arrived I noticed it did not have cheese (I love cheeseburgers) which made me sad for a second.

But as soon as I took a bite, oh my good, it was delicious. Well seasoned patty and mushrooms. A huge portion of fries that were crunchy and seasoned and condiments al and toppings were neat. Everything was really, really good.', 'Really tasty burger, portion size is also generous. Very happy to have discovered this place', 'Went to "Burgerwood", had a cheeseburger (medium rare) and chilicheese fries. There are many burger places like this one with comparable good quality. Prices range from 5.80€ to almost 10€ for 260gr.

Expect some queuing around lunchtime.']

Name: DIE EINS - Restaurant & Catering
Summary: Burgers, pasta & salads in a sleek dining room or at riverfront tables with views of the Reichstag.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews: ['I really do not know what to say, the service was terrible but funny, the cuisine was Italian but with too much persil and the prices were... Well you will have to try.', 'Good food for a fair price and good beer and a very nice server. The view over the Reichstag is a bonus.', 'Nice place at the river. Did not eat, but had some drinks. Slow service at the tables.']

Name: India Club Berlin
Summary: Stylish restaurant with a sophisticated ambiance serving traditional North Indian cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['Amazing food with the right amount of flavours in every bite. We were on a dinner date and really had the best Indian food experience in India Club. All the servers were really friendly and the Manager also gave us a complimentary salad. A must try restaurant in Berlin!!', 'Best place to enjoy Indian cuisine in Berlin!
Comes with a high price tag but trust me each penny spent here is well worth it.
Ambiance, service , cutlery everything was very nice! Can definitely recommend going here to celebrate a special occasion!', 'This is the most authentic and amazing Indian food I have tasted in Germany! Everything was delicious and the service was great. I had such high expectations and it seems to have cross its boundaries.
The drinks we ordered were supreme the mixologist had a great taste and mixing ideas.
Will visit again and recommend you too to visit.

#bowdowntothechef 💯']

Name: Wurst :-) am Brandenburger Tor
Summary: Street kiosk specializing in currywurst, plus other sausages, fries, beer & coffee.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 6:30 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 6:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 6:30 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 6:30 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 6:30 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 6:30 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 6:30 PM
Reviews: ["To be honest it wasn't very good, the sauce seemed to be plastic, the sausage wasn't one of good quality either. I have eaten better currywurst for less.", 'This place is great. You have to taste the original berliner curry sausage with fries or bread roll.\nThe location is great, like the prices.', 'Very good! I was exited for the famous currywurst when setting foot in Berlin and this place did not disappoint in the slightest. Loved the food, and the rustic vibe felt really natural and inviting. Really good, reasonable prices. Unfortunately there were no real vegetarian alternatives.']

Name: Pomodorino‎
Summary: Italian restaurant for pizza slices with classic & inventive toppings, plus pasta & tiramisu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Never forget to bring a cash with you, the don’t accept card payments.
Last time more than a year I was here. Still same delicious pizza, but this time I couldn’t find any oil on the tables. But in general I recommend here.', "Simple sliced up pizzas at affordable prices for a quick dinner night. Good vegetarian options available, although some could be quite bland and bready for one's liking.
Tiramisu was served from their restaurant next-door but was super yummy and definitely going back for it!
Ambience: Very loud, could be cosier. Super friendly staff
Payment: cash only", 'Real Italian pizza at very cheap prices but the taste is truly authentic
Like the interior design as well']

Name: Xigon
Summary: Japanese & Vietnamese dishes, plus Thai curries & cocktails, in an edgy, industrial-chic space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Very beautiful atmosphere. Sushis were great, drinks were great.

But the beef on egg? Something about the sauce, taste is very weird. Hopefully you guys make change. Otherwise great service. Waitress asked for improvements every now and then.', 'A mixed experience. The sushi and cocktails were absolutely delicious, with fresh ingredients and well-balanced flavors. However, the spicy beef dish was quite bland and disappointing.

The atmosphere needs improvement; there were spider webs on lamps and a thick layer of dust on some lamp shades, which detracted from the overall experience. On a positive note, the staff were super attentive and fast.', 'The Sushi was good, fresh, the tuna with truffle sushi was amazing.
Nice place is nice to sit outside.
One of the waiters was so rude and inpatient, made us feel as if she is annoyed that we are there...which is why I gave 2 to the service. The other waiter was so nice.']

Name: Saporito
Summary: Kitschy venue with an open kitchen & patio, serving traditional Italian fare & wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["Amazing authentic Italian with a nice terrace, better staff and service and special decoration! Let them tell you what's the best according to your taste. The menu changes every week.", 'This restaurant is definitely worth a visit.
The interior is very notable and full of many little interesting Italian items :)
The service is extremely friendly.
The food is delicious and they have a different menu every week. Antipasti plate was mouth-watering!', 'The place Italians take their visiting relatives to show them they are ok in Berlin! Have been here countless times and always the great delicious food you expect. They have a weekly menu consisting of 1 entree, 3-4 (made in-house, fresh) pasta dishes, 1 fish, 1 meat menu item and a desert.
From the larger menu, the Antipasti Saporito is highly recommended. If the Parmigiana is on the menu, jump on it. And personally, I would always recommend anything with their home made tomato sauce (ragout or other). And save some room for the Tiramisu 🫶.']

Name: Vux
Summary: Understated place with a wall of framed pictures, making vegan cakes, waffles & light meals.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['Always love visiting Vux, their vegan cakes are some of the best in Berlin. My favourite I’ve had there is the lemon meringue pie, but the cheesecake I tried last time was also super good - I think I ate the whole thing in one minute. The iced matcha was also lovely. Their savouries are also excellent if you’re looking for lunch, I particularly like the bao buns.', 'This is a super cute vegan cafe. The bagels were delicious, we got the seitan and the sun dried tomato chickpea. It was so hard to choose which cake to try, they all looked so amazing… but I went with the struesel and it was very good. Coffee was excellent as well. We will come again next time we’re in Berlin!', 'Lovely calm atmosphere with friendly staff. Amazing vegan cheesecake and cinny buns.  Coffee great too.\nRichtig coole Musik!!']

Name: Louis Café-Restaurant
Summary: Long-standing, retro-style dining room for Austrian classics, including massive schnitzels.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['One of the best spots in the neighborhood. Nothing fancy, just good beer and delicious home-cooked food. The "normal" schnitzel is far too big, but the small portion and the veal schnitzel are much better, in my opinion.', "Walked from our hotel to the Louis-Cafe restaurant and didn't regret it.
