Very friendly staff and the restaurant was quiet for lunch.  We chose an outdoor table in the shade and the light breeze made the temperature perfect.

We ordered the schnitzel (the big one😁) and it lives up to is name.  I'm a big eater and didn't finish half of it.   My wife and son ordered the chicken in mushroom sauce and it was great also.  We also ordered salads, but I missed the opportunity for pictures...

This cafe is definitely worth the walk and I'll be back here the next time in Berlin to try that schnitzel again", 'Unfortunately, this was not the schnitzel i was expecting. Upon touching it with the fork the crust was just falling off. Maybe the pork one would taste better. The classic wiener one was just bad (to put it simply). Sad 😔

Spent almost 30eur for schnitzel and 2 beers - was left disappointed to say the least']

Name: Cafe Rix
Summary: Laid-back cafe-restaurant in a converted dance hall with gilt-framed mirrors & freshly baked cakes.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews: ['Soup was amazing, the dishes were big and super tasty.\nWaitress was nice unfortunately she was a bit flooded with customers. Nevertheless she did a good job.\nWe discovered this hidden gem over Neo and we will definitely come back!', 'Giving 2 stars just because of the interior but very bad service. The waitress at the bar was very much disinterested in serving us. She looked very busy in some sort of paperwork. Also, be mindful that the place is not very hygienic for example. Our spoons with the coffee were picked from the dirty uncleaned basket of utensils and quickly washed off and kept on the plate. Disgusting !', 'Historic building hidden from the busy street just next to the metro station. Visited by locals rather then hipster expats. Traditional breakfast buffet on the weekend from 10 to 14-15, with simple but tasty and varied offerings. Coffee is not special but quiet good.']

Name: Villa Rixdorf
Summary: Meaty Berlin specialties, plus pizza & salads, in an 1870s villa with a shady beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Delightful place -  a little oasis.  Excellent service very quick, attentive and helpful.  Food was fabulous and all so reasonably priced.  Had the veal schnitzel with side vegetables and apple strudel from dessert.  Definitely go back', 'Great German experience with an extensive menu and many beer options.
Had the crispy pork and the eggplant gratin, both absolutely delicious. Fair prices, big portions and good service.
Definitely would recommend trying', 'I was here more than ten years ago and couldn’t quite remember the address. But thanks to a geolocated photo from all those years ago, I found it again.
I ordered a portion of Eisbein with a  hefeweizen. It was a splendid meal and a splendid location (once again).
I couldn’t nearly eat all of it, so I got a doggy bag with me.
The service was exceptional good.']

Name: Tulsi
Summary: Relaxed restaurant offering traditional Indian fare like butter chicken, curries & mango lassi.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['They did some fusion food but it was ok.
Starters were good but main dish was ok.

Although it was not crowded,we had to ask 2-3 times for bill and the guy never came up with bill!!', "Me and my friends have ordered rawuthar biriyani , the quality was too less , this was a bad experience for me.The restaurant is providing offer and they provide less quantity. I don't feel to waste my money again", 'Really amazing food and experience. Services are too good and friendly. Those who miss kerala food i strongly recommend Tusli Restaurant.
& mostly their Dosa be like home🤤']

Name: Jemenitisches Restaurant
Summary: Intimate eatery offering classic Yemeni plates & slow-cooked meats in a brick-walled dining area.
Opening Hours: Monday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Food was really delicious and it came very fast we order something called henez “حينيذ" and it was really well cooked and the meat tasted great. Also the rice was amazing. We also ordered white beans which was okay. Make sure to order their bread as it is very very good.', 'Went here for dinner with two friends and we really enjoyed our delicious meal. We sat in the floor seating area, which had cushions and was perfect to relax in after devouring our meal. I recommend coming here for delicious food, large portions, good prices, and low key ambiance 🫶🏼🇾🇪

PS I love the cute table covers. Very creative 💮', "The bread was a little too dense for my taste but it's freshly made and has nice charred marks.

The okra dish was ok, missing the punch.

The rice is flavorful and fluffy.
The lamb was fall of the bone and the star of our visit.

The lemon mint juice was amazing, with a shot of sparkling water it was even better.

I will definitely come back to try the roast chicken with red colored rice. That seemed to be the most famous dish when I looked across the resteraunt.

You have to order and pay upfront at the desk.

The food came suuuuper fast. It arrived even before the drinks."]

Name: Ristorante Italiano
Summary: Classic Italian pizzas & homemade pasta in a cozy venue with checkered tablecloths & outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Very good Italian restaurant (by Italian’s). Warm and friendly staff. Good service. Great food. Quality sizes and portions. Decent prices. We are here twice during our stay as it was convenient to our hotel. Both times the service and food were consistent and good the staff remembered us and gave a warm welcome.

Decent carbonara (although made with cream - as well as Parmesan & egg), good pizza, tasty tiramisu (light and creamy - slightly different to a heavy/boozy tiramisu). Good melon & prosciutto. Good coffee. Wine served by glass or caraffa.', 'Initially this restaurant was a pleasant spot with some good food, however the experience was spoiled by some poor service. It took 30 minutes for our drinks to arrive and a further 30 minutes for our bill to arrive after that. We were told when we entered that there was the option to pay by card, however when we came to pay the waiter aggressively told us no card despite having said we could pay by card before being seated. The only place nearby to get money out was a small store down the road which had a very high withdrawal fee on the ATM.', 'I ate there once and the food wasn’t anything special for the price. A frozen pizza from the grocery stores taste better than their pizza.

They recently installed some extremely bright lights outside the restaurant, that is totally nonsense for an Italian restaurant where you are supposed to have soft and comfortable lights. I leave close by and my eyes hurt when I need to look at these newly installed lights. It’s horrible.']

Name: Restaurant Blaue Adria
Summary: Traditional meat & seafood grills, fish dishes & Croatian wines in a relaxed venue with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
["Really nice hidden gem, that serves good sized portions and reasonable prices. If you like 3 types of meat on a nice hearty meal then this is the place to come. Mixed grilled meats with mushroom sauce reminds me of my mother's food - come here to make your mother proud and get your dose of meat, potatoes, and other veg 👍", 'Every time my mum visits me in Berlin, we never miss a visit or two to Blaue Adria. It reminds us of our holidays in Croatia! Food is excellent (not a place for veg though), the mixed grilled meat plates are all super tasty! Although we don’t speak German, the waitress is always keen to make an effort and make us feel welcome. We even have our own table at this point! We love the family-like atmosphere too. We always can’t wait to go back! ❤️', 'The perfect option for a lunch on Sunday. Good food, restaurant on very quiet location and outside the tourist area.

Prices are reasonable.
Beer around 3.5€
Pork steak and Cevapi around 12€
Pork meat with feta cheese inside around €14

You also get a free shot of Kruskovac.']

Name: Osteria N°1
Summary: Classic pizzas, pasta & grilled seafood entrees in an easygoing osteria with a leafy courtyard.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['There is a nice summer garden, which has some kind of natural cooling system, which makes it a good choice during hot days.
Though the food is quite pricy and has dissapointed with the taste and the way it was served.
I would recommend it only for drinks and bruschetta.', 'The hopes were high for this restaurant, unfortunately expectations fell short. There is a lovely garden and I recommend reservations if you care to sit outside.

Service was quite slow. We ordered a pizza and two pasta dishes, Pappardelle with pork, and seafood spaghetti. Both pasta dishes were rather bland and the pork was extremely overcooked.  For the price the food was very disappointing.', 'The inner garden is nice, but if you want to try proper Italian food, this is definitely not the place. Also the service can be messy and slow. Yesterday we had to wait 50 minutes just for antipasti.']

Name: +39 Piùtrentanove
Summary: Traditional pizza & pasta, plus wine & aperitifs served in a relaxed, airy, wood-accented space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ['Lovely place to spend the evening outside at in Kreuzberg. Great Tuna antipasti and a nice Buffala Pizza. Huge pizzas 🍕🍷 Next time the two of us would share one pizza ❤️\nVery friendly service.', 'Authentic Italian restaurant in Berlin. Recommended. The pizzas are big and the quality is really good. It has a good atmosphere both inside and outside.', 'food was really good, staff was nice and helpful. prices were also really reasonable. the limoncello in the house was a nice added bonus. Good place for a nice pasta in Berlin!']

Name: Café do Brasil
Summary: Brazilian cuisine & cocktails offered in an easygoing establishment with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['such a nice and chill atmosphere with good music! the coxinhas were really good as well as the guava juice. I also tried a risole de camarão which had a rich flavour too. Definetly recommend coming here!', 'Lovely small restaurant with good food and great service. The Moqueca was delicious. Nice people, live music and joyful Brazilians … Harun was particularly helpful as I arrived without a reservation and got the best seat in the house. Special farewell to Berlin on my part.', "On Google it is shown as opened but then you arrive and turns out they are on vacations.\nIt is easy to change it. Just do it. I just traveled from the other side of Berlin specifically to eat here and now I'm absolutely disappointed."]

Name: Golgatha Biergarten
Summary: Easygoing hangout serving breakfast, grilled meats & vegetarian eats, plus cocktails & draft beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
["Great location in a park. Loads of seating at tables/benches, swing chairs, upstairs patio.

We didn't eat but it smelled wonderful.

Friendly bar service.", 'Located in a beautiful park. Though it’s a bit small and tables are close together, making stroller navigation tricky, the cozy couches are a nice touch. The food selection is very good, especially the chili sausage, which is a rare find in Berlin beer gardens.', "It was 2 years ago, but we didn't like it. The vibe was sleepy chill. Young parents with babies and kids seem to congregate here. Most tables had signs saying they're reserved. It felt like an odd vibe. Babies took a stroll wherever, going into the restaurant, getting in the way of the servers, with parents not to be seen or didn't care because they were so involved in their conversations. They were okay with their kids throwing the biergarten's rocks onto the stairs and things or were not paying attention to their offspring that they cared. It was a very weird vibe. Go here if you have a baby, toddler, or very young kids. Beer was okay, person working there was very nice, it was pretty empty when we were there, odd, narrow spacing. Yeah, odd vibe. We didn't feel comfortable, so we left before finishing our beer. It felt like it was a place exclusively for young parents with small children or babies. Crawling around, stumbling about with parents carelessly in their own world. Very weird. Tired and depressing vibe."]

Name: The Luftbrücke restaurant
Summary: Asian & Western snacks share the menu in an offbeat setup with mismatched vintage furniture.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['One of the greatest places, the atmosphere is amazing. They offer only a few dishes but they taste really good. The service is very kind. If you are in Berlin you should absolutely visit this place.', 'Good spot with a mixed menu of classics and more exotic dishes\nSolid food quality in a very relaxed setup overlooking the street.', 'Wonderful cozy friendly place with reasonable prices and good comfort food.  The Shnitzel with fries was great.']

Name: Ariston Taverna Hellas Berlin
Summary: Restaurant with Classical pillars, a summer terrace & a smoking room plus a traditional Greek menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["The food was delicious, we ordered a mixed grill platter and all of them were delicious. I had Mousakka and I really liked it. I highly recommend it to those who like eggplant and potatoes. The napkins were very nice, attention to detail. We had our dinner outside so I can't comment on the inside of the place. The service was also very good, we were satisfied.", 'Even though the staff was really nice and friendly, I was disappointed with the experience. The Greek salad was bland making the meal unenjoyable. Unfortunately, both me and my girlfriend have also experienced stomach issues shortly after the visit, which raised concerns about food quality. I hope the restaurant takes this feedback to improve both their dishes and hygiene standards.', 'Me and my husband like the place. Big portion. Price is Expensive but worth to try. Keep up the good work. I order menu 43 Grilled lamb and my husband order menu 62 the Mix Grilled plate. Yummy!!']

Name: Domino's
Summary: Delivery/carryout chain offering a wide range of pizzas & a variety of other dishes & sides.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["Pizza's are very delicious friendly staff recommend it
Ajay ist the best", '5/5 for the pizza
Hollandaise Sause
Beef strips
Olives
3/5 for the strips
They were soggy :(', "Everything was ok, the pizza was delicious. The guy that took the order speaks english so I wasn't difficult to order."]

Name: Zum Ritter
Summary: Warm, homestyle eatery offering Croatian comfort food, plus a bowling alley & a covered terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ['A fantastic place for a tasty meal. The menu is large and the food is great. Who doesn’t love schnitzel and spargel? Luckily we were there for spargel season and we got to taste the excellent white asparagus sides.', 'The place is super nice, very cozy\nThe food was also very good both times we’ve been there, we even invited friends the second time', "A very upscale restaurant with traditional vibes. The food was good and potatoes tasted heavenly! Normally I am not a fan of potatoes, but it was really good. Drinks were good as well. It's slightly expensive compared to asian places in Berlin. It's worth trying! Great ambience and service!"]

Name: McDonald's Underground Station Osloer Str.
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews:
['There was a long  black hair in my cheesburger, which i discovered after biting into the burger and the hair got in my mouth. I was disgusted beyond words', 'Worst McDonald’s ever.  Don’t do it, you will be disappointed. Old food is served, extremely dirty.', "You need at least 10 minutes for the smallest things
They are too slow, only 2 people work in this shop. However, the staff is very nice, they are still very friendly!
My burger always came either crooked or with half of the cheese in the packaging.
The meat tastes like it was from my great-grandmother's grave, completely dry and
Not enjoyable, please go to Franz Neumanplatz"]

Name: Pizza Express
Summary: Chain pizzeria where chefs in striped t-shirts toss handmade pizzas in a relaxed space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews:
["We ordered a spinach and cheese pizza for take out. The gentleman was very patient with our newly gained German speaking skills (or lack there of). The pizza was reasonably priced, of good quality and very little wait time. The restaurant offers a wide variety of menu options despite being called Pizza Express. There's limited seating as it's a very small restaurant but well worth the visit if you're in the area.", 'My best pizza in Berlin ever!!!!!
1€ pizza and soup is so nice.
And this ship owner dad is so kind.
I love Pizza Express!
If Pizza Express should in japan, I would be eating every day!
I wanna go again! And I miss this shop dad!!!!!', 'Way too expensive and After you pay for your Food they tell you to pay Service Taxes. The food was cold and my pizza was served with some hair in it. The das After I went to the Restaurant I die get sick and had to stay in bed for a long, long time.']

Name: NEST Schank- und Speisewirtschaft
Summary: Bright all-day cafe-restaurant with stripped wood floors & a terrace, serving international dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Food was quite tasty and flavourful. Reasonably priced and affordable. There was no open buffet Brunch option. Service is quite friendly and nice. No complaints, all over a good experience.', 'We went there for brunch on a lovely Sunday morning. Lovely menu and good food. They almost forgot our order, and we waited for about 40mins for the food. Staff were kind enough and offered coffee on the house. I appreciate the gesture.

We ordered
Scrambled eggs and eggs Benedict: very good portion and balanced taste.

Do visit!', "Actually a good location to meet up and the place itself is quite interesting. Had a cappuccino here with a friend. The cappuccino itself was alright. Some people enjoyed lunch, which is offered as well. The prices are avarage, depends on what you get. Staff was bit disappointing. Haven't seen anyone smiling and would have expected a bit more of politeness. Well, another Berlin-style place. Besides fine. Visit it and see yourself if you like it."]

Name: Ta’Cabrón Taqueria
Summary: Burritos, quesadillas & enchiladas, plus tequila cocktails, at a mellow, colorfully decorated spot.
Opening Hours: Monday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['The food is super delicious. Cochinita pibil is my favourite. The chili sauce goes well with all dishes we ordered, really recommend if you also like spicy food. Service is very nice. Music makes me wanna dance. A great Saturday night, all in all.', 'The food is so good - tacos, nachos and drinks (margaritas & cantarito)were delicious! The place is authentic, you have typical latin music und the staff is friendly.
You have Selfservice, but they bring the food to your table:)

It was really easy to make a reservation via instagram dm.
You can pay only with cash.

(The sanitary facilities were not so clean, here are some areas for improvement).', "Amazing home made mexican food by true mexicans. I had the potato and nopal quesadillas but also managed to try the enchiladas with a red sauce that was made with chile ancho.
I trie the burrito with mole and chicken. My favorite was the quesadillas, my sister's was the enchiladas and my girlfriend's the burrito with chicken and mole.
We got some cochinita pibil tacos as dessert. Good environment and amazing service. I recommend it 100%!"]

Name: Bar Raval
Summary: Stylish bar with sidewalk tables, serving up tapas, seafood & vegan dishes, plus Spanish wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['A chill place with a relaxed vibe and easygoing staff that made us feel right at home. The food and drinks were great, and we had a fantastic time just enjoying ourselves. I highly recommend trying the beetroot with goat cheese—it was a standout dish! Overall, a great spot to unwind and enjoy some good company.', "Cozy and warm Tapas Bar in the heart of Kreuzberg. Wines and service are excellent. You can sit outside and just have a nice glass of wine with some sweet nibbles. Love how welcoming and approachable the place is, even though it looks much fancier it is quite affordable. Standouts were the goat cheese, the octopus and the Croquettes. Though I felt like some of the dishes lacked a little seasoning. But what the food lacked was made up by the warm service and atmosphere. It's the perfect place for a catch up with a big group of friends!", 'Beautiful gastro bar with very friendly staff and most of all great food. The cava list is also very well stocked, highly recommend for a nice aperitif or a dinner with friends']

Name: Sumak
Summary: Spicy tantuni wraps, stuffed flatbreads & other Turkish meals at a casual stop with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['An amazing place, very cozy, the terrace outside is clean. The prices are affordable and the portions are big. They also give you the bread:)', 'Right on Oppelner Strasse, Sumak is a very lovely place to have a super breakfast. On a sunny day, you can enjoy the tables outside and some Menemen, which is one of the specialities of this place. Menemen with sucuk and Menemen with cheese are both extremely well done. You can get a can of Turkish tea which around 7 Euros and perfect for 2-3 people for the entire breakfast. They also have several full breakfast options with fresh boiled eggs and delicious olives and even Pastirma. Don’t forget to top it all with a Turkish coffee at the end.', 'Really good food and very nice people.']

Name: Hopfenreich
Summary: Intimate, easygoing bar with an extensive range of craft beers on tap, including Berlin brews.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Very cool spot in Kreuzberg for a good range of craft beers 🍺 I enjoyed every sip of what I have tried. The place is also pretty cool and chill.', 'Great craft beer bar, wide selection, clearly shows Berlin based beer. We went twice and excellent service from all staff, quite quiet, but a nice atmosphere.', 'It is a beer place and it should be treated accordingly. The atmosphere is simply awesome, the vibes are so cool and it just feels good here chatting over a beer. It is a disruptive place with good beer, nice staff and good people. They allowed us to bring our own food and I believe the combination of their beer and Burgermeister burgers has added to this experience being hard to forget. Highly recommended']

Name: Gong Gan
Summary: Fried chicken, bibimbap bowls & bulgogi BBQ in a quirky eatery, plus LEGO bricks on the tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 3:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['It’s more of a Korean fast food joint featuring fried chicken and limited Korean dishes. It wasn’t really packed when we dined but somehow 1 order of fried chicken and 1 veggie bibimbap took 30min+ I would say taste is passable mediocre at best.', "As a Korean, I deeply respect their service and food quality. Highly recommended!

1. Makgeolli (rice wine):
Well-preserved and served at the right temperature in a half-liter wine glass bottle—a clever presentation.

2. Chicken wings:
While the wings didn't seem fresh, the frying and seasoning were excellent. The amount of sauce was well-balanced with the fries, maintaining a satisfying crunch. Despite the soy and chili sauce, the fries retained their crispiness. Reasonably priced.

3. Seasoned raw beef (Korean Tartar):
Served as a complimentary treat, the Korean Tartar looked amazing, though it was temporarily unavailable. The owner graciously offered a small taste, and it was mouthwateringly tender. Highly recommended to try soon.

4. Bulgogi:
Impressively nice with beef’s freshness and quality exceeding expectations. Proper saltiness, though a slight concern about sweetness for foreigners. Considering the high quality and portion, the price for two people is justified.

5. Red bean paste on snow (dessert):
Evoking childhood memories from Korea, the dessert showcased well-organized quality, quantity, and decoration. Enjoyable even when already full.

Overall, a strong recommendation from me as a Korean.", 'Nice korean restaurant with lovely staffs. I enjoyed all plates specially main meat course and chicken.']

Name: De Noantri
Summary: Italian mains & a wide pizza selection with vegetarian options, served in a contemporary space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM
Reviews: ['Pretty good. I had the eggplant parmigiana which was great and the fennel salad (ok). My partner had the carbonara which was good and a generous serve. Panacotta desert good. Friendly service, good place to watch the EURO football games.', "Pizza was so good! We sat on the terrace which was really nice, service was fast and very helpful. Definitely going again. Need reservations on the weekend it's very packed.", 'We are big fans of your restaurant for a couple of years now – when you were still at Görli we came almost weekly. You have really nice pizza and atmosphere. But please do not deliver panacotta like this. For example, there was a smaller container for the bread – why not use that one? We were quite disappointed with how our desert arrived here.']

Name: Sadhu
Summary: Spicy curries, tandoori dishes & samosas at a relaxed, lively Indian/Pakistani venue with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['One of the best Indian restaurants i have tried in Germany, I ordered beriany and it was really really good, and the hot sauce I have ordered was surprisingly spicy!\nAnd service was excellent and the workers are super nice! :)', 'The portions are very generous, I recommend splitting the dishes in two. The staff is very nice, the food is very good, especially the sauce and the dressings. Excellent quality/price ratio.', "Best curry we've had in Berlin! Enough spice, flavourful and great service 👍"]

Name: Faro
Summary: Cozy hangout specializing in Spanish tapas & sharing plates, plus thoughtfully sourced Iberian ham.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['In my opinion lots of room for improvement, most tapas have frozen food taste and come in small portion size whether, whether small or medium sized tapas. 40 euros for  4 tapas for 2. Too salty most of them, and too oily.', 'Cute and lively place. I shared a tapas plate for 2 with my friend, and the staff was very lovely switching the red meat to other dishes. Food and wine was good. I would gladly come again!', "Food very mediocre, and not very authentic. A little overcooked, too dry, sauces with very little 'cariño'. Service friendly and quick, place itself cosy."]

Name: ernst
Summary: Innovative tasting menus using local produce in an intimate 8-seat restaurant with an open kitchen.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["I'm really sad that Ernst is closing. We visited for the 2nd time since the renovation for their beef menu in January. It was equally stunning as their other seasons. The staff were a bit more chatty as well, which I appreciated because it adds quite a lot to the experience. I dare to say that it is the only actual serious restaurant in Berlin and I'm sad to see it go. Hope to visit one last time before closing.", "My expectations were extremely high. There is a lot of noise around this restaurant across Germany,  Europe and beyond. I was a bit skeptical to be honest, but wow, did they deliver. 5 stars in every aspect. Only downside might be the wine menu but it's always difficult for younger restaurants and you can't compare them with the legacy ones. And the pairing was still very nice. The 30 (or more?) courses were fantastic and I loved every single one of them. There is a clear red line through the menu, the quality of the products is outstanding, the atmosphere is very homey and the staff including the chefs give you a feeling of being welcome in their kitchen and are happy to answer any questions. It's crazy that they do double seating and deliver on such a high level twice every night. Courses in June contained a lot of fish, fresh veritable and fruits and two courses of lamb. Great balance, great creativity, not too creative (right on the edge), very high skills from all over the world. Go there, have a blast, you won't regret it. Worth every cent. Dylan even spend 10 minutes with me at the end sharing his travel suggestions for Vancouver.", 'What an amazing experience. This 8 seat restaurant takes Japanese omakase and combines it with seasonal ingredients from the greater berlin area.\nThis leads to an 30-40 course menu (depending on the season) you will spend multiple hours eating little bites and chatting with the chefs. We had an absolut blast here.']

Name: Falafel Dream 2010
Summary: Casual retro food truck with indoor & outdoor seating offering wraps & bowls, with vegan options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!
We tried halloumi and chicken wraps (with garlic sauce out of this world!!!). We loved it! Super tasty, freshly made and awesome interaction with the Boss! Highly recommended!
Gonna be back soon!', 'The crispy chicken wraps are amazing and halal. Have it as a bowl with plenty salad and potatoes is amazing as well. The remoulade sauce and spicy sauce combination is the best to go with the crispy chicken.

The owner is very friendly and gives a really great atmosphere while preparing the food.', 'The food here was pretty good but they should take a little more care when they put it all together. The falafel was a bit dry and cold as were the potatoes. It could have been much better.']

Name: Rutz
Summary: Chic dining venue with creative, international dishes prepared by renowned chef Marco Müller.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Simply fantastic, this was the best dining experience I’ve had. The food was light and fresh, the flavours were excellent and the many different cooking techniques were perfectly executed. The service staff were super attentive and the wine pairing was amazing. The service was tight but not impersonal. I have only one word to describe the experience, impeccable.', "Dining at this three Michelin star restaurant was an unforgettable experience. It was indeed very expensive, but for us worth every penny. The service was impeccable, with incredible attention to detail. The sommelier was fantastic, enhancing our dining experience with expertly chosen wines. The food was outstanding—each dish was not only delicious but also had a remarkable texture, showing the chefs' dedication to the textural experience of each meal. The restaurant's focus on local products was evident and added to the overall quality. While the price is significant, the exceptional service and exquisite food made it a night to never forget.", 'Indeed, a remarkable culinary experience. Local ingredients are artfully transformed into innovative dishes. The staff is both charming and knowledgeable, creating a relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere. It is no wonder they have achieved their (proudly displayed) stars.']

Name: Pantry
Summary: Innovative cuisine melding European & Asian flavors, plus creative cocktails, in a low-lit space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["Very nice place with intimate atmosphere. The staff is very friendly and attentive, plus giving good recommendations.
Food is on the expensive side but this is a place where you probably go to have a special dinner, so given the quality and presentation, it's worth having the experience.
Great place, would definitely return :)", 'What an absolutely fabulous dining experience!

Here you get what you paid for. We had 2 friendly and attentive waiters and the food was excellent. I ordered the half kilo prawns, expecting to make a mess peeling them. But no! The prawns were all deveined with the shells on and cooked in a delicious gravy - that’s the amount of attention you get on the food.

Highly recommended for a special dining experience.', 'Truly a superb balance between food, ambience and service.  The convivial leather 'banquette' seating and the feeling of cool space sets the tone. Reading the menu, you realize you made the right choice. Our waiter was knowledgeable, friendly and present when needed.  The first course selections were varied and all presented beautifully. Oysters were a nice addition as well, and very fresh.  The "200", their 200g steak offering, was very good, and the correct size after our arrray of starters. A solid listing of cocktails, traditional and otherwise, and a very decent wine list meant all of the food was well paired. Last but not least, the 'Death by Chocolate' dessert was outstanding, and offered several flavours of chocolate offerings on one plate.  A great evening, and worth the visit.']

Name: SpeiseKombinat
Summary: Polished Italian kitchen with a beer garden, emphasizing pasta, pizza, & grilled meats.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Solid 4. Was ok, to overcome hunger

They have special lunch prices for some dishes (the drink is not included)

The portion was gigantic

They accept only cash.', 'Simple food, well presented and served at a reasonable price. Keep some pizza crust back to feed the sparrows if eating outside. Nice atmosphere in the garden area.', 'Pizza was good, lasagna was tasty - but it’s more “Italian style” than the original Italian receipt.']

Name: Cô Chu
Summary: Vietnamese pho soup & lightly spiced curries at a busy pick with an open kitchen & wooden tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['We were super hungry after visiting the museum and we stopped at this cute restaurant. Food was absolutely delicious, service pleasant. We were sitting outside so it was noisy due to upcoming traffic but we could watch pedestrians and bikers. Terrific place for lunch.', "We visited around 2 pm and found seats available without a reservation. As we entered the restaurant, the enticing aroma of delicious food greeted us, and each table was impeccably clean. We ordered five portions and the kids' meals arrived in less than 10 minutes. Our drinks were served promptly as well. I was impressed by the quality of their service and food. Although the menu lacked pictures, it would have been nice to have some included.", 'Great service og tasty food. We had the spring rolls and dumplings for starters and they were the best.
Soup was fine with crispy herbs, and the duck was tender.
Nice drinks.
100 euro for 4 people incl drinks and water.']

Name: Bonfini
Summary: Homey fixture serving familiar pizza, pasta & desserts in an easygoing space or a garden courtyard.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Ate a delicious pizza here with colleagues. Great quality food and wines. Very friendly employees. We were outside in the garden behind the restaurant.

Recommended Italian restaurant. !', 'Penne pasta with buffalo mozzarella is really creamy and can melt in your mouth!
But keep some space inside of your stomach because the Panna Cotta with red fruits coulis on top is the real thing!
Also I recommend the Tiramisu, classic but still the best one! 🫶🏻', 'The only place to go for a real tomato soup. There was an incredible angus and the consistency of the sauce was perfect. See you again on my next visit to Berlin. I forgot his name but the waiter from Besiktas was very polite and friendly. The place is very characteristic. The music playing in the restaurant was great.

A very good restaurant to have a very good meal and spend a nice evening.']

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['I had a great experience here . Great food , great offerts , nice staff .', 'Great food and very affordable prices. Additionally, the service is great and the food is prepared\n\nin a very short time. Just great!!', 'The taste is unlike any other Subway I’ve tried either in America or Europe! ñam ñam :p try it ']

Name: Golden Rice Mitte
Summary: Pho noodle soups, spring rolls & curries, plus creatively presented sushi, in a stylish, airy space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["Open till 23:00 , Very friendly good service. Food is so-so. The price I paid I expected better quality.
But nice to have a drink and it's handy as just next to the hotel.", 'Dinner alone, 22€ for fried rice with crispy Duck, soup with salmon. Owner discount me 10% cause i can speak Vietnamese (I paid 20€). If u speak Vietnamese here you may have a discount as well 😂', 'Vietnamese food in Berlin never lets you down!

We tried a couple and this is one of the best. Prawns are so large - I ate them like chicken, and portions are big too.

Teapot with a side handle and tiny cups were a nice touch.']

Name: Petrarca
Summary: Warm, chandelier-lit restaurant plating traditional Italian dishes with creative flair.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Authentic Italian. Full of flavour. We had a lot antipasti and pasta. Trufflepasta was lovely. Go visit !!!', 'Lucky to have a really really good Italian restaurant just next to my house. Friendly staff good food. Elaborate wine list. Menu is concise. Staff speak English and are friendly. Only drawback is this venue does not accept credit cards or PayPal or any other means of payment except cash. But the food and customer service being good I would definitely come back.', 'Lovely small Italian restaurant, great food.']

Name: Pascarella
Summary: Glossy operation with an open kitchen serving pizza & pasta, plus meat & fish courses.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['We visited them during lunch time on weekday. They have good mittags menu. Food is good . It was a sunny so we sath outside but they have a lot inside seating area too.', 'Went alone on Valentine’s Day. Service was nice but could be improved. I like the food in general but median+ for black Angus fillet was a bit too hard (my bad). Wanted to have dessert but didn’t have the stomach. Loved the wines I had. ❤️', 'This is my second time here and I love this place! The service is very good and the food is amazing!']

Name: Bierstube Alt Berlin
Summary: Rustic 19th-century pub with weathered wood walls, local beers & covered outdoor seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['I really liked this place.  Despite being in a popular area of Berlin, it didn’t seem touristy.  It was mainly middle aged locals & a few travellers from the adjacent hostel.\nThe beer was really good, we’d already booked a table to eat elsewhere otherwise we’d have stayed longer.\nThe bar maid was excellent; funny, knowledgeable & friendly.  She even eventually agreed to sell me the Berlin Weisse without the sickly syrup!', 'good atmosphere and good beers.  Carlos made the party for us with good music.  To consider... smoking is allowed inside and the terrace closes at 10 p.m.', 'A lovely atmospheric bar in Chausseestraße, opened in 1893 and was my favourite bar in Berlin when on holiday there, the staff speak good English, were friendly and great to talk to with excellent customer service. I would highly recommend visiting for a beer and the experience of sitting in an historic old Berlin bar.']

Name: +84 Vietnamese Kitchen
Summary: Vegan rice paper rolls, dumplings & noodle soups at a Vietnamese place hung with red envelopes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:30 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["Really delicious food with a wide a large selection.
Maybe a bit too salty but otherwise truly flavourful and do recommend to get vegan food, it is clearly in an extra all vegan menu card so you can just take the vegan menu and don't worry about accidentally picking something with meat.", 'Friendly service and delicious food! They have a vegan menu and a regular menu.

Their spring rolls and vegan duck wraps were excellent, and the tough tofu was delicious as well!', 'Fantastic restaurant. Food is delicious and amazing value, service is friendly and fast, the menu is very impressive. Cannot recommend highly enough. Don’t miss this one!']

Name: Urban Spree
Summary: Trackside industrial complex hosting art galleries, dance clubs, food stands & a beer garden.
Reviews:
['Really cool spot to buy art, books and more. The lady that helped me was super sweet and explained a thing or two. Will visit again for sure. DO READ WHEN THE SHOP IS OPEN. The garden, shop and gallery have different visiting hours', 'Cute Biergarten, in a little green place on RAW Gelände.
There are many tables and places to seat, on a Saturday morning/lunchtime it was almost empty.
The place is nice to seat but the drinks are not worth the price. All soft drinks are around 4€, and from the alcohol stack that they have, the 9€-11€ cocktails can’t be that good.
Nevertheless, nice place for a sunny day.', 'Super creative and free spirit, nice museums and temporary art exhibitions, nice clubs and bars. Live graffiti and special events (eg Vans Shop Riot 2024)']

Name: Scheers Schnitzel
Summary: Hearty servings of schnitzel, chips & beer in a casual, industrial-look space with wall scribblings.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["Went looking for a traditional German schnitzel.  Was a small sit down restaurant but a fast food atmosphere.  Food was served on paper plates which wasn't a problem.  Not a lot of seating, but the schnitzel did not disappoint.  Options other than pork.  Fantastic!", 'Frankly the best Schnitzel I’ve ever had. I came to Berlin looking for the best Schnitzel restaurants and this one popped; with good reason. It is simple, self-order (offered in a manifold of different languages) with a great chill out atmosphere that suits this type of dish. The cooks will proudly show you how they batter the schnitzel and even how they make their famous potato salad (which is absolutely amazing). They offer Schnitzels ranging from Weiner meat to Turkey and everything in between. Same goes for the sides, what else do you need? If you are in Berlin and fancy a Schnitzel this is your place.', "Another nice restaurant with good food for a nice price. Funny concept, order via QR and pick up your drinks and food yourself. So, not a lot of 'service', but the staff is friendly.\n\nBig schnitzel in various ways, we loved it. Fries were a bit to salt, but that's forgiven. Very tasty fresh coleslaw en fresh made schnitzel."]

Name: East Side Bäckerei
Summary: Straightforward cafe dishing up informal breakfast & lunch fare, plus coffee & baked goods.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Reviews:
["The cappuccino had quite bitter taste. The nougat-croissant was good.
They have a good variety of pasteries.
The room is spacious, and it's cozy, not loud

They accept card payment (not amex)", "Very good place in Berlin Mitte, a nice variety of pastry and sandwiches.
Very good quality for drinks as coffee, tea, shakes, etc.

Would you like to discover the area of Berlin where this cafe is?

I'm a tour guide in Berlin!

Click on the link in my BIO!

Book your Walking Tour!", 'Never have I been more disappointed than this morning when I took a bite into East Side Bakery’s vegan chocolate muffin. 2.5 euros for the crumbliest, driest, and most pitiful muffin in the world. Never will I return.']

Name: Michelberger Restaurant
Summary: Airy venue for breakfast pastries, brunch & seasonally inspired dinner set menus, with a terrace.
Reviews:
['We came here twice - once for a light breakfast and once for dinner. First the good: there dinner service is delicious, but book ahead. Coffee in day and cocktails in the evening are also very good.

That said,tThe food in their cafe needs improvement. The quiche was delicious but still cold after it was heated. The poached egg was hard boiled. These are both things I would usually send back at a restaurant.

I’ll still give them 4 stars, but mostly for the dinner service.', 'Tasteful Patio where you can sit outside. Relaxed atmosphere where you can have a good evening. We went for dinner. Sharing meal concept. You have the option to go for menu (52€ pp) or a la carte.

We liked:
- the vibe and atmosphere
- friendly service
- some tasty food options
- good drinks

We did not like:
- small portions, you will not the same amount of appetizers as the number of menues
- some appetizers are rather bland
- 52€ menu cost for not even getting full', "I had a mixed experience at this café. The Basque cheesecake was fantastic, with the perfect level of creaminess and delicious flavor. However, the Chai latte left much to be desired. It had strange foam on top, and the latte itself was watery and lacked flavor, making it one of the worst Chai lattes I've had.

The service was a bit confusing. Despite wanting to order at the front desk, we were repeatedly told to find a seat and wait for staff to come to us. After waiting for at least 15 minutes without anyone attending to us, we had to approach the front desk again, only to still have trouble placing our order. Unfortunately, by the time the staff finally came to us, the cake my friend wanted was sold out.

On the positive side, the café itself is cozy, and the space is nice. Overall, while the food and ambiance were enjoyable, the service and Chai latte were disappointing."]

Name: Seoul Kitchen
Summary: Trendy, industrial-style restaurant offering Korean dishes & sushi, plus a take-out option.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Best food I’ve ever eaten (chicken BBQ and bibimbap). Great service. Tables are a bit small and it can get a little warm in there but food is 10/10. I want to come to Berlin again to experience their food again.', "Loved this place! Nice minimalistic atmosphere, friendly personnel and the food 👌So good! We had Bibimbap with beef, Japchae with chicken and Edamame. I'd recommend booking in advance, especially during the weekend", 'The bulgogi beef was absolutely delicious and tasted authentic, also a huge portion! Almost enough for two to share if having an appetizer as well. It came with rice and kimchi. Also had the appetizer of kimchi stew and it was amazing. Quite spicy so be aware. I sat outside so no idea what the place looks like inside.']

Name: Pirates Berlin
Summary: Down-home riverside restaurant with a terrace preparing local & global dishes, plus cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['It Is a great place for dinner!!! You can eat good food enjoying the river with soft disco music. The service Is very efficient Sandro the guy who served us was kind and quick with the order and the food arrived in few minutes. We Will come back soon.', "Popped in for a beer. Great location on the river. Friendly staff. Great views. Didn't eat but menu looked decent. Recommended. 🍻", 'Taste of the food is not special. Just ordinary. But the service and atmosphere was very good. The price is okay, affordable enough.']

Name: Haubentaucher
Summary: Cocktails, burgers & DJs around a large open-air pool in a revamped, mural-covered factory space.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 AM, 12:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['This is my favorite pool place in Berlin!
There’s usually a DJ and the music is great.
The bar never gets too full. Or at least on my visits. So getting drinks is quick.

Since they changed to Maaya, the food is now better.
The only thing is it gets really crowded than it used too.  There were way too many people at some points. To a point others couldn’t even find space to sit on their towels because there were no more free chairs or sunbirds.

My advise is go there early. Be there before they even open the gates. Even weekdays are busy.

Otherwise this place is really fun to visit!
I hope they will work on making it better. 🎉', 'Great place to chill and have fun. There is free entry, you can watch some sports on huge tv or for few € access the pool. The whole place looks like holiday resort and would not think this is in Berlin!
Love it here and cannot wait to come back again. ☺️', "I am here at MAAYA and the truth is that it is a downgrade, on the website it says that for 20€ on a weekday you can have a lounge beach chair and it comes with two drink tokens included (fair) at the door they tell me that for 20€ now it is only the lounge. if this is inspired by the diaspora as they say, how is it that now for the same price in return they give you less. Maybe the website is not up to date. Again if this is for the diaspora why keep old prices by removing benefits 👎🏽 , they have also removed all the floats. Downgrade, bring back Haubentacher who wasn't my favourite either but the prices were fairer. They have made a cosmetic change nothing more"]

Name: Markthallen Restaurant CLOSED
Summary: Cozy restaurant with wood-paneled walls & a long bar, serving German cuisine particularly schnitzel.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Great place! The food is very tasty (best Kasespatzle I've ever had!), the tap beer os delicious and the staff is super nice!", 'At previous visits to Berlin the restaurant was closed, perhaps for good I thought. I was pleasantly surprised when on this trip I discovered the place being open again.  Perhaps it is under new management, so I’m not paying attention to old reviews.

The room with a long bar and some single and communal tables was buzzing and the young and vibrant staff had apparently everything under control.
The menu is concise and covers all bases, so does the beverage list.
Weissburgunder, Grüner Veltliner were tasty. Crispy sourdough bread, oysters, veal tongue and as main course mackerel were fantastic.

There are plenty of restaurants in Berlin offering the usual fare, schweine haxen, schnitzel pommes frites etc.  this is not one of them.

This is a refreshingly “new” German restaurant with a farm fresh ever changing menu.  Hurray!', 'Nice veal schnitzel, service is quick for drinks. The bathroom is shared with Markhalle.']

Name: Café Restaurant Jolesch
Summary: Red-painted dining room with large artworks on the walls, serving Austrian cuisine & pastries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['I wasn’t too hungry so I just ordered a ceviche and did not like the carrots inside, why largely cut the carrots? I eat carrots normally but I had to fork out (literally) and segregate and eat all carrots in the end due to this mismatch of a dish.\n\nWe sat on the street table which was lovely.', 'Good food, fine, nothing special, but tasty. For me best schnitzel is in Vienna. For me 8/10. Great selections of all kind of gin if you like.', 'The veal schnitzel was delicious and crispy.  I loved the Basil Smash that was recommended to me as a drink! For dessert, we tried creme brule and apfelsturdel. Both were very good, especially apfelsturdel, which is a classic and should definitely be eaten in a place like this.']

Name: Baraka - Moroccan Restaurant
Summary: Traditional mezes, couscous dishes & tagines in a relaxed Moroccan-style spot with rough-hewn walls.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Not gonna lie, I am a foodie and we have a google maps list with 100+ places to go eat and drink, but this is definitely on top of my recommendations for anyone who visits Berlin.

The food is incredible nothing will ever top a good warm meal that was made like this, yes maybe trendy places and boozy slushies are what you want, but it’s not comparable to the best falafel I’ve had, don’t even get me started on the spiced rice with dried fruits!

We came here pretty late after not finding a place to eat and it blew our minds. The service was so nice too! Our waiter was super nice and came to ask if everything was alright with a big smile. Def coming back, thank you!', 'A very nice restaurant with tasty food. They have a big terrace with plenty of seats, so you don’t need a reservation if you’re not a big group. We tried Tajine Oase and Tajine Casablanca. The portions are big and the food is delicious. The service is fast and everyone is friendly. We also liked black tea with rose water. Definitely recommend!', 'I went to this place to taste Moroccan for the first time. We ordered a vegetarian plate for 2 people. The amount of food they gave was quite good. They also clicked pictures for us.']

Name: Cafe Morgenland
Summary: Corner meeting place, with sidewalk seats & a mirrored bar, serving brunches & a Mediterranean menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM
Reviews: ['Good food, price and nice athmosphere. The waiter was really nice.', 'This is a classic German "price performance ratio" spot. It may have been OK when it opened. Now that there\'s actually good brunch food in Berlin, it\'s outdated. The food is just OK, but it\'s relatively cheap, and that\'s all that a lot of people care about, unfortunately.', "It's almost impossible compared to just 3 years ago to find a nice place with a self serving buffet for brunch. Very friendly stuff and all the time refilled plates in the what could be only described as grab'n'stuff room. We were most likely very lucky as someone just left and we got the table i a blink of an eye. But after seeing sad faces standing at the corner, I'd suggest a reservation 🤷\u200d♂️😉 The price of 17 euros is in my opinion totally fair considering the variety you find."]

Name: Miss Saigon Restaurant
Summary: Vietnamese specialties & standards, plus many vegan options, in a casual, colorful venue.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['I went to Miss Saigon after a solid recommendation from my boyfriend about their Pho and Bao bun, and honestly, I was very happy with my choice of going there. This place is a gem and it is my second time there.

The Pho Bo here, priced at around 12€, is a flavor bomb - rich, aromatic, and loaded with fresh herbs, solid 8.5/10.
Marian (that is the name of my boyfriend) went for the Bún Bò Huế at 13,90€, and it actually took the leadership of "best dish for the night" after my already impressive Pho Bo. Even though I strongly recommend the Pho, you wouldn't not be sad by choosing this soup =D

We also tried the 4,90€ Bao bun. While it didn’t top the charts compared to what I’ve had back in São Paulo (my hometown), Marian’s enthusiasm for it was infectious. In Brazil we have a huge chinese/japanese/korean community and Bao is chinese so over there it is just better (in my opion, of course).

This place just don't get the 5 start because when we went there, there was a table with 1000 kids screaming and that took a bit of the magic away from our dinner. Not their fault, I know, but was our experience.', "Nice medium sized Vietnamese restaurant with an elaborate menu (not only what you get everywhere, daily specials) and reasonable prices. Seems that salt is missing in every food but then they say that's typical for Vietnam - and there's soy sauce available.
Really friendly service. Quite noticeable for Berlin! And a nice outdoor sitting area if the weather allows.", 'Nice Restaurant with outdoor seating. Menu is ample, service was quick. Liked the appetizers, though the summer roll was not up to par. The pho was not as good as I hoped after reading the reviews']

Name: Mercan
Summary: Rustic Turkish dishes like lamb & yoghurt meatballs in a simple family-run restaurant with a patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Excellent food, I especially liked the rice. Affordable as well. Free tea when we dined in.', 'A great little local Turkish place. No menu just eight dishes of that day which you can choose from, both meat and vegetarian options. Dishes are served with a selection of rice and salad. Brilliantly simple and effective. I had kofta in eggplant and it was delicious. All the comments about home style cooking are right.', 'Home made healthy (and vegan also available) delicious authentic meals with pleasent workers. I think all in one sentence :P BTW, Don’t forget to order a free a Turkish tea!']

Name: Café Quitte Espresso Bar Kreuzberg
Summary: Laid-back venue for espresso drinks, pastries, housemade cakes & light fare like bagels.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
['We went with friends for a coffee and we discovered a nice place with a nice atmosphere, very delicious cakes and fresh  and the most beautiful thing is that the coffee has art on it. Very good service and very kind the guy who attended. You can talk with your friends because the music is not so loud  so if you want to chill with good food you can come here.', 'We tried some croissants and had drinks.
The food and drinks were ok, the service and the ambiente good.
Maybe the other food options are more special.', 'Nice place in Kreuzberg to sit down, relax, and enjoy a homemade cake and/or drink.

Vegan options available 🌱
I really liked the vegan mango and peach cheesecake!']

Name: Kimchi Princess
Summary: Korean BBQ restaurant with red walls, wooden tables & bench seating, also serving dishes to share.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Located in the Kreuzberg area of Berlin, this street restaurant is unmissable due to its strong red lighting, which gives a pretty unique ambiance. We were there on a balmy spring night, so I don’t have a clue how/if they operate in bad weather. The menu is very interesting and has plate descriptions in both German and English and the multi national serving staff communicate in either language fluently. Busy atmosphere and the servers were excellent with their efficiency, help and smiles. The food was amazing and I cannot recommend it enough- flavors and tastes are really interesting. Even the mochi dessert was very nice. The only unattractive element of an otherwise  amazing night was the extremely unpleasant American system of being forced to add a tip by the server before settler bill. It’s such a pity that the evening had to be ruined with this Korean server insisting that I choose from 3 rates of tips before closing the bill- for that only I would seriously reconsider returning.', "Yeah it's a tad pricey especially if you go for the BBQ option. More reasonable if you don't.

Kimchi pancakes are top, bulgogi is delicious, all the pickles are delicious, and the fried chicken is decent although not spicy enough for me. The kimchi jjigae was mid. We didn't get option to change spiciness of the chicken. We ordered 4 dishes including 2 starters for three people and it was too much food honestly.", 'Perfect for a date night! The ambience is big and spacious but also full.
Tofu was average but the rest was really good :)
Also it’s on a slightly expensive side.']

Name: Restaurant Esszimmer
Summary: Seasonal & regional modern German cooking at an understated restaurant with a retro vibe.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['This was very close to a 5 star experience, and they deserve recognition for everything they did. The waiters, especially our main waiter, were attentive, funny and professional. The food was amazing, especially the dumplings (truly a 5 star taste journey). The place is Contemporary modern, which is perhaps a tad out of style with the wonderful German food, But, if nothing else, I will be back for the dumplings. Great work guys!', 'My partner and I had an excellent meal here. We were visiting Berlin for a city break and wanted to try some authentic German cuisine. I had the Wiener Schnitzel and my partner had the Fried veal liver “Berlin style”. Very generous portions and really delicious. Service was impeccable. There were lots of locals dining when we were there, so this is always a good sign! Would highly recommend.', 'A lovely, tasteful restaurant. Quiet and calm. Service excellent. Nice amuse bouche while we waited for food. Excellent Bordeaux and so reasonably priced. Calves liver out of this world!\nWiener schnitzel first class. A gem of a restaurant']

Name: IKEA Restaurant Berlin-Tempelhof
Summary: Chain store restaurant featuring Swedish-inspired food, including classic meatball & salmon dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['A lovely ikea restaurant with nice staff and a beautiful sitting area. The schnitzel came with nice fries and a side of peas which I had not experienced at other ikeas. The dish was big and filling (enough for two people even) and the sauce options were great: the usual mustard, ketchup, many salad dressings and the best one being the Lyngonberry jam!

A solid meal that really makes a trip to ikea take up a good portion of the day and feel comprehensive.', 'Even though there is not much variety, I think the food is delicious. I especially loved the cheesecake. It gets crowded after 6pm on weekdays. Along with the cheesecake, I also tried the schnitzel, and I recommend it too. I generally like the restaurant section of IKEA stores anyway.', 'The price-quality is pretty good for the restaurant. However, the restaurant is very crowded and if you are sensible to the noise it might be overwhelming. Overall experience of the restaurant is good, toilets are clean and there was enough of soap and napkins.
Also had a negative experience with the coffee at cafe part of it. For 3 euros there is a little cup and the latte i got was more as a cappuccino.']

Name: LA Paz
Summary: Mexican classics served in a warm, colorful space with a convivial vibe, full bar & sidewalk seats.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["Food was great! Kind and fast service! Very recommended!
Went for lunch, the place is quit big and was a bit empty (maybe it's more busy later in the afternoon/evening). At first the dishes looked a bit expensive, I ordered the chicken burrito and it was huge! And very tasty and it was worth it for me. Also ordered mango-colada cocktail that came with a delicious melon on it 🍈", 'Great food. Huge portion. Corn soup was sweet and like it slightly spicey, but that is my own preference. Bathrooms have been remodeled, but are on basement level.', 'Very nice place to sit and talk to a friend over the dinner. Music is not loud, unobtrusive. The interior is interesting, chairs are quite comfortable.👌
The food is yummy, served a bit slow, so be careful planning fast dinner - prepare to spend at least 1 hour here. Also looks like if one person orders soup, and others not, everyone on the table will wait for the first one to finish the meal before the second course is served.⏳
Overall impression is very positive, so if you have time and want to eat nice food, I would recommend to visit this place.👍']

Name: Kindl Stuben
Summary: Classic dishes like schnitzel & spätzle cheese noodles at a trendy gastrobar with live concerts.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['I brought my dad here who was visiting from the UK and wanted to try some typical german food! We were the only ones in the place but felt really comfortable and welcome, and the food was fresh and delicious. I would highly recommend! I’ll definitely be back soon :)', 'Went here for dinner and absolutely loved it. Cozy space, nice service, and great food. We had schnitzel and Spätzle, both were deliscious and very generous portions. Will definitely go back!', 'Very strongly enjoyed the spinach and cheese dumplings with mushroom sauce. Very reasonably priced.']

Name: Wolf Kino
Summary: Small independent cinema in a former shop built from crowdfunding with a café-bar & events studio.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['A petite cozy movies corner in a little hectic neighborhood of Neuköln. Lots of independent films in intimate settings. Plus a great bar with friendly people.', "The cinema (Saal 1) was hot, smelly and extremely crowded. the room has absolutely no ventilation!!! it's crazy to pack it full for movies and let people just cook in there for 2 hours.
The slope of the room is poorly constructed. if people sit in front of you, they are likely to hide the screen with their heads.
I will not go to see movies there ever again.
I might come back for beer.", "This is not a serious cinema.

Saal 1 lacks any ventilation whatsoever - the heat, smell, and poor air quality were unbearable and spoiled what would have been an otherwise amazing film. If only one person was infected with covid, I'm pretty sure we all have it now lol.

Their seating system is a disaster - the numbers on each chair seem to be completely random, which led to chaos and people trying to find their seats in a tiny, crowded room with no space to manouver while the film started playing.

They overbooked the showing and people were sitting on the steps next to the seat rows. I don't have to explain to you how incredibly wrong and dangerous that is and how it violates every fire safety code ever.

There are so many cute theaters in Berlin where none of this is a problem, I see no reason to support this business."]

Name: CRAZY BASTARD KITCHEN
Summary: Laid-back destination offering international comfort food & menus that change weekly.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["My Irish friend invited me here to try the Irish Week theme they had going. Was a bit skeptical given they rotate their menus every week, so to me it seemed like a 'jack of all trades, master of none' type deal, but I actually really liked the dishes they had on their menu! Crispy fish, delicious fries in 2 variants and a great spice bag too. If their other special weeks are as quality as this one, I'm sure you can come in at any point and be treated with a solid dinner.", 'Very cool place! They have different themed weeks all the time and always high quality. Staff are nice and the beer and cocktail selection is great, we tried some unique beers and also Japanese yuzu gin and tonic. The spicy sauce is very saucy ;)', "Been coming here occasionally since years. Until I took a friend who decided, we'd go every week- so it's what we are doing ever since.

Our Portuguese friend who joined us for Portugal week, said they loved it. Another one from New Orleans found Creole vuisine week was 100%. A friend from Chile loves the Blueberry Carolina Reaper sauce, and a Scottish colleague was so happy about fish & chips. A colleague from Costa Rica exported the 7 Pot sauce to give to his family, and myself from the US can confirm CBS got Kentucky fried chicken down! My favorite sauce are Chipotle-Pineapple, and Ghost Pepper- Mango.

The food might now come out 2 mins after ordering, but for me it's a good sign. It is always freshly made and quality takes time. No matter what cuisine, it is amazing and worth the wait!
All waiters I encountered, are really nice and attentive.
See you next week! :)"]

Name: Restaurant Kalaja Berlin
Summary: Lively operation with a sidewalk terrace serving up grilled meats & Turkish specialities.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Great place. My first choice whenever I’ve got a craving for Balkan food. Fresh puffy Börek. Good goulash and bread. Nice price and served right away. They’ve upgraded the restaurant now and moved to the building next to the original restaurant. Now the place is bigger, brighter and more modern. Waiters now wear ‘Kalaja’ polo shirts, and there are lots working now, as I write this. Quick friendly service.', 'We came together for borek, a cup of tea and cake. The tea was terrible. It was late, but they could have already said that there is no tea and we would have said okay thanks. Instead they brought tea that tastes nothing like tea. It was terrible. It looked and tasted terrible. After that, the other waiter started saying but my colleague told you there was no tea when you ordered, but that wasn’t true at all. They didn’t tell us that at all. They started trying to convince us to take the tea that was so light it tastes like hot water and no tea. Then they brought back tea that looked horrible and so dirty. Then we asked for sugar two times and they didn’t give it to us. It was terrible service throughout that it was honestly so frustrating we told them to have the tea and the money. They brought the money after, but it didn’t even matter because we came and were looking forward to just a cup of tea instead of trying to cheat. It was a terrible experience.', 'Very nice place. The food was fulfilling and reasonably priced. Highly recommend']

Name: OS'Kitchen
Summary: Middle Eastern cuisine with a modern spin, plus vegetarian options, in a contemporary setting.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['The best oriental food in neukölln and maybe berlin. We got a mixed plate for two but three ate and got full. Loved the spicy potatoes made traditionally lebanese recipe. Also drank a fresh Arian and a fresh orange 🍊 juice. Would definitely recommend', "A week ago my girl friend and I ordered food from OS Kitchen: a Köfte plate (€11) and a vegetarian plate (€10). Both came with a very nice small salad (we were impressed how fresh it was!) with a yoghurt dressing, lots of hummus (with 10-15 whole chick peas on top), spicy potatoes, as well as fresh pita bread. The Köfte sausages were plenty and grilled to perfection. The veggie plate came with lots of Halloumi as well as grilled vegetables. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and highly recommend this place since it's reopening end of May, 2024. The owner is also a really nice guy and he knows how to cook! We plan to eat there quite often in the future...", "This place has a great interior and friendly staff, just the meal wasn't worth it. Feels like I was being served something that wasn't even fresh anymore."]

Name: Babbo bar
Summary: Robust Italian pastas & seafood, plus a long wine list, in a cozy setting with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["The food is certainly not bad, but it's a place you'd normally avoid as a local. Primary reason is that it's quite overpriced for local standards, and you'd have better options for Italian dinner more reasonably priced around the corner. So, it's a place usually crowded with tourists on dates. ;) Also the guy running the place is a bit weird imo, but probably depends on what you like.
