What left a flavour is that you're asked to pay cash and they refuse to issue a bill. Don't want to know where that cash flow ends up...", 'In short: carefully made fresh pasta with amazing sauce. Extensive wine list that goes from Puglia to the Trentino. Seven or eight tables, unpretentious given the high quality of the food. Amazing Octopus Tagliateli. Ideal place for a date or for a get together with a small group of friends. Don’t leave without trying the Tiramisu!', 'Unfortunately I’m disappointed and don‘t quite get what others who recommend and love this place have experienced here, because sadly I can‘t see why others love this place so much.
More on this in the following but if you want a short explanation for my 2 stars:
we paid around 180€ for 3 persons, 2 of us (me included) had to eat at home afterwards because our portions were tiny (we all had first course, main course and dessert) and for an authentic italian restaurant it was sadly on of the badder experiences I have encountered in my culinary years.

But now for the long version. I chose this restaurant because my dad was in town, we love italian food so after reading the extraordinary good reviews and seeing the nice website with a nice menu selection, I wanted to give it a try.
(I worked years in restaurants and I am a big foodie, especially for my italian food, so I love to try new stuff, because why not, it‘s berlin right?)

The place:
We get there and it is just a brightly lit room with a big window so you can see the whole restaurant. Because the first impression was sadly uninviting (compared to other romantic italian places in berlin) I even had to check if that is the right restaurant because the place looked nothing like the photos, but we were right.
The atmosphere and ambiance was just… cold. You walk straight into the dining area with tables scrambled together, bright lights, no candles, no nice tablecloths, just straight up cheap tables and chairs. The chairs are unfortunately also so uncomfortable, that we wanted to go right after eating. For every restaurant, but especially italian, I want to be comfortable. I want to feel at home. I want the feeling I am in Italy right now and I can sit and sit forever and just have nice hour long conversations over a bottle or two of red wine. But all I got from there was just a reaction to stand up and go. I‘m sorry to be so direct but I have no other way to describe it.
The most sad part about it: one reason I chose the restaurant was by the way they decorated and printed their menu. (It sounds dumb but after years of trying new restaurants you know when they put in the work for a nice menu, they will do with everything else as well).
So I was flabbergasted when the waiter just lay the menu cards down, which were just flipchart boards with a old laminated printed out sheet of paper.

The food:
Well the food. As stated above we ended up paying 180€ for 3 persons, which isn’t THAT much for berlin, but everytime I pay that much I get a really overall nice experience from the places. So, as you can imagine, this place was nowhere near that.
My girlfriend and I had roman artichokes as starters, my dad had porchetta with radicchio. The artichokes were ok, but they just tasted… bland (i guess?!), my dad described as: „They lack the kick“. The porchetta was fine.
For main we had: octopus, ravioli with cod and tagliolini with calamaretti.
And now it got disappointing for that price: my dad had the octopus main and he got 2 half arms. Like maybe 100g, if even. It tasted good, a little bit too long cooked on one side, so octopus gets rubbery. But like the size was just a joke. I‘m sorry to be so blunt. This dish was 28€(!). I had the ravioli and also here taste was ok, but they lacked a bit of everything and for about 26€ it was just to small (had like 7 ravioli) and too little kick to it. My gf had the tagliolini, which was surprisingly a huge portion, compared to ours. I just don‘t get their measurements of plating?
Well the taste was also good but lacked something and were a bit to bitter. I mean that‘s a dish for normally around 16-18€ and it was also like 26€.

So all in all I want to say that the food was not bad or uneatable. But we paid 180€ which is just not right for what you get. A ok-quality food with lack of passion behind the taste and an unromantic atmosphere where you don’t want to stay hours.
So my rating is 2 stars for that the food was ok and the chef was nice, but I‘m sorry. Didn‘t get the vibe and sadly not something to visit again.']

Name: café tschüsch - indiaspired futurefood
Summary: Laid-back destination for colorful curries & rice, with vegan options, local beer & organic wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews: ['They nailed it with the description of Indian inspired future food. We did the vegan soja korma and the appetizer dal soup with red lentils. I opted for medium spice. The food was so flavorful and the veggies were very fresh that came with it. I loved the pickled red onions and the orange slice that came with the soy korma. The red lentils were definitely “legendary” like the menu description states. I wish I knew every spice and ingredient they used so I could make it at home. We ended dinner with the chocolate cream schokola with soy whip cream. It was so cute and a perfect small size, they had small chunks of chocolate to change up the texture from just creamy which I thought was really smart and delicious. We scootered over here from across town after a deep Google search and it was worth it to make the trip over. The restaurant itself is also really cute and if you want there is also outdoor seating. They were very friendly, attentive and also down to earth. They share a love of good food and you can tell. Thanks!!', 'Delicious vegan meals, and unique setup inside. I really liked everything about this place! Then if you are in lower income bracket you can simply ask them for discount while ordering. They also serve beers made by social collectives.', 'Amazing food, tasty and portions are big! I especially loved the onion salad and souce of spinach. Interesting drinks worth to try. Also great location close to trendy weserstrasse and nice street view. Definitely, I will go again']

Name: Döner 44
Summary: Kebabs & wraps filled with meat, halloumi or falafels, at a long-standing, no-frills snack bar.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['The best kebab in Berlin!! Big portion, a lot of meat inside, not too much sauce. Very recommend!', 'Incredibly tasty Döner. Even I, als a Chinese, am also lured by the taste. It only costs 3,5€', 'Still a good kebab, but now smaller than it used to be. Maybe it depends on who prepares the food, but disappointing.']

Name: Café Botanico
Summary: Garden-to-table Italian cuisine in a cozy, lively cafe & bistro with a lush garden terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['This place is a true gem. Not only the food was extremely good, but the service was amazing. Dishes are made simple but really tasty and home made. They use herbs and products from their local garden which makes everything more sotenable. Do not miss out on visiting the garden, such a lovely place to have a drink before your dinner. And the waitresses there were all extremely lovely and careful with our allergies inquiries. Many vegan options, all of them delicious 😋 The burrata is one of the best I have ever tried and the vegan pasta was sooo good!', 'Wonderful hidden gem with a nice garden in Berlin! Excellent Italian food, with a lot of fresh greens and fresh herbs. Lovely helpful\nstaff and great service. Highly recommended!', "I’ve visited here three times with my boyfriend, and we consider it the best restaurant in Berlin. It's a humble and cool place with its own vegetable garden. Unlike many fine dining restaurants, their food is not pretentious but genuinely honest. Despite this, each menu item is crafted with care and a high level of quality. The cozy atmosphere makes us want to return again. :) Personally, I enjoy the antipasti menu and the meat dishes. The tiramisu is the best! 😊"]

Name: Pêle-Mêle
Summary: Breakfast, daily lunch menus & homemade cakes at a snug vegan cafe with a few sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Reviews:
['One of the few vegan brunch buffets in Berlin and it is super tasty! It has various savory warm, lukewarm and cold foods and some desserts, all of which are vegan and delicious! Definitely recommend to make a reservation and visit the restaurant!', 'This is a fully vegan café with several cakes, brunch items and a few daily-changing meals, which are (except for the bread) all made in house. They have a couple of gluten-free options as well.

The cakes were okay and actually tasted better than they looked. Coffee, however, was not what it was supposed to be… The warm meal was absolutely not to my taste, and I couldn’t even finish it.

After all, the prices here are on the expensive side, too.

What I appreciated is that staff was friendly and honest when trying to help us choose what to order.

The café is quiet and seems suitable for working or studying. The interior features old furniture, including tables with mismatched chairs. The vintage and random interior represents the Berlin-style flair of this neighborhood.', 'We had vegan brunch and I ❤️ it. Very good food and vibes. I will definitely come again soon!']

Name: Ristorante Firenze
Summary: Classic Italian pasta & seafood in an elegant room with wall murals & floor-to-ceiling wine shelves.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['We come here often for their delicious menu. The food is fresh and tasty. The service is premium. They are kind and helpful for selections both for food and beverages. The price is quite reasonable. It is spacious for larger groups. Reservation is needed in advance. It must be visited at least once or twice a month. Recommend.', '3 stars for the food: the mixed appetizer (cold cuts basically) was by far the best dish. The caprese appetizer had good mozzarella but tasteless, small tomatoes that hadn’t ripened. Both pasta dishes were mediocre. The Tagliatelle Firenze: under seasoned, tomato sauce wasn’t good and the beef was over cooked and chewy. The tortellini were just ok, supermarket quality. The restaurant does offer a decent selection of Italian wines, which is nice, but the food needs quite a bit of improvement. The reason I’m giving this restaurant 4 stars is the cozy atmosphere and relatively low prices. Otherwise, definitely not the best Italian restaurant in Berlin. Just a place to have a glass of wine with some Italian style tapas on the side.', 'Amazing italian food, good prices and the treatment is great. I had truffle pasta and I really recommend it.']

Name: Strike Lanes Lounge Bowling
Summary: Subtly lit lounge-bar with low tables & seating, bowling & restaurant serving an international menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 3:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 3:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
['We had a great time at the bowling lounge! We booked one week in advance, as last-minute bookings may not guarantee a spot. We lucked out finding a lane late on a Wednesday night. The place has a fantastic ambiance with music, drinks, and food. The only minor downside was the limited seating for larger groups sharing one lane, so it can be a bit cramped when waiting for your turn.

This is one of the top bowling lounges in Berlin, offering a spacious area for loads of fun. They have a dedicated bar for your convenience, and you can rent bowling shoes right at the entrance. The overall experience includes great music and reasonable prices for a fun game of bowling.', 'Nice place for weekend chill. There were some technical issues on the lane, however restored quickly by crew.
You van order beer and snacks on the screen on your lane with fast delivery.
Toilets are huge and clean.
There was a football match displayed, but not very clear.', 'One of the nice bowling lounge in Berlin. The lounge is big and super specious for having fun. It has a dedicated bar for the customers. I was rented the bowling track shoe from the entrance. Overall nice music and fair price for bowling.']

Name: Kentucky Fried Chicken
Summary: Restaurant chain known for its buckets of fried chicken, plus combo meals & sides.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews:
['Good KFC. I really like the vegan chicken burger. I also like what they’ve done with the fries. When I was young we had to go through the drive through of both McDonald’s and KFC because I preferred the McDonald’s fries. These fries are now just like those! Perfect combination. There is some outdoor seating too.', 'I wanted to take some food after long day at work at approx 22:30 pm. I understand it was closing time maybe. 2 employees (girls) were playing clap clap with each other. What I got to eat from them is on the pictures provided.
A disaster. I didn’t expect it from kfc at least.
I know maybe you don’t want to make fresh food before closing but for only this reason we as a paying customer cannot suffer.

1. All the chicken that I got was full of burnt black flour sand stacked that comes when you use the oil again and again for a long time.

2. no sign of crispyness and completely dried out as it was fried long ago and already packed (actually waste as rest food).

3. look at the French fry each piece of them is +-1cm-2cm in size.

I hope KFC Alexanderplatz store will keep this in mind and improve their food quality.

Best regards', 'Food was really good. There was a misunderstanding when I requested a drumstick 🍗 because they gave me a thigh, but that is alright. Otherwise all good. I also made videos reviewing the meals will upload them soon.']

Name: Lotos Café
Summary: Mellow cafe within a Buddhist center, serving a veggie menu with vegan options, plus homemade cakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: 3:00 – 7:00 PM
Reviews:
['Lovely little café in between the apartment buildings!
Cozy and homely, like visiting your grandmother for a cup of coffee and a snack. Great staff!

Filter coffee is 2,5 Euros
It was okay. Like at home.

Lentil soup is 4,5 Euros
Tasted great!

They speak a little English. They prefer cash, but can take credit card also', 'Hidden in between of the ulgly lego bricks there is this realxing little meditation center with attached cafe and garden. The staff is really nice, but the coffee could be better. Very cheap :)', 'Beautiful relaxing place with vegan options. Less than 10 EUR for daily menu. They don't speak English here, so you'll need some German or other form of communication. Saying "vegan" and hand gestures worked well for me.']

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Well the Service was... don't talk about it better. Normal question about the Ingredients of the offered Mountain Dew..very unfriendly answear.
The employee all not german speakers... just a few words..?!
Don't understand as i want instead the Still water as menu.
So i payed only the Philly Beef half Sandwich.
Oh accept only paying by cards an NO Amex.. good that i have a German Bank Debit Card too..!
The Sandwich... bread too hard, the salad not green... more yellow.
Last visit here.. 📴 🔚 🚯", "Food was good, I had a foot-long Meatless Chicken Teriyaki which was surprisingly close to real chicken. The subway shop is very small but it is enough as there are many tables around to sit down and eat.

I paid 10,80€ for a menu with a small drink and a cookie. They don't give you a tray for your sandwich though, as other subway restaurants do, which was really annoying.", 'We waited 10 minutes for anyone to serve us, a person was sweeping the floor and laughing. We could hear people talking and laughing in the back, yet no one noticed the growing line.

One person came out not in uniform, scratched their armpits without gloves and touched all of the cookies.

The bread was horribly dry, the employees did not care one bit about the people they served when they served us, ignoring us and laughing withnother employees.']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['This McDonald’s was quite nice, though a bit noisy. The food, service, and waiting times were average, and it’s located a bit far from the main entrance of the mall. However, the interior design and seating options were impressive. I got takeout, but the terrace looked amazing and very unique. I’ll definitely have to try it next time, and I recommend you do as well', 'Waited a total of 15\' for 2 simple burgers. My number just disappeared from the screen, and when I asked about it, the stuff responds every time in German, ending with saying "one moment." People were ordering and getting their meals before me all the time, while I was standing in front of the staff to see if anyone will care that I\'ve been waiting there for 15\'', "Don't recommend. We have been here a few times with the family and a little child. I asked the service for a simple straw for the child and the response was: we do not give a straw with Coca-Cola only with milkshake. How expensive a straw is, I don't know, but it is ridiculous! I am very disappointed. Don't recommend and will try avoid this place in the future."]

Name: Vedang - green burger | Alexa Berlin
Summary: Plant-based burgers, wraps & fries offered in a bright, funky fast-food kitchen inside a food court.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['I ordered a menu with a "chick patty" burger, fries, and drink.

The burger patty was super crispy and very tasty. The fries were also very tasty, and it was one of the best. The drink was average.

This is the go-to place for those who have plant-based burger cravings. Highly recommended.', 'We tried a crispy chicken and a smash burger. Nothing interesting or worth mentioning. The Coca Cola was not as expected probably they use a different brand. Cheesy fries were not with cheddar as expected but still not in our taste. Probably the plant based burgers are better.', 'This was one of the best vegan sandwiches I’ve had in a very long time. The fries were to perfection and the sweet-and-sour sauce is incredible… Enem the bacon topping was so so yummy. There was nothing about this meal that I did not love. #govegan :)']

Name: Cielo Di Berlino
Summary: Relaxed stop with sidewalk tables & a menu of classic & buckwheat pizzas, plus housemade pastas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 2:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Another visit to this amazing place. Great service, great atmosphere and delicious food. I highly recommend it especially for people on a gluten-free diet.', 'tasted great! The buckwheat pizza dough is very filling. Remember to indicate when ordering that you wish for gluten free. Not all menu items are. Friendly and helpful service. Good to see their friends drop by for hugs.', 'Great gluten free options.  Friendly service\n\nFound this place through research when looking for gluten free friendly restaurants as I am Coeliac.  Upon translating the menu it said that their buckwheat gluten free pizzas cannot be kept free from cross contamination which was concerning. But after speaking to the waiter he advised that everything is done separately and that it was okay for those with gluten allergies.  The pizza was good and I had no reaction to it and so assume everything was kept gluten free.']

Name: Gon 80 Vietnamese Cuisine Restaurant
Summary: Low-key option serving typical Vietnamese fare including noodles, spring rolls, meat dishes & pho.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['my favorite restaurant in Berlin, always tasty food and nice service. There are vegan options, which are really good. Thank you for everything ☺️', 'Their dishes were delicious and fresh! Originally we ordered 1 appetizer, 1 main dish, 1 dessert and two drinks and after finishing those dishes we just had to order more because it was great! The staff were friendly and accommodating. A must try!', 'Undoubtedly the best Pho we had in Germany, so felt really lucky to find this place on our last day during the drive home. Definitely coming back here on our first day when we are in Berlin again ❤️ Thank you']

Name: Ripieno
Summary: Charming, down-to-earth place offering traditional Italian pastas, pinsas & wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM
Reviews: ["I went there with my colleagues for a team dinner, we were 13 people, and the food was delicious, i was quite disappointed that they ran out of Ragu and meatballs pasta, so ended up with Clara pizza and Pasta with beef in red wine both were perfectly flavoured, and the textures were spot on. By far the best pasta I've had in years.\nThe staff are friendly to the point you feel like part of the family - thank you for the great service and food", 'Thank you for taking us back to Italy. We missed authentic Italian food in Berlin. If you are looking for real carbonara or Tiramisu then Ripieno is the right place to dine and enjoy. Grazie mille', "The first thing that caught my eyes was its vibe! For an hour I felt we're in Italy. Owners were Italian with strong accent and even people there were also warm and hype! I liked it in general. The food was acceptable maybe was not my best Italian experience but still was good. The only average point was the service. There were just two owners who were handling orders and many customers so we had to wait a lot just to order or receive check."]

Name: Tirelli's
Summary: Informal Italian venture furnishing pasta dishes & wine in a homey, compact dining room.
Reviews:
['I ordered ravioli it is very good but not a perfect. It has some salt problem as much as a Italian raviolis maybe I am using more than acceptable :). anyway they have little service problem(English menu, I had to chance my knife) still good restaurant. You could go there.', 'Great service, only one Vorspeise tho, was really tasty. We had carbonara and pesto pasta! Super flavorful ⭐️', '🙏Simply Fantastic 😍❤️

Great Italian food, super fast and very reasonble prices 👍👍👍

Totally worth driving through the city for. It is consistently good and one can talk a very nice walk in the parkafterwards.']

Name: Munch's Hus
Summary: Mellow setup for modern Norwegian cuisine focusing on fish, plus craft beer & European wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Excellence in food - especially quality - some improvement potential in service.

Munch's Hus is great and absolutely worth a visit from a food perspective. The fish plate starters were already all out of excellent quality and taste, same level continued thru main dishes. We tried both a fish and a duck dish as main, all well made. Food has a very recognisable Scandinavian touch, if you like such food, you will absolutely love it here.

Drinks menu also decent, some good wines on the menu and happy to see a few Norwegian craft beers as well.

On the service side there is potential to improve. It was a bit on the slow side as it took over an hour to get our main course. Also there were small things surprising such as no Norwegian menu available, they insisted on German although I spoke English with their waiter... Nothing major, but a bit funny! :)

So, despite not entirely happy with the service, I have to objectively give it a 4.5 which rounds to a 5 here. They got the feeling for the food and the Norwegian tradition, which is the most valuable asset for a restaurant. Will for sure return and try a few other dishes.", 'The restaurant is authentic and has a good variety of Norwegian dishes. Also the service was very attentive and quick. However, in my opinion my fish dish wasn’t that fresh; it had rather a strong taste and smell, also the texture had suffered a bit already. Considering the high prices of this place, more freshness was definitely expected.', "What can I say,the elk was outstanding the meat was tasty and almost melted in my mouth it was so tender 😋😋 notice the Chef talent there,is not easy to cook that kind of dish,the dessert a A+👍👍😋😋 Tilslørte bondepiker highly recommended and the atmosphere was awesome very kind and professional felt like home, I'll be back when I come back to Berlin.
Came back after a year and had two main dishes and now I love it even more 💖💖 😋😋😋👍😋buonissimo"]

Name: Hisar fresh food
Summary: Meat, chicken & vegetarian kebabs, plus sides, served in a low-key spot with a take-out window.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM
Reviews:
['One of my favorite Döner shops in Berlin. It‘s usually packed. There‘s always a long line. Especially on the beef window. They have a chicken window as well, which is usually quicker.

They mostly cater for take away customers. But there is a small seating section as well. Not very cosy. But it is fast food after all.', 'This place is usually full of people in line, probably because of its location, right next to the S-Bahn station, and they offer good döner. Luckily for us, there was no one there when we arrived. My friend and I ordered beef döner, we both enjoyed it a lot.
There are two order windows here, one for chicken meat lover and the other for beef, pick your line wisely.', "Ordered dürüm as i was super hungry, but take a look at the meat. Almost none. Literally, i had salad instead of a döner. Besides, the meat was too dry, you can't get any meat taste because they slice it too thin. I don't recommend any one to waste money on their döner."]

Name: Ristorante Café Aroma
Summary: Long-standing evenings-only venture with a terrace & an old-school vibe serving pasta & pizza.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Since the place has changed ownership it has improve 180 degrees. Pizzas were fantastic and served in time, although the place was full we did not have to wait that much and drinks were well done and refreshig. This place is one of the top Italian ones to recommend in XBerg.', 'One of the hidden gems in Berlin, loved by the locals...an interesting locale with a large outside area, the street is off the beaten path,and the food/service truly Italian . Excellent 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻', 'Very slow service and instead of Linguine and Pappardelle we both got Fussili. The food was but definitely not worth the price. Do not recommend.']

Name: Da Jia Le
Summary: Northeastern Dongbei Chinese cuisine & local Berlin beer, served in an unfussy dining room.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['This place made me homesick for the Chinatown restaurants in New York. I love it and it’s my new go to Chinese spot as a New Yorker in Berlin. The food is on paar with some of New Yorks best Chinese food. Authentic and stellar. This place made me very happy.', 'As an Asian person who’s now living in nyc - I have to preface that Asian food I’ve tried in Berlin has much room for improvement. I’ve been to a couple places with great reviews and ended up mildly disappointed.

The food here is ok, not authentic the way I’ve had in China or Bangkok, or some really good places in NYC or London, but it wasn’t bad.

The service was fast and the servers were attentive. We thought the price was fair too

One down side is that we found a crumbled paper in our rice bowl.

All in all, if you’re used to Chinese food from China or Asia, don’t expect this to be the same', 'Great restaurant!!! The food was delicious! Maybe the best Chinese food I have ever had and maybe one of the best in Berlin! Almost all the tables were full so make sure you make a reservation first. This was also the reason why we had to wait for the waiter to take the order for quite a while, but once he came he was very polite and the food came pretty soon. A great choice for Chinese food in Berlin!']

Name: Café Peri
Summary: Turkish brunch cafe serving spicy baked potatoes, menemen scrambled eggs & börek pastries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Authentic Turkish restaurant with a diverse menu, including breakfast items such as Peri breakfast, Karadeniz breakfast,etc.
In addition, they offer a launch menu or dessert.
They are also famous for kumpir.

I enjoyed the atmosphere and service.

The price is also okay, especially nowadays most other restaurants have high prices.

Thanks to the kind Peri team.', 'Very nice place. The vibe is great. Inside and outside there are a lot of tables to sit. In addition, inside you can find some special isolated smoking rooms. The food and beverage are tasty.', "We went there to drink tea. I tried the Sebastian cheese cake, kunefe and also the mango kiss (it's a drink).
Everything was good. So delicious 🤤
The atmosphere is amazing 😍 and all the staff was nice. I highly recommend the restaurant.
I liked the diversity in the menu you can and prices are correct for me. You feel like you are in Istanbul while being in Berlin."]

Name: Prometeo Authentic Pizza
Summary: Simple Italian restaurant specializing in traditional dishes, Neapolitan pizza & pasta.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['We had our team event here. And it was 100% the perfect place! All of us were satisfied with the quality of food! And the level of service! Very nice staff!!', 'This place has a really nice atmosphere the waitress was really friendly he even danced on the local and that was amazing. The pizza was also really good with a big variety. The sad part is that it took for ever to give our order and also to bring the food.l, maybe because there was not enough staff.', "This hip and trendy pizzeria in Schöneberg is a must-visit for pizza lovers! The atmosphere is buzzing with great vibes, although it can get a bit loud when it's packed full – a testament to its popularity.

The Neapolitan pizzas are authentic and absolutely fantastic! The chewy thick crust, flavorful tomato sauce, and high-quality ingredients make for a truly mouthwatering bite. The pizza tonno was made with ventresca, a high-fat, high-flavor part of the tuna belly - just yum!

Whether you're craving a classic Margherita or something more adventurous like the pizza porchetta, this pizzeria delivers."]

Name: Train Cocktailbar
Summary: Craft cocktails mixed from scratch in a low-lit venue resembling the dining car of a vintage train.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Reviews: ['Staff is awesome!! Drinks are very good and food fantastisc! I really recommend!', 'Nothing special with drinks. All cocktails are 7,5€.\nwe had some questions about quality of alcohol in them. After first cocktails we wanted to see how cocktails are prepared so we ordered at the bar and was waiting for them. But The bartender chased us away from the bar to our table on the terrace, asking "do you have any problems?". You have problems, if you have something to hide from the visitors, I can sit anywhere I want in the bar (there were no people inside) and I have all rights to see what you put in my drink if I want to. Never have this problem before.\nWe won\'t go again', 'Nice concept of having a cocktail bar in an old train carriage. Cheap and nice cocktails. Friendly staff too. Located above U Kleistpark station, so it’s easy to get to.']

Name: PIZZERIA NAPOLETANA
Summary: Simple Italian eatery offering Neapolitan pizza, along with antipasti, salads, desserts & wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Delicious Neapolitan pizza with high-quality ingredients and perfectly springy dough. I have visited this place several times and have never been disappointed. I highly recommend it if you are a fan of Pizza Napoletana!', 'One of the best pizzas I had lately in Berlin. Dough is perfect and I really liked the atmosphere. Also one can find some pizza types, very common in Italy aside the modern ones. Will come by again.', "The pizza is okish, but it's definitely not a neapoletan pizza as advertised. You can find much better options in Berlin. The server did not know the wifi password"]

Name: GOLVET
Summary: Smart, cosmopolitan venture spotlighting refined cuisine with a focus on regional ingredients.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Food was done very well. Ingredients spoke for themselves. Then pacing and portions were just right for us to enjoy every dish. Service was friendly and warm. Highly recommend this place to people traveling to Berlin', 'For a Michelin restaurant, a bit funky place with dark interior, colorful lighting and a beautiful view over Berlin. The menu was a parade of small artistic dishes with an asian touch. Friendly and informal service. Food being presented well and the sommelier Andrea who gave us a-beyond-what-you-can-expect tour in German wines. As wine geeks we really appreciated that they paired wines beyond the conventional regions and names. We had an amazing evening. Compliments to the kitchen and service people from two happy Danes', 'I had a very positive surprise, first of all it was the view, 180 free view of Berlin, summer and sunset. Food was ver very good, from the beginning to the end.']

Name: Grill Royal
Summary: Elegant grill restaurant, overlooking the river, with an international menu but known for steaks.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["The food was not especial at all, it is just super expensive and not even good. We went for an anniversary and we were very disappointed, people in Berlin recommend it a lot but don't know why. I guess just because looks fancy and is expensive but the service is terrible bad and the food not good at all. The worst is the waters and the hostess that just because one is not full of botox or makeup assume that one has no money and treat you but. Definitely not going back and wouldn't recommend it.", 'Very nice food, best beef I ever had.
Quite pricy, but very good quality too. The Atmosphere directly at the waterfront was very nice.
The furniture is a bit outdated.', 'All on point, amazing food, location perfect, unfortunately we had a rude Italian waiter (Alessandro) that didn’t make our experience excellent. Shame that in a place like this having this kind of attitude.
Beside this all the rest of the team really lovely people.
Really recommended 👍🏽']

Name: The Sixties Diner
Summary: Vast American-style eatery with pop art & retro artifacts on the walls, plus screenings of sports.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews:
['I hardly know where to start with this disaster of a dining experience. Over half the items on the menu were unavailable—no pancakes, no milkshakes, not even basic mayonnaise. The waiter nonchalantly mentioned that the ice cream had gone bad, as if that was just par for the course.

The guacamole was rancid and had to be sent back immediately, and the fries were so greasy they were impossible to eat. Not a single dish matched the description on the menu.

Everything had a strange, foul taste, likely due to a grill that clearly hasn’t been cleaned in ages. Considering the state of their disgustingly dirty bathrooms, this was hardly surprising.

As for the service, it was shockingly careless and apathetic. It felt like the entire staff couldn’t care less whether the place stayed open or not. How this place is still in business is a mystery. The decor might be nice, but no amount of visual appeal can cover up the disaster that is this establishment.

To top it all off, our server refused to offer any kind of compensation or discount, even though we could barely eat any of the food. They wouldn’t even comp the spoiled guacamole we had to send back.

This place is beyond disappointing. What could have been a fun, enjoyable outing turned into an experience so bad it left us wondering how such blatant disregard for customers could exist in a business. This restaurant is a mess, and no amount of decor can hide that.', 'Excellent service, horrible food. Nachos are made from either old or packaged tortilla chips, and had the taste and texture of something out of a microwave instead of an oven. The jalapeño burger was oddly proportioned, with cuts of jalapeño 2 cm thick that had me picking out seeds from my teeth with every bite. The fries were soggy a minute after reaching the table. The portion sizes were certainly authentic, but it tastes like an American stereotype than a sincere attempt at recreating American food in Berlin.', 'This is a bit of a tourist trap. It has plenty of fun things from the 60ies and 70ies, but the place is pretty old and warn out. The food is eatable but not great and the staff seem very unenthusiastic. So unless you are looking for something to post on social media I would suggest that you go somewhere else.']

Name: GRAND BAR - Restaurant | Bar | Lounge in Berlin-Mitte
Summary: Steak, pizzas, burgers & pasta, plus drinks, amid ornate dark wood interiors or at terrace tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews:
['Large, atmospheric restaurant. The menu is very extensive and includes dishes from cuisines of various countries.

While the restaurant itself is fine, the place has quite a few flaws, becouse of which I would advise against visiting it. First of all, the waiting time for drinks was very long, and we waited an hour for food (one main course per person). Secondly, the staff was absent and it was difficult for us even to ask for the bill. Thirdly, we were expected to pay only in cash. Lastly, there was an intense smell of cigarettes inside the establishment near the entrance.

There are many better restaurants in Berlin. I recommend giving up on this one in favor of other places.', 'Came here for a late lunch after a tour. Happy hour for cocktails was great, they did a good margarita and espresso martini. We ordered Currywurst and fries, it was good and tasty. On a busy road but plenty of outdoor seating with fans to combat the heat. Good value overall.', 'Very good food and great service. And they gave me an extra chicken breast not shown on the photo']

Name: Schwarzwaldstuben
Summary: Robust Swabian-Baden dishes like maultaschen dumplings & spätzle noodles in simple surrounds.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['One of my favorite bars in Berlin. Great atmosphere, the bartender was exceptional, loved their Bramble, gins, and schnepps. Hope to visit someday again.\nVisited summer, 2023.', 'A taste of the Schwarzwald in the heart of Berlin, the ambiance effectively transports you to the region, complemented by a menu featuring classic dishes like Maultaschen and Flammkuchen. The friendly staff welcomes you into the relatively spacious yet cozy restaurant. I highly recommend the Flammkuchen, especially the special of the day with added Pfifferlinge mushrooms. The Wurstsalat was also exceptional, providing a delightful culinary journey through the Schwarzwald.', 'Great atmosphere and wonderful authentic German Cuisine. I really loved the vibes here and all the food items tasted delicious. Great place to grab food and drinks. I love the decor, very German and the vibes inside is great for friends and family.']

Name: Aposto
Summary: Pasta & pizza, plus lunch set menus, at an Italian restaurant with a wine wall & sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Do not come here without cash. They will not accept card payments unless the bill is €30 or more. I was a solo tourist and my bill came to €26.90. I have travelled across Europe and had never come across this until now, €30 minimum is not really normal.
Otherwise, my food was nice and I appreciated the friendliness of the waitress (despite the payment rules) and outdoor seating area.', 'Food is good and tasty. Nothing head blowing, but delicious. Good price and quality ratio ✌️
Service is astonishing. Waiters have good sense of humor. I like to come hate for some drinks and desserts on Sundays.
Nothing special, but it feels like home ❤️', "The pizza wasn't anything special, but was still good. Service was nice. It's situated in a seemingly unwelcoming and dirty location, but the outside seating is still okay. Big minus for them not taking cards, only cash."]

Name: Gaststätte Sophieneck
Summary: Schnitzels, sausages & meatballs, plus beer, in an old-fashioned tavern with an intimate vibe.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Delicious German food! I got the bratwurst with potatoes and sauerkraut, and my husband got the roast beef Rosa. Both were fantastic! We left clean plates.', 'Loved our lunch. Very nice, quiet place to enjoy a German meal.', 'Had dinner for 2, good solid German food. Staff were friendly and menus in English too. We enjoyed our meal.']

Name: Restaurant Keyser Soze - Berlin
Summary: Laid-back venue for all-day breakfast, plus schnitzels & salads, as well as afternoon cake & coffee.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Excellent place for breakfasts in the mitte. They have 2-3 pages of various breakfast options. Mainly focus on national cuisine style. Service is expemplar. Coffee is tasty and vibe is cool and sweet. Views from window also deserve attention.', 'Delicious food and drinks, friendly staff :)', "A great café to enjoy good food and drinks.\nWe stopped at Keyser Soze after visiting the nearby Berlin Wall Memorial and enjoyed some Aperol Spritz's.\nThere is ample seating, friendly service, and the outdoor window seats are great for people watching. A great place to take a break after exploring the nearby sites."]

Name: Strandbad Mitte
Summary: Brunch, coffee & bistro-style regional dishes in a cozy bar/restaurant with a street terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews:
["I absolutely loved having brunch here! The food and vibes were great.

The waitress was kind. If your German is as bad as mine, don't fret! They will work with you in English.", 'If you’re looking for a breakfast place especially at the weekend, Strandbad Mitte is a good choice. Their Egg Benedict is pretty good. The cheese plate is gigantic, you can definitely have that for 2 people. They also serve a large basket of fresh bread. Prices are around 12-15 Euros for all dishes but they do have Broccoli soup for 6,50. Worth trying!', 'Hidden breakfast place in the heart of the city.
Better book in advance to avoid disappointment.']

Name: Restaurant Via Nova II
Summary: Refined Mediterranean meat & pasta dishes in  elegant interiors or a flower-filled courtyard.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews:
["We had lunch. For me the food was great, I really can't complain. The service was good, although waitresses don't know english. But never the less we ordered our food and drinks without problems. The food came quick and drinks even quicker.
All in all it was good experience, and i definitely recommend.", 'Came in for lunch on a cold, rainy day - sadly the lasagne was dreadful and was clearly reheated from frozen. It was bland and the sauce tasted like Heinz tomato soup. The side salad was fine but appeared to be drizzled with excrement before I realised it was the balsamic dressing which was also very bland. In hindsight I should have sent it back but I was so cold and hungry. Overall very disappointing for the price but the service was ok', 'This restaurant is unfortunately only fake Italian with slow service and rip off prices. Felt very much like a tourist trap.

We were in a larger group, I waited 1.5 hrs to get a beverage. Over 1 hr from ordering food to when it arrived.

Antipasti plate for 16 euro had a tiny slice of hard cheese and half a slice of prosciutto.

My biggest disappointment was the steak. I ordered my steak rare, but it arrived medium well. After hours of waiting for my food, I was starving, but I asked for my order to be redone. The waiter was very surprised "Do you not like it? Do you want something else?". I asked for another steak to be cooked to rare as I ordered. The result was a cold slab of meat that was fridge cold in the centre and barely cooked on the outside, accompanied by sad overcooked vegetables.

The waiters were totally overwhelmed with our group and the service was almost non existent. I would not recommend this place for a larger group, but perhaps it's nice for a casual small dinner.']

Name: Bombay
Summary: Unfussy spot for Indian curries, biryanis & tandooris, with a business lunch menu & a large terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Food was just ok.  I expected more flavor and spice.  Had the lunch special with the vegetarian option, which came with lentil soup.  Also ordered the mango drink and didn’t like it since I’ve had much better.  Not bad for the price but I won’t be returning.', 'We stopped by Bombay Restaurant for lunch while touring Berlin and were impressed by their Business Lunch deal. As vegetarians, we appreciated the two options available—Dal Tarka and Palak Paneer. We went with the Palak Paneer, which came with rice, and the flavors were incredibly authentic and well-balanced.
The Lunch time deal also included a delicious lentil soup, a small Bhatura, and a fresh salad, which made for a satisfying and wholesome meal. If you’re looking for a great vegetarian meal, this restaurant is definitely worth a visit.', 'I didn’t have a good experience, but I need to be precise and say we visited the restaurant almost by the closing time.
Nevertheless they allowed us to enter and order food, so I would still expect a good service.
Lets s start with the cocktails, the mojito was just sugar and alcohol, the sugar was not crushed, so it was all in the bottom, when I tried to drink only the sugar came up.
The pina polada was also only alcool, not properly mixed as expected.
About the food I ordered paneer pakoras, the batter was not cooked, inside was all liquid.
The chicken was ok
Overall I didn’t have a nice experience']

Name: Toca Rouge
Summary: Creative Chinese fusion cuisine in an atmospheric contemporary space with colorful lighting.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30 – 11:45 PM, Tuesday: 5:30 – 11:45 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 11:45 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 11:45 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 11:45 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 11:45 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Food was good but didn't knock me of my feet. Everything tasted fresh and was looking appetizing. The portions were generous. Service was friendly, attentive and quick. I liked the modern and hip interior.", 'Duck appetizer was disappointing. Duck was too tough! fatty and chewy… Shrimp dish with sweet potato and rice was a bizarre combination. Two carbs on same plate? Lamb dish was superb, peanut chicken was okay, all dishes were too sweet for my taste. Great service, cool environment', 'Pretty small place and usually quite packed. Makes it then also rather crowded and you are sitting very close to other tables/customers.

The food was well prepared and beautifully set but unfortunately the taste is missing the best edge. The food is good but not great, not the best that I have tasted while spending my holiday in Berlin. Also the food is a bit too pricy for the quality.

The crew is really friendly and is serving you all the time. Giving points for them']

Name: Dada Falafel
Summary: Compact Middle Eastern restaurant, with 2 floors & outdoor seating, known for its eponymous dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 8:30 PM, Saturday: 2:00 – 8:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Food is very nice - especially the Dada platter which contains a little bit of everything. Friendly staff, fast service, no pressure to leave. Only minor point that may put some people off is their choice of music (electro with quite a beat).', 'Great food, good people, nice area and vibes +reasonable prices. Just LOOK at the dada platters meat/veggie 😍😍', 'We were sweating in 30 degrees and the sun was baking on our fur.  And as much as I like the kebab, there is no room in my stomach for meat in this heat.  When I took the first bite of this sandwich with my shaky teeth, I immediately knew that it was a good decision and definitely not a mistake.  Fresh ingredients and a little cheese as a meat substitute.  Some part of the food should have lived in some form... the whole thing was prepared with joy, all good, thank you!']

Name: Lucky Star
Summary: Cantonese food, including hot pots & dim sum, in a straightforward dining room with burgundy tones.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Really nice, original Chinese food. We highly appreciated the friendly service and that all allergens were listed properly in the menu. Also our request of gluten-free version of a dish was taken care of with consideration. We highly recommend this place. We will be back.', 'Food taste is consider good in Europe country as some essential ingredients is not available. Services is good. Pricing is reasonable especially for set lunches that is available during Tuesday to Friday. Been there many times during my stay in Berlin.', 'Best 水煮鱼 in all of Berlin! Great prices and lovely staff. One really cute waitress who speaks good english and the bao dim sun mix is lovely. I was suprised to find this resteraunt when I arrived but it tasted so good I spent almost every night there for dinner in Berlin.']

Name: Boulevard Friedrichstrasse
Summary: Seasonal German cuisine & house-baked bread, dished up in a modern, straightforward room.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["I was a little disappointed with this as it had quite the high reviews. The food was average and didn't really have much flavor. The soup was a little too watery for my taste and needed salt, the bread was very dense. The Spätzle was very salty and was filled with onions - fried and spring onions and chives. It was really hard to finish cause the onions were overpowering everything else. Bratwurst was also underwhelming, could've used a little more flavor and little less water.

Service was fine, nothing special. Plenty of seating indoors and outdoors. You can pay by card. Overall, okay experience but will probably not be back.", "I was very satisfied with the service and completely dissatisfied with the cuisine.  Let's go in order: I showed up without a reservation on a Saturday around 6.45pm.  I was greeted with big smiles and immediately placed at the raised table next to the entrance.  Since at least three small tables remained empty during dinner, I would have preferred to be placed there.  But the service was truly so excellent and attentive that it made me forget where I was sitting.  Unfortunately I was really disappointed by the cuisine.  My rinderrouladen looked like the pre-cooked one from the supermarket, but much saltier and stringier. Served with a salad that looked like it had just been taken out of the bag and some anonymous potatoes.  I don't like leaving food on my plate, but once the meat was cold, it became the insole of my shoe.  I will return and try another course.  Maybe I was just unlucky, but from what I see it looks like the cuisine of a classic Berlin tourist restaurant.", 'It was lunchtime but super quiet, 3-4 locals in there.
I had schnitzel,  hubby had goulash.
Goulash was wonderful, warming, comforting and very tasty.
My schnitzel was served with not so warm potato salad, was OK but have had better.
Price was very reasonable']

Name: Da Vinci
Summary: Antipasti, pasta & Italian mains, plus pizzas, at a classic trattoria with red-check tablecloths.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Really delicious food and really good portions. The waiter was an Indian guy who gave impeccable service. We arrived in Berlin yesterday. I was really disappointed with everything we ate. Just came from Amsterdam where everything was delicious and then in Berlin, the food turned out to be not good and expensive , Da Vinci was a refreshing change. Great food , amazing service and HUGE portions', 'Da Vinci is a great spot for traditionally delicious Italian food, where many locals come for lunch. The pasta is freshly made here. We truly enjoyed the beef carpaccio for a light start. The salmon tagliatelle was great and the beef lasagna was brilliant. The lasagna is made with a combination of a hearty tomato sauce and a finely made bechamel, perfectly broiled in the oven.\n\nThe service was not so great. This place tends to get crowded, and they do not have enough waiters to manage the volume.', 'First time I went there, the lasagna was great though they didn’t give me olive unlike other people. Second time, the service was horrible and the spaghetti was also not well cooked. Not sure if that’s because it was lunch time or other reasons i don’t want to talk about.']

Name: Zosch
Summary: Schnitzels, burgers & beer in a relaxed bar with outdoor tables & a vaulted basement for live music.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
['Excellent old bar with vintage fittings and cigarette machine with fussball. I complimented the bartender about his bar. The outside space was nice and great beer at a decent price.', '- we sat upstairs and everyone’s phone suddenly lost network. Couldn’t be reachable and couldn’t make calls.

- The menu doesn’t really have many pleasant option.
- My hot chocolate was cold but the waitress was so nice., she went to warm up without complaining.
- The one female toilet was not flashing.
- The water in the toilet was freezing cold.
- The furniture was not giving.
- The ambiance wasn’t giving.

- The tacos were nice though.
- The beer was also nice 👍
And the waitress was really nice.', 'I highly recommend their dark beer, it was perfect for me. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Prices are normal. There was live music downstairs and it was pretty good but smoking is allowed. All in all, it is a good place to drink couple of rounds.']

Name: Stranero
Summary: Hip contemporary pizzeria with classic, vegan & vegetarian options, also available for takeout.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Great place, it was open until later. You can order on their website using the QR code on the table. The orders are provided very fast. The food was amazing, great neopolitan pizzas. The server was really nice and so was the rest of the staff. They took some time out of their closing schedule and helped us find a brewery we wanted to visit. Great experience.

Ps. Please be advised that you can only pay in cash

At least this was the status on 12.01.2024', "I've found out about Stranero back in 2019 from an Italian colleague of mine. Since then, I have been sure many people say that Stranero holds a crown of all Berlin's pizza places.
The taste, the quality, the atmosphere, and the staff friendliness are only the beginning of the long list of pros of this place.
The pizza is fresh, oven-baked, and made with high-quality ingredients. Must visit!", 'Great pizza in Wedding.
Prices are okay.
Staff is nice.
Just wish I could pay with card like it s 2024 :)

Only thing is it s quite loud inside.
But still, nice place.']

Name: Schäfer - Café Bar Restaurant
Summary: Unassuming restaurant offering German & Mediterranean dishes for breakfast, lunch & dinner.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews:
['We went there for burger sonntag today (burger with fries/country potato for 5.90 euro as of today). It was really good and of plenty amount. The veggie burger was made with very fresh produce and grilled tofu.

Before today we went there for lunch twice. Each time the food quality and quantity was more than what you expect for the amount you pay.

Not only that the restaurant owner and Staffs are really nice and friendly.

Deserves more than 5 stars. We found a local gem. Would come back again soon.', 'Very nice place to chill have eat some german kitchen !
the only thing i didnt like i got eiscafé in plastik glas ! it s no go for me . i m in Restaurant to eat and drink not with Plastik Glass !!!
The food of the taste was ok ! i ate Jägerschnitzel , it was reall salty for me but taste ok !
also it says on menu salt potatoes but it just came bolied potatoes! ( salz kartoffeln are like fried a bit in the pan normally!!', 'I was here for brunch on a Sunday. There was a decent selection of food for a very reasonable price - approx. 8 euro including coffee or tea. However, the quality and freshness of the food was very bad. It seemed that the food was lying around for quite a while - dry cheese and ham. The warm food smelled funny and not fresh at all. The bread was quite dry as well. One star for the friendly staff...']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 1:00 AM, 7:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: Open 24 hours, Sunday: Open 24 hours
Reviews:
['I have never eaten something that disgusting before.
Food came within 1 min to the table. In the worst presentation. Very cold, bacon stinked, fries was old and soaked in oil. Frankly it seemed that the whole meal was very old and sat there for some days. No idea.
I went to the manager and said that my burger is very bad and not edible. He ignored me. So I paid money for nothing and left without touching this meal ofc
I really do not understand how can any restaurant operate with such standards.', "Food is good, taste good I didn't say is healthy is not , people who work here should be more careful with orders, cuz sometimes I didn't received everything I paid for", 'The service is really bad. I’ve waited for my order around 15 minutes. The workers just didn’t want to accept my order. They made hot coffee instead of ice latte.']

Name: Amera
Summary: Mediterranean meat & seafood dishes are served along with pizza & pasta in a white-tablecloth venue.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['This Italian restaurant boasts delicious food and a stylish interior. Reservations are recommended. The staff is friendly, but there might be some internal issues (this is just a hunch). The only downside is the slightly high price point.', 'Visited the restaurant without reservation, it was busy but they gave us a table. Pasta was delicious but pizza was soggy. Overall it was a good experience. Would like to visit the restaurant again.', 'Wanted to say thank you to Amera restaurant for such a perfect evening for our big team. Everything was perfect - service, food, atmosphere and the whole place overall. We are happy that we chose this place to celebrate. I would recommend this place for a family dinner or a bigger group of people.']

Name: Namaste Italia
Summary: Mellow restaurant dishing up traditional Indian specialties, plus Italian snacks such as pizza.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Food is really good and prices are reasonable. Also located at quiet area. Has many vegetarian options available. Service is good.', 'With a nice location near a tennis court, this spot offers delicious Indian food and very friendly staff. The relaxed atmosphere is a bonus. Highly recommend!', 'An absolute delight, right in the heart of Tempelhof. You would not expect such excellent indian cuisine next to a tennis court, try the Mango lassi while you watch people play in the sunset. Highly recommend.']

Name: Hackethal's
Summary: Robust German classics like wurst, sauerkraut & dumplings in a lively pub brewing its own beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 6:30 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:30 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:30 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:30 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Amazing food service.
First, when I got there, I was lucky enough to find a parking place. Parking is very convenient, there are parking infront of the restaurant, or on the left or right.
The place is decorated a lot! It looks like a pub! Very interesting! You can seat down inside or outside, I chose outside.
As soon as you sat down staff came very quick, with a big smile. Which made the service so much better. Staff made sure everything is alright.
I ordered my food with my family, three delicious meals! Unfortunately, I forgot the names of the food!😂😅 Very quick food service, and delicious.
Really recommend this place! I would come here again!', 'My partner and I came here for dinner for an authentic German food experience and it was exactly what we got and more!

The service was friendly and kind, the waiter explained the food menu in English and in such detail that every meal sounded delicious.

We went for the slow cooked veal in red wine and port and the home made meatballs, both dishes were absolutely mouth watering and devoured quickly. They also brew their own beer!

The food came out fast and we were so satisfied with every part of our experience. I cannot recommend this place enough if you are ever in Berlin. Thank you to everyone that made our dining experience so wonderful.', 'We both came and got goulash as we previously had it else where and loved it. This was no exception was really lovely. The other options sounded good too. Staff were really friendly read and translated the menu for us without a problem. Can really rate this place!']

Name: Ristorante Torrisi
Summary: An unpretentious menu of traditional pizza, pasta & salads in a compact Italian restaurant.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['We went there around the peak time at 12:30 on Thursday. This may have affected the service but in combination with tasteless food I think this review is only fair.
Service: We waited 30 mins to be served with our drinks and a basket of bread with some small appetisers. Unfortunately we waited another 40 mins to get our antipasti and main dishes altogether. Service staff is also unfriendly.
The food: pizza was somewhat similar to frozen pizza, pasta with salmon was drenched into oil and bland sauce, antipasti was simple.
That’s sad for a Sicilian place to have such low standards. There are much better Italian places in the neighbourhood than this. I would not recommend.', "After spending a lot of time in Sicily I was excited and expected to eat some authentic food, but we were fairly disappointed. It tastes more like German interpretation of Italian cuisine.
Service was slow, 30 minutes to get drinks and bread, 1 hour for food.  After that all meals, both hot and cold (antipasti) arrived at the same time.
The price was fairly low, but even with that I can't say it was worth it.", 'Lovely little place. Cozy atmosphere. Good lunch menus. The pasta options I have tried so far were all tasty (even though they did not look like what I had expected). The prices are reasonable. The service is always very nice and all staff are full of smiles.']

Name: meet me halfway Berlin
Summary: Laid-back eatery offering all-day breakfast, salads & Persian staples, plus coffee & craft drinks.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews:
["It is expensive but the food quality can do better. I have the avocado but it doesn't look nice.
Service is okay, takes a long time to order, the waiter seems friendly but somehow you felt like they are not really flexible or make me confused... As maybe I can't connect with him...
The presentation of the food is good, the taste is okay..
Maybe I had order the wrong dish, I should order traditional Persian food.", 'I had here by far the best Persian (home-made style) food I ever had outside of Iran. The food tastes like grandma’s food but fancy, specially the crispy rice (Tahchin) that I haven’t seen in any other persian restaurant to be served. The menu is full of interesting stuff and I will definitely come back to try them all!
Also the staff and the owner are very welcoming, true representative of Iranian hospitality :-)', 'I ordered Saffron Chicken. The rice and the chicken were both quite nice! The ricer was well cooked, and the chicken was so tender that you it would gently break into slices once touched with a knife. The saffron sauce on the chicken was also quite tasty.

The interior decor was cute. Music was chill. It seems to be very busy both times we visited.

There’s WiFi here.']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['the lady who takes orders was exteremely agressive.She was yelling on me.i m regret to  have my lunch over there thank you', "Located in a very sketchy neighborhood. Super tiny eat in area. This branch does not accept any digital coupon from the McDonald's app.", '25.07.2019, out side Mc Donalds 35 degrees, inside  you kann die over there, 47 degrees. And you will just  hear im so sorry the air  conditiining ist broken 47 degrees EXTREME..\nNot for People whit  a weak heard.!!!!!!\nOtherwise i love MC Donalds']

Name: Moon Cuisine Weißensee
Summary: Pho, curry with chicken & other Vietnamese classics served in relaxed surrounds with outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Hidden gem in Weißensee. One of the freshest Vietnamese places in Berlin. Definitely get the glass noodle salad and papaya salad for starters! They also have their home made lemonades and juices including watermelon and aloe vera flavors. Also a Great lunch break spot as they have a deal for food + beverage', 'I had the magic moon tea - it changes colours depends which fruit juice you add!!\nMerkur plate was very delicious!\nIh and the shared appetizers for two - super yummy you can make it all vegetarian as well!', 'I enjoyed my food a lot. Was craving for curry and decided to go there. It’s not just an eatery, guys are actually trying to do something special, the menu is pretty big, a lot of food and drinks/beverages options. Prices are very acceptable, service is good. I ordered red curry with tofu and a homemade limo with strawberries and lime. Really recommend this place, gonna come there again.']

Name: Delhi 6 Restaurant - Berlin
Summary: Delhi street food-inspired Indian dishes at a lively, colorfully decorated venue with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['We had lunch at Delhi 6 Restaurant on our final day in Berlin, and it was a fantastic experience! We ordered the Veg Thali, which came with three curry dishes—Paneer Korma, Mixed Veg, and Chole—and added a Paneer Onion Kulcha as an extra. All the dishes were absolutely amazing, bursting with authentic flavors and rich taste.\n\nI must say, the Paneer Onion Kulcha was one of the best I’ve had outside India in many years—perfectly prepared and truly delicious. Thank you for such a delightful meal. We highly recommend Delhi 6 to anyone looking for an authentic Indian dining experience in Berlin!', 'I have been wanting to try Indian cuisine for a long time, where you can taste a variety of dishes in small portions. Finally, I got the chance. Everything was delicious. Especially the chicken and lamb. The chicken biryani was tasty as a whole dish. The rice and vegetables were cooked well. However, the chicken itself seemed average in the chicken biryani. The Mango Lassi was fabulous. At our request, the waiter provided a high chair for our child. We were sitting in the side extension. They opened the shutters there, and when it became hot, the air created a pleasant coolness. We really enjoyed the Indian cuisine. I definitely recommend this place to those who were nearby the Jewish Museum.', 'Delicious.  This was our first experience trying authentic Indian food for my son and I, and we loved it! The Delhi 6 Special #23 was amazing.  Thank you so much for an excellent meal.']

Name: Mama Cook
Summary: Trendy, fashionable Vietnamese eatery with terrace seating, cocktails & many vegetarian options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Our first meal in Berlin we stumbled upon this lovely gem with the best ambiance. Lots of locals there as well! Wide selection of alcohol and different types of food. My absolute favorite was the fried chicken dish with curry. The breading was exceptional with juicy chicken to be dipped in delicious curry. Everything was fresh but used a lot of repetitive sauces. The portions were decent size to be shared with friends. Lovely staffs! They only accept cash so bring $.', 'The food here is magnificent. All of us were very impressed with the and the service. I recommend that you book a table in advance as the restaurant is extremely popular. The prices are extremely reasonable. Will return as soon as possible.', 'What is really cool about this place is definitely the interior design, it’s just unnecessarily pretty!! It makes you just want to hang out in there even after you finish all the food. Which, by the way, is very tasty. I had a curry with shrimp and it was very fragrant. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I can definitely recommend this place.']

Name: Ristorante Diomira
Summary: Classic Italian & international dishes served in warm, wood-paneled surrounds with a beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Quick seating and prompt service. Atmosphere was nice. Convenient to my hotel two minutes away.  Food was great.  Thanks for a great dinner.', 'We’ve ordered an jegerschnitzel and a pizza. We could hear they was making schnitzel from skratch, that was good. It was good size but dry and thin. Fries was ok. But the side salat was horrible. It contained so much bottle dressing; it was drowning in some kind of weird dressing. And looked like they’ve put everything they had at the kitchen into the poor salat. Tomato, cucumber and some onion with lettuce would do better. Pizza was ok. Beer not so cold. Overall ok if you don’t have any other place to eat.', 'Worst italian restaurant ever. Received raw pizza, asked to make normal cooked pizza, so they put in the oven pizza with rucola and heated.. Asked why you doing this? said what you expect to eat in berlin for 10 eur.. Very sad place, very']

Name: Hallesches Haus Store
Summary: Coffee, natural wines & brunch with vegan options in a bright, plant-filled space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews:
['We visited Hallesches Haus for brunch on our most recent visit to Berlin.
It is conveniently located right next to the Hallesches Tor station and is within the heart of Kreuzberg, an up and coming vibrant neighbourhood of Berlin.

Do not let the outside of the building deceive you! Walking down the passageway, you catch a glimpse of the wonderful outdoor dining area that is full of foliage and overhead lighting.
When walking into the building you are greeted with a gift shop/store that sells a variety of products from independent suppliers and retailers.

We chose to sit indoors, the restaurant/cafe area is incredibly spacious, well lit and aesthetically pleasing. There is table service if you choose to dine in, but this was not communicated upon arrival leading to a bit of confusion, but it was not a problem.

In terms of the food, unfortunately the menu on the day we visited was very limited. We were told this was due to an event being held at the venue later in the day. Because of this, we opted to have the “Full Haus” and can gladly say this was delicious! The menu appears to change during weekdays and weekends so I would look online beforehand if you are planning a visit.

Service was quick and the prices reasonable for this area of Berlin. The staff were friendly and there was a particular English member of staff that really stood out amongst the rest in the best kind of way, unfortunately we did not get his name!

If you are in the area, I would highly recommend a visit to Hallesches Haus.', 'This is one of my favorite cafes 🌹 The high ceilings and vibrant atmosphere make it a great place to work on my laptop. Every visit feels like a mini vacation. They offer delicious food, cakes, drinks, and cocktails, and there’s a design store at the front. Please note, they only accept card payments.', "Food and location is nice and the service team is very kind. It's great that there are options for vegans and meat eaters too.
