Only negativity I would mention is that it took 20 minutes till I could order a coffee even though the place wasn't full at all. Still I can recommend this place and will definitely come back."]

Name: Asia Snack
Summary: Straightforward counter-serve outfit dishing up Asian-inspired stir-fries, rice dishes & noodles.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Had an incredible meal here for such good value for money. Really lovely food, huge portions and obviously totally worth it. I would have gone here every day had I not left Berlin…', 'So cheap and so good! Just happened so see the place while at the park and I made a really good choice. Chicken fried rice 6euro, very good for the price', 'I ordered the süɓ sauer ente kross (sweet& sauer crispy duck) for takeaway. Quick service, good taste, good prize, well sized portion, alu meal box keeping the dish hot and no additional plate needed at home. Beats cooking yourself all day long!']

Name: Al Catzone - Pizzeria
Summary: Easygoing destination with understated decor serving innovative plant-based Neapolitan pizzas.
Address: Eingang auf dem Mehringplatz, Brandesstraße 7, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["To the people complaining about size, are you kidding me? This place serves a proper, good-sized Neapolitan style pizza that won't leave you hungry - just look at the photo! The people who didn't know it's vegan were probably not taught to read in school 🙄\n\nHighly recommend the Helmut potato pizza, the blend of flavours is simple but gorgeous ❤️ the staff were very friendly and we had a great time here. Favourite vegan pizza place in Berlin right now!", 'Incredibly tasty! You’d think that a vegan pizza place would be limited in options, but every pizza was delicious. The Neapolitan style dough had the perfect crunchiness and wetness from the fresh tomato sauce. Salami, pepperoni, cheese… vegan and full of flavor. My recommendations: Dave Rave, Timo Truffle, Campani. The outdoor seating is great for an afternoon aperitivo.', 'it’s a bit expensive there, but definitely worth it! the pizza is fresh & well seasoned, the staff really is nice & helpful, and the atmosphere is amazing! the only thing i didn’t like here was the loud music. yet, i would highly recommend this place for a fancy dinner ;)']

Name: Katz Orange
Summary: Laid-back eatery with exposed brickwork, sofas & an international menu made with seasonal produce.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Amazing food. A bit pricey for the portions. Regardless would recommend. Food felt light (ceviche to share and flank steak). Closer to fine dining.', 'Food very good, old brewery converted to restaurant.\nSitting inside gets very noisy, almost annoying when busy.\nVery helpful staff, answered all sorts of questions thrown at them.', 'Great food - great overall experience. I went with my parents who visited for the weekend and they really loved it + were super happy to with the food. Service was very attentive and welcoming. Definitely coming back! :-)']

Name: Ristorante Nuovo Firenze
Summary: Italian cuisine served in an upbeat, casual environment with a full bar & sidewalk seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["Servers were nice when they're there, they're dressed nice, and the ambiance was pretty nice. Service itself was very slow, it's a very slow restaurant, you'll sit here for hours. Food itself was good, decent, fresh, al dente pastas and piping hot. Glass of vino were poured fairly, and their merlot was on the tart side, not full bodied. Everything was just enough flavor... so, for me, not enough. Fresh pepper and fresh grated parmesan weren't offered with pastas. If you need something that's comforting, not too much flavor, that can settle the belly, this may be the place for you if you have at least 2-3 hours to sit down. It was nice to get olives and fresh, good bread after you sit down.", 'The food was ok but not meeting the expectations of Italian kitchen. The bruschetta and mozarella tomato are quite large as appetizers but somehow need a bit more kick. The tiramisu did not have the amaretto taste. The service was very kind and good but my expectations were higher for an Italian restaurant at this location.', 'We went for lunch, so it was not so full and we had a nice service. They were really quick and always ready to serve us.
The food was really good!
It was really good Italian food, Even the tiramisu was really tasty. We had pasta and meat, both delicious.
The atmosphere is also nice, with the small lights on each tables making the table more cozy.
I really appreciated the set up of the table with a proper tablecloth, making it feeling more like home']

Name: Distrikt coffee
Summary: Trendy, industrial-chic cafe serving coffee, breakfast plates & smoothies in a plant-filled space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:30 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 4:30 PM
Reviews: ['Went here for breakfast. They have a great and delicious breakfast selection that pairs well with their excellent coffee. The batch brew was lovely, the French toast absolutely delicious and the tasting plate for their guest coffee beans was super nice!\nThey take no reservations, but are super well organized with making sure they seat people as soon as possible. :)', 'Honestly, great place for breakfast! I loved the atmosphere, very industrial style, and the coffee was amazing. We had pancakes, really, really delicious, great overall experience, perfect!', 'Great atmosphere 💫 had brunch on a Sat morning and waited 1 hour to be served unfortunately. Food was delicious 🥑']

Name: Engels
Summary: Hip cafe offering vegetarian & vegan breakfast options, as well as beer cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ['Breakfast here is amazing. Fresh, home-made, simple and tasty. Coffee spot on. And you can pay by card, which in Germany is still novelty', 'Very nice place to enjoy a good coffee. The vibes are very chill for book reading.', 'I only had Chai Latte because they would not make any coffee at 6:30pm and unfortunately it the taste was too weak and too milky and sugary. Not worth the price unfortunately(4euros). So cannot recommend it, sorry;(']

Name: Han West - Home of Dumplings
Summary: Compact restaurant offering Asian dumplings, including meat, veggie & vegan options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Small street food kitchen near the Tempelhofer Feld. The dumplings are well made. We had some with minced meat and chili, which reminded us of Sichuan. My Taiwanese friend said that they were quite authentic, the dough was a bit too thick. We also had buns with grilled pork belly, which reminded us more of Hong Kong or Taiwan. The pork belly was very crispy and aromatically marinated, the meat juicy and soft. You can use the tables of the Brauhaus Nelich next door, their beer goes really well with it. Only card payment.', 'I had a pork belly bao and a beer from the brewery next door. It was quite filling and really delicious with a good sized chunk of meat with crackling. Hole in the wall place with seating along the wall outside. Service was friendly and swift and the food good value for money. Highly recommended!', 'Very, very tasty! The peanut sauce is awesome, go for the combo box with the fries and try the Taiwanese pork bun, its so good!']

Name: MAMA KALO
Summary: French & German bistro fare like tarte flambée & spaetzle in a quaint space with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['We were looking for a place to eat and found this gem :) the staff are so so friendly and kind, the food was also delicious. I like the idea of combining French and German cuisine, the galette with mushrooms was top😍 they have a cute terrace too. I recommend it!', 'I know that most places serve avocado on toast. Yes it’s common and yes it’s a staple brunch dish. This on the other hand was truly delicious 😋. It was spectacular in all aspects. Not only was the dish marvellous 🤩, but the service was on another level. I was there on the 1st of May with a friend. The waitress was the kindest and most helpful I’ve encountered in Berlin. I will be back to try the other dishes. This place is a real gem 💎.', 'We loved this place! Located on a nice spot near Tempelhof park.\nVery tasty with great combinations of flavour. Vegan options and nice atmosphere. We had a potato soup as a starter and for main we shared a Flammkuchen with pears and sweet toasted nuts and a Vegan Galette. Drinks and dessert were great too! Highly recommend :)\nHope we visit you again soon!!']

Name: QADMOUS - Libanesisches Restaurant Berlin
Summary: White-tablecloth venue supplying traditional Lebanese dishes & desserts, plus cocktails & wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ["It was the first restaurant I visited in Berlin and I wasn't disappointed at all. This restaurant offers a wide variety of authentic Lebanese dishes. I recommend it 😁 the service was amazing, the staff were very friendly, the atmosphere was so peaceful and romantic, perfect place for a date 🌹", 'This Levanti cuisine restaurant is rather on an expensive end, well decorated interior. The food was great, the serviceman’s prompt and super friendly.', 'Food is nice but jeeesus these prices. I’d give 4* for food and 1* for the value/money. I recall them being a lot cheaper in the past where I think the evaluations come from. They are priced like an upscale restaurant but the food is normal casual Lebanese food like you get it in so many places in berlin for half the price.']

Name: Il Pane e le Rose
Summary: Antipasti, pasta, pizzas & stylishly plated mains at a bright, understated trattoria with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['delicious spaghetti con vongole 🍝😋 and pinot grigio was very chilled and crisp and the tiramisu was lovely as well.', 'Nice Italian restaurant, in a convenient location, with a wide menu. The pizzas and pastas are very good, and the prices are reasonable.

The place is quite big, with several big rooms making it suitable for groups or for a more intimate dinner. There are also a few tables in the small terrace.

The restaurant is children friendly. They offer children options in the menu, have high chairs and the staff is welcoming.', 'Decent gorgonzola pizza for a decent price. The salads looked good too. The salami pizza was more on the edible side then good.

Our waiter was friendly, but either drunk or super unfocused, barely got anything right.']

Name: Mami Camilla Pizzeria
Summary: Pizza with standard & vegetarian toppings, dished up in a breezy room with rustic wooden tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Went here after many years and the menu seems to have changed a bit. The pizza dough is now sour dough, I have to say it’s absolutely fabulous. I really enjoyed it. And there was a good amount of cheese on it. Keep it up ❤️', 'Sad and disappointing new opening! Have been a devoted client for 10 years. The restaurant had been closed for renovations and since then it has turned into a very sketchy place.

Menu is a Dropbox link scanned from the cell phone of one of the servers.
Menu is much smaller and the quality of the food has gone down very sadly. Servers have ignored us for all night and then when we finally left there was no way to get an official receipt.
Cash payment only.
This pic is what we got, together with a sarcastic unfriendly comment from the owner to volunteer our time to help him with accounting - as I insisted on getting an invoice.

When I asked what happened to the “old” Mami Camilla I was told they are cutting costs…never seen the restaurant so empty so I fear that these decisions are cutting clients more than costs. Very disappointed overall :(', 'The Margherita pizza had tremendous potential, because the dough is excellent, but the tomato sauce was at a high level of acidity.  With a delicious tomato sauce, the pizza will be perfect.  When we ordered the pizza with toppings a week ago, it was excellent.']

Name: Gasthaus Alt Wien, Berlin
Summary: Timbered dining room turning out classic Austrian dishes like tafelspitz & Wiener schnitzel.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['We ate here on the recommendation from a friend. The schnitzel was absolutely delicious (and huge). We also had a tasty salad. Unfortunately when we got the bill, we were disappointed in the supplementary charges. We asked for tap water and were strongly discouraged by the server due to the taste. We agreed to bottled water and were shocked to see it on the bill for €7 - nearly 2x what most restaurants charge. We also planned to split the schnitzel and were offered separate plates for €1, but it was actually €1,50 - a small difference but annoying. We also were charged €2 extra for cranberries which is reasonable, but again we didn’t know.  Overall, I would recommend the food but the overall experience just felt like a money grab.', 'Seems to me as one of the best Restaurants for "Wiener Schnitzel". Would always prefer this place instead of an Bavarian Wirtshaus since it is less touristic and way more authentic. Food is extraordinary good.', "Unbelievably good!
The other reviewers were not exaggerating when saying this wiener schnitzel was amazing (and the large portion is HUGE, so beware if you do not eat a lot).
The waitress was very very nice.
I'll be sure to come back to this place whenever I'm back to Berlin."]

Name: Taleh Thai
Summary: Thai specialties & veggie options at an unpretentious setup with Asian motifs & outside tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews:
['Finally found a decent Thai restaurant in Berlin. Ordered the red and green curries; a little watery but still delicious and flavorful. Service was great as well. Will be back soon!', 'been to taleh thai a lot and mostly everyweek, the food was really delicious and so tasty!! you can request as spicy as you wish,
the portion is good and price are affordable.

definitely will recommend to everyone..

❤️❤️❤️', "Nice, small Thai Restaurant in Prenzlauer Berg. I really really like the place, it's one of the few real Thai restaurants in Berlin. It has its own flavour and they're preparing meals that are consistently good.
I love that they use the typical veggies like small Thai eggplants.
The place has few tables, I'd recommend to make a reservation instead of trying your luck, especially if there's more than two of you. I tried several dishes here but the green curry is one of my favourites, it tastes different from all others Thai I've tried in Berlin and it's really good.
Prices are fair for the area, most main meals are within the 13~14 euros range.
In general it's a restaurant I'd surely recommend for a nice and original Thai meal in Berlin."]

Name: A Cabana
Summary: Portuguese staples like garlic shrimp prepared in a snug cafe with outdoor tables & a festive vibe.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews:
['A Cabana is a nicely located and authentic Portuguese experience - they offer a wide variety of Portuguese dishes with fish and meat, as well as some vegetarian rice/omelette dishes. While the main courses and drinks were very enjoyable, we can’t recommend the (frozen and reheated) pastel de natas. Service was okay, but friendly.', 'Authentic Portuguese restaurant, the only difference from the food I had in Lisbon was the prices.

The fish and the seafood was one of the freshest we have had in Berlin.

The portions are big. The octopus had 3 tentacles served.

As mentioned above, it is pricey. Appetizers ca. 12€ each, main dishes 15-20 €. This is why I deducted one star. Otherwise perfect.', 'The chorizo was amazing and so are the mussels. I ordered the grilled octopus which was unfortunately a bit overcooked. Service was great and a great experience overall']

Name: Chez Maurice
Summary: Upscale, classic French plates & wine served in an intimate eatery with a rustic, romantic vibe.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['From my perspective one of the best and most authentic French restaurants in Berlin. The food is absolutely delicious and the chef, every time you compliment him on his food, is authentically happy. I had times, when the kitchen had its ups and downs. However, the quality is unmatched. Never miss a good time at Chez Maurice! If you are in Berlin, this is definitely a must do. Great food, great atmosphere and the staff is always making sure that you have a time to remember! Thank you 😊', 'French restaurant in Friedrichshain. Excellent menue with a good variety of french dishes. Goose patete and the mussels were excellent. Very good wine card as well.', "very limited menu options, the food was incredibly hot, almost burned my mouth eating it, ordered coq au vin, the quantity was so much i couldn't finish it, the carrots weren't properly cooked, so it was ok, ordered red wine which was not so good but it's cheap so cant complain, they'll bring double quantity of wine without even asking which wasnt good, if u air the wine for sometimes then it's palatable.  also it's bit on the expensive side with main couses mostly on 25€ range gping till 50s."]

Name: Monsieur Vuong
Summary: Laid-back Vietnamese restaurant with banquette seating, outdoor tables & a trendy vibe.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Wonderful experience. We had a nice lunch with family. The service is very good and fast, they make good recommendations and they are careful about your requests. We really enjoyed our lunch here!', 'Personally, I think it’s overrated for me. The food is alright. If you enjoy fusion food, sure you might like it. Not that many options in the menu. You can try it once but I won’t come back, especially for Vietnamese foods. The interior and atmosphere are nice, lot of sits. Staffs are nice.', 'Delicious asian food, warm and friendly staff, inviting and cozy atmosphere, Monsieur Vuong is one of the best restaurants in Berlin. No wonder they are popular in the area. Definitely highly recommended']

Name: Das Lemke - Biergarten, Brauerei, Deutsche Küche
Summary: Brewery bar & restaurant with on-site copper brewing vessels, German food & seasonal beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['We went to this place with a bunch of friends
We tried tasting every possible beer they have - we ordered west coast IPA, helles, Indian pale ale and many more with pommes frites. The washroom was quite innovative with a cockroach', 'Had a very late hour service, for which i am very glad. Lemke is a solid brand, location inspired somehow from Brewdog style, not bad. Didnt check the food, but the beer was OK. The Garden is a special area, very comfy, i love it. Do not be afraid of the rats passing by occasionally. They are polite, you can even give them names. Dont chase them away, they always comeback. Pretend you are in Paris if you think its an unappropriate showing up. PS: the restaurant have nothing to do with that, its just a consequance of a very crowded area and sometimes a poor public service.', "I ordered Munich-style helles, Sprite 0.4L, Big knuckle of pork.
Pork. problem is, its skin is too chewy and hard and too oily.
I can't even eat this one, but still inside is very tender and juicy.
Service wise, if you don't ask it first, they won't do anything.
It took me 15 minutes to give me the menu.
Intermediate, not very recommend."]

Name: YOSOY TAPAS BERLIN
Summary: Easygoing establishment serving Spanish tapas & main dishes amid retro-chic surrounds.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 1:30 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 1:30 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['This place was very different from every other place we visited in Berlin.\nWe came here after a long day of traveling, and the food was incredibly comforting. Warm, delicious, exactly what we needed. Great tapas place. Authentic af', 'The bell peppers are very recommended; they taste so good; a must try (especially if you never tried them from Spain). The sardines were good too. They have a big selection of wine to pair.', 'Great tapas place if you are looking for somethung to eat in the area. The portions are rather generous, so you might want to be careful when ordering the tapas-we ended up asking the staff to pack some of our leftovers. Pro tip: better reserve a table beforehand since the restaurant can get quite busy in the evening. We went there for lunch, so we got the table straight away. All in all, loved it here and would definitely coming back!!']

Name: Dolores Mitte
Summary: Californian-style burrito restaurant with slogans on the walls & a counter with fresh ingredients.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews:
['Summary: disappointing just overwhelming mushy burrito with unbalanced flavor with friendly service at the counter; I asked for a recommendation, because I’m not an expert in „Mexican“ food and also not a big fan, but the high frequency of visitors made me want to try it: the recommendation was the wicked beef burrito

Dishes (- negative / = ok / + positive):
- Burrito wicked beef: beef was ok, unbalanced flavor overall with too much of everything making it a mushy „I don’t know what I am eating“ experience; took a little bit of spicy and that was the major flavor I left with
= added extra guacamole on the side which was ok

Service:
+ friendly service at the counter

Price:
+ fair price for value for a big burrito; I’d prefer if they added a little love and balance the amount of ingredients so that a well-balanced umami flavor results

Atmosphere:
+ easy fast food style', 'Dolores offers a take on Mexican food that feels more like a nod to Chipotle than an authentic experience. While the flavors are decent, it’s clear they’ve tailored their menu to cater to a broader palate, resulting in a version of Mexican cuisine that lacks the depth and richness you might expect from a more traditional establishment.

One of the main drawbacks is the portion size. The servings are surprisingly small, especially when considering the recent price hikes. It’s hard to justify the cost when you feel like you’re not getting much for your money.

Additionally, the payment process leaves a bit to be desired. Even if you’re just picking up a quick bite, you’re nudged into selecting a tip, reminiscent of the tipping culture in the U.S. It’s a bit off-putting, especially in Berlin, where service workers are generally paid fairly. This push for tipping feels out of place and adds an unnecessary layer of guilt to what should be a simple transaction.

Overall, while Dolores Mitte might scratch the itch for a quick and familiar meal, it falls short in value and authenticity.', 'Loved the food. The bowl seems initially a bit small but it gets filling faaast. The homemade corn chips live rent free in my head now.']

Name: Hofbräu Wirtshaus Berlin
Summary: Bar-restaurant with wooden benches, Bavarian-style food & beer, show band & staff in regional dress.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['We had great lunch here!
Did not expected so much food 😅- we ordered a soup, 2 main meals and 1 additional 1/2 portion meal!🤤
My husband ate most of it.
4 person could eat this lunch.🙈🤭
If you want great local food with big portions to feel real Berlin come to this beer garden!
Strong recommendation! 👏🤩', 'Great beer garden’s atmosphere. Fast and good service. Restaurant male staffs were very friendly. HB beers were good. The roasted/crispy pork legs were a bit overcooked so that meat was dried out. You can’t complain about German sausages as it is one of the best sausages in the world. They also had local music band playing while you enjoy your beers.', 'Kid friendly, kids menu in pictures. Did not have a reservation but you can do it in advance.  There was a live band, which was awesome. The food was good, be prepared to explore a little. Server had a lot of tables so it took a bit longer than expected.  Plenty of inside and outside seating.']

Name: Kilkenny Irish Pub
Summary: Easygoing alehouse offering straightforward pub grub, plus stout & German beers.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["Right next to Hackescher Markt station, this is a fun Irish pub with many screens showing sports and live music. The bar staff were friendly and efficient in dealing with large groups. The Guinness was actually pretty good. It wouldn't be my first choice for a romantic evening out, but it's a decent place for a drink watching some football", 'Great selection of British beers that are all available in German sizes (500ML). You can get a fresh pint of Guinness, Kilkenny’s here or fresh ciders that are not too sweet.

Can’t talk on the food, but the inside provides a really cozy ambiance and there is a roomy terrace outside to have a nice drink in the sun.

Great service too - they come and take your order at your table which is not the standard in Berlin.', 'Great spot by Hackescher Markt station. Atmosphere is spot on, and the food was lovely. Staff were brilliant and very friendly - definitely recommend if you’re in the area!']

Name: Hafenbar Berlin
Summary: Nightclub & disco at the TV tower with maritime decor & a convivial pub atmosphere.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: Closed, Friday: 9:00 PM – 5:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 PM – 5:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['When visiting Berlin, this club is centrally located. Their mixed drinks are good and strong. Everyone there was having fun. Lot’s of English songs in the mix, was a nice plus. Songs that bring you way back.', 'Visited this place with friends on a Saturday. Great experience! Great atmosphere, great music, great mix of people from different ages, and very friendly staff. Will absolutely recommend this place for a night out with friends!', 'Really fun and warm environment. Thank you Denise for the friendly chat, as non german speakers we had a really nice chat as tourists']

Name: Belushi's Berlin (Alexanderplatz)
Summary: Informal chain bar with TV sport and live entertainment, plus a burger menu and global comfort food.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 1:30 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 1:30 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 1:30 AM
Reviews: ['The atmosphere at this place was really great. We’re from Australia and we love a sports bar - this definitely was the vibe. The food wasn’t too expensive and the drinks were nice and cheap! My only criticism is the classic burger was a little dry and the patty was too thick.', 'This place is great, always busy with a nice atmosphere!\n\nHumberto especially was super friendly and nice, if you stay at the hostel there are some good discounts too! There are some good deals for each day of the week ☺️', 'Nice place to watch matches. But they would *definitely* need better chairs and tables. At least on the first floor.']

Name: Tuans Hütte Thai u. Sushi
Summary: Thai curries, soups & noodles in a bright, airy space with a tropically themed, straw-thatched bar.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['For me it’s the best Thai restaurant in Berlin. Never disappointed. Ok there’s one time one of the waitress was not so friendly to us, but most of them are super nice. the experience is always the top. I won’t let one incident to affect my opinion cause it’s so hard to find something nice in Berlin. So I will endure with her that attitude. 🙂', 'It was one of the best thai food I have ever had. So delicious, I was just smiling during eating! I really recommend this place to everyone who loves good thai food! Staff is really friendly and place has opportunity to eat inside or outside. Absolutely love it!', 'I have been here many times in the past, and 2 days ago we tried again- on the 05.08, but the taste was not like before- rather tasteless. I have asked to make it spicy, but it was not spicy at all 😁.']

Name: Oxymoron
Summary: Elegant, 1920s-style lounge bar & restaurant with brass lamps, a French-Italian menu & a courtyard.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Nice delicious food with vegan and vegetarian options. Friendly staff who is quick to help and advise if needed. Would highly recommend coming here for lunch or dinner. In a nice area as well!', 'Amazing & peaceful environment right in the middle of Berlin. Marcel, our waiter was perfect with suggestions and always the right timing. What a pleasure…and the food absolutely tasteful. Price were more than correct for such level of service. Hope to be back soon. 🙏🏼', 'What a great restaurant-you need to try this quiet hideaway near Hackescher Markt.  Oxymoron is found in an alley-perfect for a memorable evening. Ziga was our server. He was great, attentive & gave us suggestions on food choices. The parsley risotto with mushrooms was creamy & delicious. Also the veal, asparagus & new potatoes was mouthwatering. The rhubarb cheesecake did not disappoint for dessert. Overall, this was a fabulous evening.']

Name: Trattoria Peretti
Summary: Pizza, salads & homemade pasta in a relaxed venue with al fresco tables in a covered passageway.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews: ["It's a place with very nice feel, good service and tasty food. Service was pretty quick and portions were quite sizable. Both pizza and pasta were great, so we went for dessert... aaand it wasn't as great. But overall experience was excellent.", 'Very good service, short waiting time. The food was very good. Tomato soup was delicious, Parma pizza very good and quite large, with lots of rucola on top. Panna cotta was heaven in my mouth. Everything cost less than 30€. It was lovely to sit outside. There was a nice fountain nearby.', "I've been there yesterday with 10 other people. The service was surprisingly good. The waiters were super kind, helpful and attentive. We neither couldn't complain about the food. It was served quickly, at the same time, looked good and tasted good as well. I'd definitely come back. Tiny improvement suggestion would be the bread that was served in the beginning :) more crispy and fluffy would be awesome!"]

Name: Marcus Brewery Berlin
Summary: Traditional pub serving up house-brewed beers alongside schnitzels, pork knuckles & fried potatoes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['I could recommend you to order the pork knuckle here! The meat was not dry at all and  the skin was so crispy. Unfortunately it came without any brown sauce.

The schnitzel was just ok, not the thin type of schnitzel. Another tip: try their beer mustard on the table, it taste so good 👍🏻', 'Not sure why anyone would be negative about this place….went there for our last meal in Berlin after staying here a month and it was fantastic. Pork was delicious, potato salad was great, beer is…local….and that’s what counts (so it’s not the bubbly mass produced stuff you get off tap in an average pub….thats what makes it great). Service was quick and friendly…my German is terrible….the staff’s English was great. Loved it.', "AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!

Worst beer I have EVER drunk. Unpalatable. Can't even describe in words how unpleasant it tasted. Warm, flat, sour, and tasted gone off if you can imagine that taste.

No water in the taps in the bathroom, walking back to my table I saw a tall fridge with pre poured beers in. Certain they gave me one of these then.
Tried to charge me much more for this AWFUL beer than most of the much nicer bars I went to in Berlin.

I ordered food but cancelled it after tasting my beer. Having read the other reviews, I'm very happy I did.
Service got short with me when I said I had to leave.

0/5, only rating one star as there's no lower option."]

Name: Sophien 11
Summary: Flammkuchen & robust German meat & fish dishes in a homey restaurant with a leafy courtyard.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["Recommended by an American friend who lives a few months a year in Berlin, excellent suggestion. My wife had the devil's schnitzel, I had the goulash, and both were delicious. Potato soup to start was perfect. We did not realize there was an outside area to eat but it would not have mattered for us because it was 3° out and we needed someplace warm. The inside space was quaint, pictures on the walls, an old-fashioned cash register, only a few tables and beer taps that look like they have been there forever", 'Great place for authentic German food. Very pleasant premises and good service. A lot of food for the money. Cash payment only.', 'If you are in the Jewish quarter near Hackescher Markt, you need to find Sophie’s 11, a small quaint restaurant that serves traditional German food. From the fresh flowers on the tables to the original historic photos on the walls, this place is a gem! We both ordered pork schnitzel. One with mushrooms & the other with horseradish. Both delicious with a chilled white wine. Dessert of kaiserschmarrn was a delight!  Thank you gals for such a memorable evening in Berlin, your historical & beautiful city. We hope to be back!💕']

Name: Berlin TV Tower
Summary: 368m-tall tower, opened in 1969, with a viewing gallery at 203m and revolving restaurant at 207m.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Had a fun visit overlooking Berlin. If you don’t buy tickets in advance get there first thing when they open. We were able to go straight up but the next three time windows were sold out.', 'One of the best places to have a Birds Eye vote of Berlin. A must for any tourists I would say
Do buy the tickets in advance and if you have a Berlin tourist card you can get the ticket cheaper so definitely worth having
There is a security check prior to you start.
You get into a lift and it takes you to the viewing deck there is a restaurant too and it is worth booking a table but do check the menu as for a vegetarian (me) I couldn’t find any thing I would eat so I didn’t book a table but it does have a revolving floor and worth a visit', 'Our pre-purchased tickets were on my phone and my phone died. They were able to look up our reservation and everything went smoothly. It is definitely worth the visit to the top and the restaurant was worth it too! The view is incredible, especially at sunset.']

Name: Carambar
Summary: Burgers, nachos & currywurst in a lively venue with a lengthy cocktail menu, a DJ & patio seating.
Reviews: ['Although the restaurant offers 1000 different meals, the quality of food is quite high. Food is really delicious. Staff was friendly. We ordered Nachos chicken cheese, Tomato-cream-soup Mozzarella and Chicken red curry. Everything was delicious and prices are affordable.', 'We came with a group of 7 people with friends from Brazil, we love this restaurant, but today we are very disappointed. today is Monday, 22.00, there are practically no guests, NO ONE comes to our table either during the order or after the meal, I raised my hand, approached the staff personally, they just forgot about us every time. absolute disregard, they just talked among themselves and joked. This is the first time in Berlin that I encounter such service. Just disappointment and no words. My condolences to the management for such staff.', 'I was just recently in Berlin with my father and this turned out to be our favorite place to return to. Very broad menu so everyone can find something they like. The meat was great.']

Name: Com Viet
Summary: Snug, charming restaurant with sidewalk tables dishing up traditional Vietnamese fare.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews: ["Very good value for money, especially if you take the Mittag menu. Nothing exceptional about the food, but it's a generous serving, fresh and quite tasty.\nService can be a bit slow because of the number of clients.\nGo there for a cheap and nice lunch break.", "Very cosy and affordable place not far from Museum Insel. The lady that took my order was very professional as she should be but that's enough if you get my order wrong. I reiterated as much as I could that I did not want soup after she recommended pho. I told her I wanted either rice or rice noodles and that I also wanted it to be very spicy but she ended up bringing me soup anyways. I'm disappointed is an understatement.", "Cozy little place with nice Viet cuisine. They give very generous portions for the price. The tables have pictures and notes from other diners, it's a nice way to pass time while waiting for food."]

Name: from Hanoi with Love
Summary: Small, rotating selection of Vietnamese rice & noodle dishes, plus vegan options, in a trendy space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Lovely food and service. Fast yet friendly and restful. Didn’t struggle to get a table Friday evening. Ordered veggie pho and a lassi. Will come back to try one of their salads. Very reasonably priced for the apparent quality. Cash only.', 'My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Berlin. This place never disappoints, and it has never disappointed in the 7 years I have been going there. Do yourself a favor and try the crispy duck. Great service too!', "Really nice little place in Neukölln. Wenn went there because it was not far from where we were staying and we were very pleased. We ordered the fried wonton as a starter to share (the portion cames with 5 peace's, although I only remembered to take a photo when there was only one left), the crispy duck and the wonton noodle soup, a lemonade and an iced green tea to drink. Everything was very fresh and tasty, and the portions were quite generous. The price was really good also (it came at about 25 euros altogether). If I had the chance, would definitely go back."]

Name: Karabach
Summary: Azeri barbecue restaurant with elegant traditional décor & a sizzling open kitchen.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Tasty food with good atmosphere. Need to spend much time to find a parking in the area 😀', 'A place with nice atmosphere and feeling. Oriental music. The service is super friendly, nice and fast; they can also help you in meal recommendations or descriptions. A bit pricey, but still affordable. The food is great - all fresh and delicious. Highly recommended.', 'If you’re a foodie like me, you’ll love this place! The menu has a fantastic selection of dishes, and we loved everything we tried. We only had good comments about the food. I can’t wait to come back again! Also after getting acquainted with Azerbaijani cuisine and culture here, we decided to travel to Azerbaijan sometime.']

Name: W.n.9 - Oyster bar and kitchen
Summary: Cozy neighborhood hangout with a terrace, serving aperitifs & sophisticated seafood plates.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Wow, really good seafood which is so rare to come across in Berlin. Everything was great and loved the orange wine, splendid', 'I recently visited this exceptional oyster bar that truly exceeded my expectations. I had the oysters that were incredibly fresh, bursting with flavor, and the mussels were a standout—plump, perfectly cooked, and absolutely delicious. The warm, welcoming staff added to the delightful experience, making the atmosphere as inviting as the food was delectable. Love this place, it is a gem for those who want to have romantic dinner and into seafood of course!!', 'Great cozy find in my neighborhood! The employees are really kind and attentive, the homemade food is exquisite, wine and oysters of great quality at a very friendly price. Definitely a new favorite in the area, will be back!']

Name: 21 gramm
Summary: Chill, old-world eatery with a brick-lined terrace serving cocktails, bar bites & all-day brunch.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews: ['A mixed experience—while the ambiance is charming, the food fell short of expectations. The lime cake was underbaked and disappointing, though the banana bread was enjoyable. The flat white was merely average, and the brunch menu overall lacks variety and options. A decent spot, but not quite living up to its reputation.', "Freshly squeezed orange juice was fantastic! Overall we were happy with our food & drinks, but only gave 4 ⭐ because the outside area is quite small, but packed with tables, so it's full of people and loud. I get the need to make money, but the vibe was ruined when people next to us started smoking. Yeah it's open air, but please don't allow smoking in such a tight outdoor space where the smoke will inevitably annoy other guests.", 'Great place, haven’t been in half a decade but glad to have dropped by. Love the cryptkeepee vibes and jumping over to a cemetery right after. On weekends there are no reservations, however we got in for a table for 4 with a 10 minute wait. Limited food options as it’s almost exclusively a brunch affair although we were pretty satisfied!']

Name: Barra
Summary: Elevated dishes & natural wines in an intimate, minimalist restaurant, with bar & communal seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 11:45 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:45 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:45 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:45 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:45 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['An exceptional experience! We would come back every day of the week but we don’t live in Berlin. 😅
We ordered the entire menu and it was delicious throughout its entirety. Flavors were building up over time and there were some pretty nice surprises.
Their wine list is also very exciting and we trusted the staff with some nice recommendations.
Come here if you want to have a perfect evening 🙏', "Barra was an incredible recomendation from a very good friend of mine, who also joined me for this feast of a meal…
We had never visited before, but the expectation was high, and it really lived up to the promise, i would say it smashed all of my expectations to the moon!
What just happened here, I'm pretty sure i can't remember ever happening, the starters, the main, desert, coffee, staff and the restaurant deco were absolutely all in tune, unbelievable to say the least!!
I don't have any words to describe better what just happen, every choice was a bliss, perfectly crafted, engineered, created with such care it would seem all those dishes were uniquely made for us... Extraordinary...
You can absolutely try anything, you won't be disappointed! We tried the Oysters, the Tuna with cocumber, the melon Gazpacho, and the Girolles, for desert the Figs with icecream...
The staff were incredibly thoughtful, friendly and you could tell they loved what they were doing and this is maybe the main point for all the success on this restaurant.
Thank you so so much for this experience! 10 points out 10! 🙏🏻🙏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻", 'Been here twice and had a great experience both times with amazing food and great service.

Lots of amazing different tastes in the dishes with a great wine list.']

Name: La Cantine d'Augusta Käse Restaurant & Wein Bar
Summary: Brunch, French cheeses & wine, plus fondue & raclette, served at a long table or counter seats.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['We wanted to try fundu so we found this French restaurant in Germany.

Food: delicious. We ordered fundu for 2 and it was a lot of food for us. He even gave us an extra round of green salad

Services: our waiter spoke 3 languages: German, French, and English. Feel free to speak to him in any other one and he might know. Very friendly.

Drinks: they have a large selection of wine. Beer is also available.

Cheese: yes they are a cheese restaurant. If you want CHEESE, you come to the right place

Location: 1 block away from the subway station

Definitely would come back', "I visited Berlin in 2018 & came here, when booking to come again in 2024 I immediately booked a table & couldn't wait to visit again. Dream for a cheese lover!

I would have liked to see some options for slightly smaller plates / versions of some things, we had raclette & it was delicious (so MUCH cheese!) but I'd have loved the opportunity to have it slightly smaller & be able to add some other dishes. ALL the cheese 🧀😍", "Extraordinary wines, exceptional friendly and skilled service, great menu. Couldn't be better. I'm glad to have found this place and even more happy that they're opening a second venue in Charlottenburg in September 2024."]

Name: WaWa Berlin
Summary: Bulgogi & Korean hotteok sweet pancakes in a stylish space with exposed bricks & wood bench seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Highly recommend!!! Tasty beef with noodles pot.
It came with a little kimchi.
The kimchi tofu soup with pork was good as well as the bibimbpa. I hope I can try the cheese beef.. not enough space for my stomach.
Really enjoyed the meal! Very good price as the portion was big.', "Went here with a friend and had a great time. Fairly small menu with the main dishes being bulgogi, bibimbap and a few soups. Personally really loved the signature hot cheese bulgogi! I also haven't really seen hotteok in Berlin much, so was really nice to have it for dessert, incredibly delicious. 잘 먹었어요~", 'Delicious!
The cheese beef under the category Wawa signature is absolutely tasty!

I asked for super spicy and it was super spicy.

I’m very happy with the food.

We also ordered bulgogi and bibimbap.
All of us were very happy with the food. It fits Asians’ taste and we would love to visit again!']

Name: Lagalante
Summary: Italian restaurant serving classic meals in a stylish, contemporary space with rustic touches.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews: ["Nice Italian food, friendly and accommodating stuff although maybe one person for all tables was too little. For that price range I would expect some more care around the dishes in terms of presenting them and talking them through. The deer meat was exceptional. We got it twice but the portions seemed very different in the plates with one bring significantly smaller. We enjoyed the small restaurant but for that price I think we'd probably try exploring new ones instead of revisiting.", "The food was delicious, it felt fansy but delicate and homely. Dessert didn't disappoint either. The waiting stuff was wery nice.\nI think the restaurant is a great date spot.", "It's a very nice and cozy Italian restaurant. The food is delicious, especially the hand-made pasta.\nIt's a true culinary experience. Loved it!!"]

Name: Barkett
Summary: Stylish cocktail & craft-beer hangout with a mod vibe, open-mike nights & regular live music.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Reviews: ['Went there for a pop up filter café event on Sunday and I really enjoyed it. The bar is in a very nice neighbourhood, the staffs are friendly and the coffees are tasty. Will definitely recommend this place!', 'Went there for the first time last summer, since then every time I been in Berlin I had to go for a drink.\nGreat vibes, nice music and a five star service.', "Quite expat-ish bar, but they do have a smokers' room, one changing craft beer, alright wines and it gets even better when you sit outside watching the bridge."]

Name: Restaurant Varadero
Summary: Cuban cuisine, plus cigars & cocktails, in a laid-back setting decorated with graffiti.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['I tried the Plato Vegetariano and it was pretty good, nicely seasoned. This restaurant has a decent amount of vegetarian options, which I really appreciate. Overall a nice place to come for a relaxed evening with friends, also just for some drinks :)', 'One of those restaurants that seem like a local neighborhood fave. First time for Cuban food. Nice friendly and lively atmosphere. Good food, good portions. Enjoyed the tamales the most.\nLots of fun cocktails at reasonable prices! Gal like me who usually never does cocktails still had two.', 'Delicious food and fantastic atmosphere. The place is chilled and cosy, with a little dance floor at the back. The food is really tasty and well price, with a huge cocktail menu, which are also well priced. The staff are very friendly and can make good recommendations. For a meal for 2, plus a cocktail each and a starter, we paid under €30, as Sunday and Monday nights they have specials.']

Name: Dark Restaurant Berlin
Summary: Restaurant with a softly lit bar & a completely dark dining room, so diners use non-visual senses.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Ever wondered what it's like to dine in complete darkness? Such intriguing dining concepts are becoming increasingly popular worldwide. This DarkRestaurant offers a dining experience shrouded in complete darkness, served by visually impaired waitstaff. The prospect was intriguing, yet no amount of anticipation could truly prepare me for the depth of the experience that lay ahead. In this environment, "utter darkness" means the absence of all light, making it impossible to see anything at all.

Upon our arrival, the hostess warmly greeted my date and me, taking our coats and presenting a menu that outlined meal types rather than specific dishes—poultry, seafood, beef, or vegetarian options, with a selection of drinks. I opted for the vegetarian, and my date chose beef. We were then led by our blind server, Heedi, in a conga line fashion into the pitch-black dining area, a journey that set the stage for an evening unlike any other.

Seated and acquainted with our surroundings through touch—silverware, glasses, and more—courtesy of Heedi's guidance, we awaited our meal. The palpable darkness soon unsettled us, a feeling exacerbated by the inability of our eyes to adjust or find light. To distract from the discomfort, we engaged in conversation.

The meal began with bread that, to my discerning palate, immediately felt unworthy of indulgence. A playful moment ensued when my date, attempting to lighten the mood, inadvertently launched a piece of crust into my eye. Despite the mishap, we navigated the challenges of sharing dishes and experiencing the meal without sight, which proved messy yet enlightening. Our main courses arrived, and though my initial impression was of a simple salad, I was actually enjoying a complex dish of lime-marinated beetroot with a mint topping, a discovery that underscored how much sight influences taste.

This dining-in-the-dark experience taught us valuable lessons about the reliance on visual cues in culinary enjoyment and the profound impact of sight on our dining experiences. Despite the average quality of the meals, the unique environment made for a memorable evening, though not one we're likely to repeat. The experience served as a reminder of the importance of sight and the intriguing ways in which its absence can alter perception, conversation, and even the ambiance of a meal. Dining in the dark offers a one-of-a-kind experience that goes beyond food to challenge and enlighten the senses in unexpected ways.', "I absolutely adored the experience and the atmosphere! The employees were super nice and friendly. The food was great and having the option of being surprised which meal you'll get is awesome. I loved the live music show as well. It was a wonderful time and I can't wait to revisit!", 'It was a funny and peculiar visit and interesting to experience how your senses compensate when one is disabled. That being said, overall the visit was disappointing. The food was sub-standard, the atmosphere was like a factory where focus was on squeezing as many guests as possible through the production line. We never felt welcomed nor appreciated as patrons.

Conclusion: Been there, done that! Won’t repeat!']

Name: Spagos Restaurant - Bar & Lounge
Summary: Pasta, pizza & burgers, plus breakfasts & cocktails, in a large, minimalist hotel restaurant.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['A lovely restaurant with a relaxed vibe - we ordered cocktails and I had the prawn tagliatelle which was very nice. Prices were a little high but the service was quick and staff were attentive. Great music being played too!', "I'm giving this 1 star based on the fact you have to pay €1 to use the toilet. I'm paying for the meal in the restaurant, so shouldn't that be a given? I'm also a hotel guest, but still have to pay?

It's also very cruel for people who have accessibility needs and may need to use the toilet more than once during a meal.
Staff were friendly and food was fine, but I can't recommend this place as somewhere you should eat.", 'Delightful decor, spacious and comfortable, delicious food, friendly service and the live music is just right!  We came here every night for our drinks sitting on the sofas.  One night we decided to eat here as well - ordering the Pumpkin Soup, Prawn Carbonara and Crème Brûlée - all absolutely fantastic!']

Name: Bierbar Alkopole
Summary: Colorful rail-station bar with vintage-style murals, draft beers & a jukebox, plus outside tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ['Great beer, lovely service.\nOld fashioned kind of bar with a good selection of local beers on draught', 'This is one of those places in the Alexanderplaz  Station where you would think you would never enter, but on the contrary, here the atmosphere is very nice and warm, almost exclusively German audience, very correct draft beer.  In short, a place to consider for a good "Abend bier"!', 'If you just need a beer and some company, pop your head in here. Right by the train station, Alexander Platz.\nYou go in for in and say hello, I need a beer. Enjoy.']

Name: Burger King
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['The waitress who worked at the cashier on Tuesday 12th of March at 11:00 am is VERY RUDE. I have an IBS syndrome and needed to go to the restroom with the understanding I have to buy something and get a code (picture below). She’s unwilling to give the code and told me it is only 50 cents. I do not mind paying however it can only be done using coins which I did not have at that time. She told other customers the same thing, only coin and no card. Very inconsiderate.', 'The Burger King in central Berlin is pretty decent with the only downside being the wait times. The food was to standard and cooked well, there was plenty of seating and the restuarant was overall pretty tidy.', 'Average BK in Berlin 🇩🇪\nSame service as usual, pretty big inside therefore lots of place to sit.\nBurgers and fries were good.']

Name: SOY
Summary: Plant-based Vietnamese food, with noodles & curries, in a modern, airy space with outdoor seats.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:45 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:45 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:45 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:45 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:45 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 9:45 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 9:45 PM
Reviews: ["My family and I spent a week in Berlin during the summer, and we ate at Soy 3-4 times. It's my absolute favourite restaurant in Berlin that I've tried so far. The food is very well made and tastes amazing and the restaurant has a nice and welcoming atmosphere. I ordered the same food every time, number 21 and 24. I really recommend Soy for anyone looking for a vegan place, or just good food in general!", 'One of the best vegan spots to grab a nice lunch. Big variety of food and drinks. Friendly staff. Good food!', 'Absolutely spectacular soup and mango sticky rice dessert. Super creative and amazing flavor. Highly recommend.']

Name: Pho Co Restaurant
Summary: Noodle soups, curries & rice paper rolls in a trendy Vietnamese stop with bamboo & dark wood decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["We dropped in on a weekday evening and had a great welcome. The menu was in German and English, and the waiters spoke good English. The food was plentiful and very tasty. It was great to see a separate vegan page. There's seating inside and out, the inside seating did have music which was a little too loud for my taste. Overall we had a great time and would recommend it.", 'What a lovely restaurant in the heart of Berlin. As Vietnamese food lovers, we landed at this place for a Saturday meal and were so happy with our experience. The ambience, food, and service were 10/10. As we ordered a bunch of vegetarian salads and soups, the waiter found it important to disclose the presence of non-veg ingredients (from fish sauce to chicken broth) in our chosen dishes, which we thought was extremely sweet.', 'This was one of the best meals we had in Berlin. We asked the waiter to recommend some dishes for us and they were all delicious. Our family all had a different favorite. My favorite was the curry duck dish. I think I would have loved this dish even if it was vegetarian. The curry sauce was delicious. I definitely recommend stopping here if you are in the areaz']

Name: King King
Summary: Laid-back restaurant serving up sushi & sashimi, plus curries & stir fries, in an unfussy space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Dinning at this restaurant wasn’t the best experience.

We were offered to sit at the terrace. The only table had a lot of plates and bottles for the previous guests. We had to wait until the drinks were brought to the table and kindly ask for them to be removed to get finally a clean table.

It took very long to someone to come and take our order. The 3 waiters were inside the restaurant watching their phones and after several minutes we needed to approach to them to ask for service.

The home-made drinks were ok, but rather expensive for the quantity.

We ordered sushi (as seen in the pic). Quality was average, not terrible, not exceptional. For some reason the arrangement was super messy, they sprinkled salad over the sushi and many pieces were stuck together, leading to them getting broken when trying to separate them.
When the plate arrived, we didn’t receive chopsticks not napkins. Again we had to look for the waiters to get some and be able eat.

On the positive side, the place looks overall nice and clean.

Probably we won’t come again as for the price we would prefer other nearby venues.

It’s important to mention, the place wasn’t overcrowded that the waiters looked free most of the time. As a recommendation, train your waiters to provide a better experience to their guests.', 'Amazing sushi place with affordable prices for swiss people. We ordered tapas and sushi for two people and it just hit the spot and was perfect. The service was kind, capable and quick with a pleasant and welcoming open designed interior with comfy seating.', 'Usually go there for lunch with my team since it’s closest. Decent portions and lunch menu is short but we normally get A1/A2.

Staff definitely can learn to smile more often. One less star because I was charged 3 euros for a tiny glass of water, that’s downright ridiculous.']

Name: Volksbar
Summary: Cocktails, beer & snacks, plus DJ music & comedy gigs, in a lively cafe/bar with a relaxed lounge.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Great atmosphere, mediocre service, hit and miss cocktails. Whiskey sour, pina colada and white russian were actually disastrous.', 'Very nice Bar. We went on a Saturday and it was surprisingly not too crowded. The staff is speaking both English and German and are super nice but they do sometimes forget an order.

The drink selection is very nice too, they have a huge Gin list, Cocktails and the usual beer, wine and shots. Prices are decent too.
Will go again!:)', 'Great bar with excellent drinks and very friendly service! The music is fantastic and a perfect chill vibe to enjoy - would recommend!']

Name: Chuan House
Summary: Informal dining room filled with intricate, Asian-inspired decor & furnishing Chinese specialties.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: Closed, Friday: Closed, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: 5:30 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['The food is really good. I had just a few starter today but will come back for more! Had some wan tan, dumplings, and dim sum. For real origin spiced food, this is a good place to go.
If it says spicy at this place, it means Asian typ of spicy (dragon dance on your tongue)  not european ahh a bit of spicy is OK I can stand it.

The host was quite busy, but still in a good mood and was able to read my mind to have another coke before I was able to order one 😀

Will come back soon, for sure!', "Delicious and flavoured Chinese dishes. The place is nicely decorated, Chinese style, and it has a good selection of meals. We got the R2 and H2, they were both extremely tasty. We also tried the eggplants under the vegetarian dishes, which was good but not as good as the other main courses.
The place is now on my shortlist of Chinese restaurants in Berlin. I'll surely visit soon this fine restaurant again.
A clear recommendation from my side!", 'WOW! What a hidden gem in Alexanderplatz. I have found Chinese/Asian style restaurants to be very hit and miss across Europe. But this is so FRESH, you won’t mind the wait for the courses!

Even though there was a language barrier, I politely wrote down on my phone my order and they were happy to use this!

Definitely a revisit next time I’m in Berlin. The prices cannot be missed aswell!']

Name: Restaurant Pankoff
Summary: Restaurant for fine German cuisine in a sophisticated space that has a sun terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Nice place for a lunch. Wiener Schnitzel is good, while jam is amazing. Nice waitress.', 'Great food and tasty wine paired with friendly staff in suburban Pankow. I recommend their deserts.', 'Classy ...in a word']

Name: Schlesisch Blau
Summary: Compact venue with a subdued vibe specializing in traditional homestyle cooking.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews:
['Like the homecooked feel on the foods. The owner and staff are very friendly and warm.

A surprise find to us and definitely a pleasant one.', 'Family business has been operating for more than 22 years, delicious traditional German homemade food. The owner is super friendly and he is happy to introduce the best food of the shop. And the menu will change every day.
If you looking for transitional food 100%. This is a right choice.', 'Such a beautiful little restaurant. Staff were so lovely and welcoming! The food was absolutely delicious and were massive portions.']

Name: Gude Falafel
Summary: Chill counter-serve spot dispensing sandwiches & wraps with vegan & vegetarian options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Not sure what happened to this spot but portion sizes have really dropped. I’d used to get meals I could barely finish, to a wrap with just a few slices of meat and barely any veggies. I’ll find a new spot.  The people working there are still cool. Just this is laughably expensive for what you get now.', 'Price performance ratio is not right, you get a very small pita full of salad for 5.5 euros. If it was 3-4 euros, it would be acceptable. There are better shops in the area', "Quick service, centrally located, easy to find, staff was mostly friendly, the places isn't too big, but few indoor and outdoor seats available. Food was good (falafel wrap), just the bread bit to cold. Try it out!"]

Name: Salumeria Lamuri
Summary: Trendy eatery in a former butcher's shop offering a changing menu of creative Italian cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 3:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['This restaurant offers a limited selection of antipasti and primi, with only two secondi piatti on the menu. However, the quality of the food is very good!\nThe prices are a bit on the high side, and the tables are too small, making dining a bit cramped.\nOn another plus side, the staff is very friendly and welcoming.', 'I had a pleasant experience at Salumeria Lamuri. The service was attentive and the atmosphere was inviting. However, the food was mediocre and could be improved. The interior, being a former butchery, had a cool vibe. Overall, it was an enjoyable visit.', 'The portions - rather pricey - are so small that you can’t tell whether the food is tasty or not. The waiters are friendly and the place is cozy.']

Name: Cha for Tee
Summary: Down-to-earth restaurant offering Chinese dim sum including vegan & vegetarian items.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['This place offers a wide variety of dumplings with great service.

We tried both vegetarian and non-veg options, and everything tasted amazing.

If you love seaweed, I highly recommend trying their seaweed salad.

The prices are also reasonable.', 'Wonderful experience here with my friends: we tried ALL the vegan dumplings and got a second round of our favourites. Highly recommend any group big enough to do the same. The appetizers are also remarkable- the sour potato stood out to me.
10/10 is the service by the owner, a very friendly woman passionate of taking care of her guests! I will be coming back and hope you get to experience her hospitality!', 'This mom and pop joint serves authentic homey food. The owner is super sweet and from HK. My favourite dishes were the wonton, pickled cucumber. Definitely coming back soon']

Name: Nonne & Zwerg
Summary: Cozy eatery offering Greek cuisine, natural wines & vegetarian options, plus outdoor seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 1:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Great modern Greek restaurant in Mittenwalder Straße in Kreuzberg 61.

The restaurant is quite small so make sure you book your table in advance. Especially in the cold season when they have less seating.

We had great grilled octopus as well as sardines. Both were delicious. Service was great as well. Prices are very reasonable. Looking forward to my next visit', 'Brilliant restaurant, excellent service. We asked for recommendations and we got fab food and wine!', "The restaurant is nice and cozy. The staff are all friendly and you feel you were invited to your close friend’s. Everything from the appetizer to the dessert was delicious, but I personally didn't like the texture of the octopus being partially raw. It's a homey and friendly restaurant that you'll want to go to if you're in the neighborhood. Absolutely recommended!"]

Name: Hong Nhat Restaurant
Summary: Sushi, curries & pho served in a modern, fashionable pan-Asian restaurant featuring a bar.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews:
['Amazing Food & Service - highly recommend the dim sum & wantan soup as an appetizer & the rice noodle dishes for main (especially the duck!) 🤝
Good veggie & vegan options as well as sushi.

Will definitely go here again!', 'Really great restaurant with something for everybody. Great drinks, recommend the Clover Club! The pho is so good and filling!', 'We visited the restaurant due to a hens party and we were able to make the reservation online which it was very convenient for us. The place looks really ethnic and the overall atmosphere attempts you to try their cuisine. However, when we arrived and during our dinner, there was a weird smell in the place which don't know if it was a coincidence or not but it matters to us. Very friendly, helpful and smiley staff. We ordered the Tokyo sushi from the " Crunchy Extreme" section and the Avocado Dragon Roll from the "sushi extreme" section. For main dishes we chosed the "canard a la maison' which is a duck and the Royal Pho Bo Dac Tau. Every single dish was absolutely tasty, well cooked with lots of flavors and huge portions!! Value for money!! Definelety worths visiting it and try as many options you can!! Highly recommend it!! 👌']

Name: Ristorante Pizzeria Garda
Summary: Antipasti, pasta & pizza at a charming, family-run trattoria with tables in a leafy courtyard.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Amazing! The hospitality and service were just wonderful. While the place was crowded and full, I asked for a table for one. Within a few minutes, they brought a table from somewhere, a chair and a menu, and created an extra spot just for me. It was perfect to dine there in the pretty garden and the food was delicious. Very thankful for the staff and their hospitality!', 'Niceeeeeee!!!!! The pizza is the best food here, my favorite one is funghi! The clerk is also very handsome🥹', "Everything was absolutely scrumptious! We had the bruschetta, Margherita pizza, salad, and pasta with truffles—adored every bite. Felt as if we'd been whisked away to Italy. The staff were tremendously kind. Completely smitten! We'll certainly be returning for a second round. 🍕🍝💖"]

Name: Kamala
Summary: Classic Thai curries, stir fries & noodle dishes served in a relaxed space with traditional decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Very very good food.
Fast service nice waitress.
Taste like the real thing. Just like in Thailand.
Thanks
Recommended!!!!', 'It was really tasty, the place is cute and authentic, service was great. The portion is big and full filling. I enjoyed food very much', "The atmosphere of the place is pretty nice and cozy. The service is really great. The people there are really lovely.

The food is really fresh and huge in quantity. The taste is great, I just wish it was a bit more spicy.

Price is really good for what you're getting, and as with all places in Mitte, they speak English.

Would recommend for a nice hangout."]

Name: The Rabbit Café
Summary: Charming coffee house & plant shop with a diverse menu of Asian & Western nibbles.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
['Amazing food and coffee, lots of healthy and savoury options too! The vibe is really calm and it’s very pretty inside and out, and the portions are BIG! The brioche dish with extra salmon is particularly delicious.

We had a calm and tasty brunch here on a Saturday afternoon!', "Surprisingly cheap cafe given the location, with one of the best cream carrot cakes I've had! The french toast was solid for the price, and the vanilla ice cream float coffee was delicious too! Really love the green vibes here, they also sell plants.", "Recommend the french toast & egg drop!!!
Really tasty and reasonably priced!!! So we came back again before we went home.
I'll definitely come again if I visit Berlin 😋

Highly recommend"]

Name: BrewDog Berlin Mitte
Summary: No-nonsense chain bar specialising in the Scottish brewery's craft beers, with regular guest brews.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['This was yet another great visit at BrewDog Mitte, we were a large group of 16 people and the staff was accommodating and patient.

The food quality is great as always, fresh out of the oven, and biers collection is outstanding.

We had a gathering for a small nonprofit community event, and everyone enjoyed their time.', 'Yes to BrewDog in Berlin! As someone who loves fresh, high-quality, and tasty beers, BrewDog in Mitte is one of the few remaining places that maintain that standard. They offer the best service with friendly staff who provide a full experience, especially Loulou and Maya, and really, all of them! The food is excellent, and enjoying some beers in a sunny spot where the sunset is magnificent adds to the experience. The interior is spacious, which I love, and they also have a great backyard.

Whether you’re with a group of friends, having a cozy chat as a couple, friends , or just chilling by yourself or with your pet, BrewDog has got you covered. The space, privacy, beer, sun, and service are all top-notch.

When I say I can compare, trust me, I mean it. In Berlin, there are a few places that try to copy the vibe, but they are far from reaching the same level. So if you’re in Berlin, don’t miss it.
