Thanks to the BrewDog team, you deserve this!', 'Really good sourdough bread pizzas! Large selection of beers (or non-alcoholic beverages) and very friendly service. Order at the bar when you get there and they'll bring food to your table. I'd recommend a reservation if you can get one as there can be large groups. It's also pretty kid-/pet-friendly so not a super "bar" vibe so a pretty relaxed atmosphere. Not a bad way to spend a night out!']

Name: Umspannwerk Ost
Summary: German & Italian cuisine, plus cocktails, in a revamped 1900s power station with an open kitchen.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ['Modern restaurant with a variety of menu options. Nice ambiance. We had the pork risotto and the Schnitzel, both were delicious. Good size portions too.', 'We came here for an event and we were very satisfied with the whole restaurant. The food was exquisite and the staff catered to all of our needs. The design is spectacular and I would love to see this place again outside of an event. Top quality food and a lovely venue in the heart of Berlin.', "A friend suggested we come here for dinner. I'm so glad she did. Wait-staff professional and kind, food delicious ability to dine inside or out. I enjoyed sitting out being comfortable. We had a great time. I had the fish for the main dessert creme brulee, which was very good"]

Name: Briefmarken Weine
Summary: Traditional Italian mains & antipasto, plus European wines, in an easygoing setting.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Food here is incredible, had a white fish with radicchio, chicory, grapefruit and purple potatoes. Should have taken a picture, as it looked as good as it tasted. Always great advice with wine too. 🍷', "Looking for an excellent place to have a romantic dinner in Karl Max Alle during the summer? Look no further! This place is perfect. With its delectable Italian menu and an extensive selection of Italian wines.\nOne of the highlights of this restaurant is Alberto, the manager, who is always there to provide you with the best recommendations for every dish. Whether you're a seasoned Italian food lover or new to the cuisine, Alberto will guide you through the menu and ensure that you have an unforgettable dining experience.\nMake sure to visit and let Alberto's expertise enhance your dining experience.", "The overall atmosphere is great, cute little location and great outdoor seating under trees. Service was unattentive, slow (despite the place being pretty empty) and a bit hit and miss (depending on which lady happened to grace your table with attention). Wines are excellent, but the service didn't seem the very knowledgeable or able to explain much about them. Food is okay but not outstanding. If you're doing only small dishes and antipasti, I think the quality and flavour needs to be outstanding, especially considering how (overly) pricy the food is here. That's just not the case."]

Name: Bierhof Rüdersdorf
Summary: Relaxed, convivial beer garden offering picnic tables & couches, plus beer, coffee & finger foods.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 1:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['A local Biergarten with good atmosphere, cool crowd and clubbing music, in the yard of the Berghain & Lab.oratory clubs. Reasonable prices (0.5 L Bier: 4.5 €, Hamburger: 7.5 €, Pommes: 3 €).', 'Nice bar with a rooftop next to Berghain. No card accepted so make sure you have spare change for a beer.', 'Perfect spot to relax with a beer and snack in Berlin!']

Name: Restaurant & Biergarten Schoenbrunn
Summary: Casual venue in Volkspark Friedrichshain serving local fare & wood-fired pizza, plus weekend brunch.
Address: Friedrichshain, AM SCHWANENTEICH IN VOLKSPARK, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 3:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["So gorgeous, middle of East Berlin's largest, most sumptuous park - a fountain midst of a lake facing the restaurant terrace and a circular shower for the kiddies off to the left - food was top notch, and served by pretty, friendly staff - thank you!", 'We had excellent service from the start, and then our Amaretto (in the correct glass) and coffee. The seating is comfortable. The temperature is perfect today. Just brilliant. And the apple strudel was primo!', "Beautiful place to be whenever you thought of relaxation and wants to eat or drink. It has a wonderful views. It's foods are unique, drinks served up in favorite patterns. The staffs works at your satisfaction at all times. Schoenbrunn Restaurant is choice place for your family and friends."]

Name: Zollhaus Pankow
Summary: Hip eatery, bar & beer garden serving Neapolitan pizza & Mediterranean fare in a restored brewery.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Great food at a nice venue. Pizzas are very good with a decent selection of other Italian antipasti and mains. The ribs were a bit too sweet for our liking but nonetheless well prepared. Lovely ambiance, service was friendly and attentive.', "This place has such great pizzas!!! They have a great selection of pizzas and have great pizzas for kids and a sandpit for the children to be entertained in. However, I didn't like how slow the service was; they forgot about our pizza order so we ended up waiting for them for about 2 hours. I hope they fix that problem soon. 7/10", 'Fantastic pizza and wines.
The base is light and fluffy, nice selection on the menu.
The outdoor spaces look great, although we sat inside as it was a little cold the evening we visited.

Look forward to going again!

Outdoor space is also great. Lovely big beer garden style with pizza and bar menu. 😋']

Name: Hostaria del Monte Croce
Summary: Longstanding rustic-style Italian restaurant in a coach house, offering set menus.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['" Un'esperienza culinaria ricca di gusti e sapori autentici. "

If you're looking for a true taste of Italy, Hostaria del Monte Croce is the place to be.

The ambiance at Hostaria del Monte Croce is equally captivating. The rustic decor and traditional Italian artwork, creates an inviting and cozy atmosphere. Soft lighting and the gentle hum of Italian melodies in the background further enhance the dining experience, making it the perfect spot for a romantic evening or a gathering with friends and family.

The service here is impeccable, with staff who are not only attentive but also genuinely passionate about ensuring you have an unforgettable meal. They guide you through the menu with expert knowledge, making recommendations that cater to your tastes and preferences. Their hospitality is second to none, making you feel like a cherished guest in their home.

The menu at Hostaria del Monte Croce for July 2024 is a delightful journey through authentic Italian and Mediterranean flavors. Each dish, from the antipasti misti di verdure to the risotto al limone e zucchini, is crafted with fresh, high-quality ingredients that bring out a harmonious blend of tastes and textures. The combination of classic Italian dishes with innovative touches, such as the Scampo lardellato with grilled radicchio Treviso and yogurt sauce, ensures a memorable dining experience.

I can't wait to return next month to discover what new culinary delights await!', 'I visit here every time I travel to Berlin.
The atmosphere is welcoming, the staff is nice and the food is excellent. If you’re up for a good vibe evening with a fixed Italian menu, this is it.
Last time I’ve been there (Feb 24) they had a new chef and I personally think he’s way better…
Would definitely visit again in the future thank you!', 'We went for a special occasion, and loved the service, super friendly and made us feel like we belonged. Most of the food was simple but high quality, even though I expected more complexity of flavours. For the price one pays, I expected a nicer Pasta-dish for example. Making an last minute adaptation for a guest was not a problem. They use good quality ingredients, the prosciutto and melon course was excellent, but also hard to go wrong with, good melon, good prosciutto, è tutto. The bread was somewhat peculiar, as if they took a recipe for good fluffy Italian bread and then tried to make it heavy and dry (the way Germans like their bread), the halfway solution was not my cup of tea. The desert was absolutely excellent, the red wine very potable. It´s cool they have Ichnusa and the apple juice was great. Will I go back? Maybe.']

Name: cuccuma
Summary: Specialty coffees & teas at a relaxed stop also serving gateaux & pastries baked on the premises.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Reviews: ['Ahhh i love the sizes of the cakes. It was like big as my head lol. we had lemon cake, it was like home made. Coffee was very good and i really liked that they only allow laptop/tablets upstairs and people are enjoying board games or chatting downstairs.', "we didn't realize they were closing but they still tended to our orders so that was very nice of them! they didn't have matcha anymore so they suggested power chai which was still good! just a little very sweet but it was still nice and warm. i love the little logo on the cups.", 'The place is absolutely amazing. Nice coffee, lovely breakfast selection, and a chill vibe for laptop users and readers. Shoutout to the staff girl, Lynn, who made my experience pretty lovely. She deserves a good rise in the salary for being such pleasant and enjoyable. Highly recommended! =)']

Name: Tadım Ocakbaşı
Summary: Humble Turkish restaurant with sidewalk seating doling out grilled meats, kebabs, salads & desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 1:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 1:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 1:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 1:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews: ['a small restaurant with delicious food. everything was properly seasoned, very tasty and, what is equally important, quickly served. to this is added very nice service.\n\nworth trying, solid place.', 'It was the first Turkish restaurant I ever ate in Germany. I have eaten Turkish food all over the world but this one has been 2nd best after Dubai. I have yet to try Turkish food on turkey. I will soon. This place has street parking. This restaurant is extremely busy. I stood in the cold rain for 20 minutes to get a seat. Yes it was worth it. The pictures speak for themselves. A very unfortunate thing with Turkish restaurant in North America they use gas grill. That takes away 50 percent of the flavor. In Berlin all the Turkish restaurant cook on top of charcoal tandoor. That gives the amazing smoked flavor and then you compliment that with high quality juicy fatty meat then you create magical Turkish kebabs. Every single item is made to order. There is no artificial or ready made ingredients every marination made from scratch. I would go back to this restaurant every time I am in Berlin. The staff are so kind and they invited me to kitchen side to make video. Food i rate it 4.5 and service 5. This place needs more space. People are lined up to eat here.  The images and videos speak for themselves. Make sure you end the kebab feast with Turkish tea and baklava.', 'Best ever Turkish charcoal barbecue in Berlin, in Germany and your will not find such quality in Istanbul as well, you would need to got to Turkish countryside to find this dedication, this craftsmanship, this quality of meat and all other ingredients, best early afternoon, evenings are usually packed…']

Name: Abirams
Summary: Indian staples like curry, biryani & samosas in a low-key eatery with an open kitchen & a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Ate here twice while staying in Berlin and had a great experience both times. The food was very good, the staff is very friendly and the service was excellent. The portions are very generous and great value for the price. Definitely recommend the samosas and the various chicken and veggie curries.', "I have been eating here ever since they opened about 15 years ago and always felt their quality and pricing was excellent. Sadly, my last few meals have been mediocre to terrible. I suspect they may have a new chef. I ate there today and it's the worst meal I have ever eaten at Abirams. In the next few weeks, I will go there again and if the quality has not improved, then I will stop eating there.", 'Fantastic Indian restaurant. Big menu, low prices, excellent quality. Service is great as well. Highly recommended!']

Name: Freischwimmer
Summary: Waterside dining space with wooden decking over the water, comfy rooms, serving an eclectic menu.
Address: Vor dem Schlesischen Tor 2, Berlin-Bezirk Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['We‘ve been here with the family for dinner which was really nice because in summer sitting outside at the waterfront is priceless.

the service was a little bit chaotic the dishes didt come at the same time, but the staff was friendly and polite.

the food is tasty but not outstanding and for my kind of taste to overpriced.

but all in all we had a nice evening', 'So this place is a very posh "in place".
The vibe is that the staff is better than you. It is so sad with the amazing view and location of this place.
Did not feel welcome, and on arrival, it was more that we were disturbing the staff.
After ordering, the food came rather quickly, so that was good.
And all hats off for the kitchen staff and chef. The food WOW, everything was amazing.
This place with location, view, and food is 5 star no question.
The only thing sad is the staff serving you.', "Good atmosphere but the food took an hour to be served. The BBQ wasn't working for a while which also means no side dishes available (no potato salad, no green salad...). Our waitress didn't tell us anything when we were asking about our food and was hiding in a corner avoiding eye contact.
Good scenery!"]

Name: Fabrics Restaurant
Summary: Stylish eatery with bright pink/white/green tables, chairs & fittings plus city & river views.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30 – 10:30 AM, Tuesday: 6:30 – 10:30 AM, Wednesday: 6:30 – 10:30 AM, Thursday: 6:30 – 10:30 AM, Friday: 6:30 – 10:30 AM, Saturday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 PM, Sunday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 PM
Reviews: ["In keeping with the stylishness of the hotel, the food served in the restaurant is incredibly stylish and decorative. Full of delicious flavours but don't come expecting huge portions: this is bite-size artisan food. Service was a bit slow but the views onto the Spree in the evening are nice to soak up", 'We were here for dinner and I can only say that is really worth it for the price. Plates could be a little big bigger, quality it is already very good. Perfect decoration, views and everything is clean. Service really good, waitress are polite and professionals.', "The breakfast here was phenomenal - the best breakfast buffet I've ever seen and the sweetest staff. Not only do they take incredible care of you, they take the time to get to know you and help suggest a bespoke experience of Berlin to maximize your stay at their beautiful hotel. Oh - and then there's THE FOOD. In addition to having fresh, delicious food - they are allergy friendly offering gluten free, vegan and Pescatarian options. That was a big shock in comparison to the rest of even Europes biggest cities who aren't near as up on it as these guys."]

Name: Birgit
Summary: Eclectic hangout with a terrace & carousel, serving wood-fired Neapolitan pizza & draft beer.
Reviews:
['Went for free open air!  The progressive techno at open air was so good!  Big space to sit.. only option was pizza which ranges from 10-14.. Only downside was the drunk tourist in the Acid Techno scene.. chanting owww oww.. why the hell you guys even enter when you dont know the music?   Good place and vibe.. I will visit next time too..  Request to the tourists: please respect the Berlin club culture scene.. Dance on the floor and please do not talk.', 'I really like this place. It’s in a fantastic location, offers plenty of space, and always has great music. The waiting staff are friendly and attentive, and although the bartenders might seem a bit tipsy at times, that’s part of the charm of the industry.

However, I had a concerning experience with the security staff. They were rude and dismissive, which was disappointing. I was refused entry even though my friends got in without any issues. There was no line, I was completely sober, and yet the security guard singled me out. His behavior was almost violent and extremely impolite, possibly even racist. Because of this incident, I’ll think twice before returning. It’s a shame, as the rest of the establishment is quite enjoyable. Cheers.', "A Refreshing Oasis in Berlin's Club Scene

Birgit stands out as an exceptional bar/club that breaks away from the traditional, premeditated strict vibe that many of the city's nightlife spots are known for. Instead, Birgit embraces a more decentralized and inclusive atmosphere, making it a refreshing and unique destination for anyone looking to experience Berlin's nightlife in a different light.

One of the most notable aspects of Birgit is its welcoming and diverse crowd. Unlike many other clubs where the atmosphere can feel exclusive or intimidating, Birgit is a place where all kinds of people come together to enjoy a good time. From hardcore ravers who thrive on the pulsating beats of electronic music to regular drinkers who are just looking for a relaxed evening out, Birgit's doors are open to everyone. This melting pot of patrons creates an eclectic and vibrant ambiance that is hard to find elsewhere.

Another major highlight of Birgit is its approach to payments. In a city where many clubs and bars still adhere to a cash-only policy, Birgit stands out by accepting card payments. This modern and convenient approach is a breath of fresh air for both locals and tourists, making the overall experience much smoother and hassle-free.

The vibe at Birgit is decidedly relaxed and unpretentious. The venue itself is creatively designed, with various areas to explore, each offering a unique atmosphere. Whether you're in the mood to dance the night away to energetic beats or prefer to chill out in a more laid-back space with a drink in hand, Birgit has got you covered. The outdoor areas, in particular, are perfect for taking a breather and enjoying conversations with friends or meeting new people."]

Name: Banja Luka
Summary: Easygoing beer garden whipping up finger foods & light bites, plus beer & cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Lovely low-key beer garden if you are in the east side gallery area.', 'NicI chilled place to hangout and have drinks', 'What better place to catch up with a friend after work than in a hidden little beergarden with an interesting food option. 👌🏼 Probably only beer and potatoes would be more German but we were in a wine kind of mood and loved to calm down in this little paradise so close to one of the vibrant busy part of the city. The fries were delicious and the dumplings are great! You have a lot of options (approximately 4 different dumplings that you can mix and match with 4/5 different sauces) where you can create your own „dumpling experience“. 😁 So good to be back outside exploring these kind of places! 👌🏼']

Name: Inderheld ShahJahan Restaurant
Summary: Relaxed operation offering curries, biryani & other traditional Indian provisions.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:50 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:50 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:50 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:50 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:50 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 10:45 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 10:50 PM
Reviews:
['We ordered via Lieferando twice and the food was delicious and fresh. The dessert was very fatty and sweet. I was surprised by the taste.
The meals are all good, less creamy than other Indian restaurants and more fresh ingredients.', 'The food quality is the best prices are worth fully i really enjoy my food i suggestion you to try and enjoy', 'I was keen to try out a new Indian restaurant and I picked this one.
But unfortunately I was left very disappointed.

Chicken pakora came completely dry and slightly burned, onion bhaji was more like soggy onion rings.
And dall tarka flavour was just nothing I have had before.

Very very disappointing, such a shame.']

Name: Restaurant Grill
Summary: Estrel Hotel's sophisticated option for steaks, burgers & grilled seafood, paired with wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Good steak restaurant within the Estrel hotel/conference complex. Service was quick and attentive, but did not feel rushed, food was very good and well presented. The prices for the higher end steaks were quite expensive, but not unreasonably so. I would have happily eaten here for more meals if my stay at the hotel had been longer.', 'The food was good. Not excellent but good enough. The service on the other hand very rude. I was shocked. The restaurant was basically empty and the waiter didn’t want to seat us as we were a large group. He finally rolled his eyes and showed us to our table. Gesturing and swearing all the time. We stopped because we were in shock and didn’t know what to do. He made some impatient gestures and taunts. Do not recommend. Other waiters were nice.', 'Very good tasting italian food ! The starters are à little bit to expansive, but really good too. The service is fast. I recommand this restaurant ;-)']

Name: Kentucky Fried Chicken
Summary: Restaurant chain known for its buckets of fried chicken, plus combo meals & sides.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Had the hardest orignal chicken in my whole life.
Literally taste like overdue cookie with pepper flavor that has been lying in Sahara Desert for a year.

Don’t know if this is a mistake or it just should taste like this but well.', "It was finger lickin' but not good... The fries where.... The other food was okay at best. No sauces included.
When ordering you see pictures of real Pepsi but when at the counter sugarless Pepsi is the closest you get to the original.
The order terminals try to upsell wherever they can. At least the staff is nice but could be trained a bit better.", 'They asked us to check in using an app called luca, which doesn't work.
And then we asked to cancel the order, which they denied.
The rude lady which took our order said "then just go"
They asked us to delete all the photos that we took inside when i said im going to review on google maps.

Worst customer service ever. Doesn't even worth 1 star. Pretty bad']

Name: Burger King
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['The service was quick, the food was delicious, and the portions were surprisingly generous. Special shoutout to the friendly and handsome employee who offered me a bag – a small gesture that made a big difference. Would absolutely come again!', 'Took very very long, then forgot 2 fries and a burger. Drinks half full. Not acceptable. Would like to arrange a refund as i am typically happy at other burger kings.', 'Unfortunately this Burger King mixes up order quite frequently. If you order for take-away please check right at the counter, what is in the bag. Just ordered two menus and none of the burgers have been like ordered. Cheese, where no cheese was added and a completely different burger for the other menu. QUite dissapointing.\nThe location is okay. The tables as clean as you might want to expect. I will definitely visit another Burger King in the next time and skip this one!']

Name: Sofia Bar
Summary: Convivial restaurant with sidewalk tables, serving up grilled meats, plus Bulgarian salads & wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["I'm no specialist in Bulgarian cuisine, so I won't give my opinion regarding the flavors of the dishes, but I can attest to the quality of the ingredients. I ordered the pork skewers, and it's a well established fact that pork in Germany is excellent. Well, they have the worst quality pork I've ever seen here. Half of it was not meat, just fat and cartilage. Uneatable.
Cash only.", 'Good Bulgarian food with very friendly staff

I recommend the Schaschlik', 'Great and authentic food, beautiful setup, friendly and involved hosts . Awesome for a traditional Bulgarian experience. Hosts are happy to help with special dietary requirements where necessary.']

Name: Bamboo’s Hut Asiatische Küche & Sushi Bar
Summary: Simple Asian & sushi snack bar with green décor serving Chinese, Thai, Vietnamese & Japanese.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["Tastes like you are in Vietnam. The owners are couple from Saigon. They are very friendly and the food tastes very authentic. Don't expect any glamorous interior or fancy serving. Come here for the good match of quality and price. Very affordable place and 1 dish will make you full. Definitely will come back.
P.S. They don't serve sushi anymore", "Tasty food and very fair prices. The atmosphere is a bit simple and the menu doesn't offer many sushi options but I guess that's fine.", "Really good food for a really good price ! I took a Vegan dish because i've been to Asia and knew they can make really tastefull vegan dishes so i wanted to test how the quality would be here in Berlin. Well, no diisapointment at all, it was really very good and tastfull and i finest my plate to the last piece of rice ! Have to stay for work a few days here so i think i will be back !!!
And allso, very importent, the people are very friendly !!  So, if you like asian food, this is the place to be in Berlin !!!

The next day, i couldn's resist to go back and try something else and.......as good as the other day !!"]

Name: BURGER KING Deutschland GmbH
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
['Thought I get quick bite,order,pay and eat.This is  where the problem started,they have only machines to order I very don’t like it.It takes more time than ordering face to face.Lucky me one of the staff took my order and typed in the machine.2nd point I didn’t like,they have only paper straws with your coke,disgusting feeling in your mouth and as longer you wait drinking the coke changes the taste.Food was good and staff very friendly', "French fries came with something burn. No icecubes available according to the lady in the counter. Other person got ice though... I don't understand. Fanta left a straight on the glass which I can't understand either... all looks and tastes weird", "It's -7 outside and inside it's close to zero Celsius too. There's no heating! Even the employee at the service desk was like yeah it's pretty cold.
We tried to enjoy a quick dinner but it's literally freezing.
And also not for the first time, it's like this for long but with the extreme cold it's just unbearable.
People are sitting in with winter jackets on.
It's even cold for Germans, just imagine haha."]

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 7:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews: ['Ordered Plant Based nuggets, got all the way home before we realized they were actually meat nuggets. Came back to ask for a replacement, and they handed us the old, cold nuggets that had probably been sitting there since we left.\n\nThey were nice and polite. But handing us the old, cold nasty nuggets was too much to not comment on it.', "Easily one of the worst experiences I've ever had at any restaurant, the employees were unresponsive and I had wait and hour and 10 minutes for my meal. I went up multiple times in that period and tried to get my meal, but the employees just ignored me. The first time I went to complain, they took my receipt. The second time they said ok we'll get on it. Then 20 minutes later I went back and they said they had lost my receipt. I had to recite my order and not leave in order to receive my food, annoying everybody else in the building", 'Took 40 minutes to get food. My friends food didn’t arrive after an hour (and also a complaint) and it turns out the staff just “lost the order”. They eventually sorted it out. Do not eat here unless you want to be waiting for ages to eat “fast” food.']

Name: Bornholmer Hütte
Summary: Old-school joint offering German pub eats, local brews, a pool table & nine-pin bowling.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ['No nonsense down to earth original Berliner Bierkneipe (a beer pub) that serves the local lager beers and an assortment of spirits as well as a small selection of typical Street food. The walls are still tar stained to a brown yellow and smoking was still permitted inside the guest area. Service was friendly and welcoming.', 'The place is super smokey and the ambience not really nice. BUT they have a really old Kegelbahn from 1904 downstairs, which is just awesome to play on. For this you need to make a reservation though!', 'Fantastic authentic Berlin bar with friendly staff. Also very nice to watch football 🍺⚽ They even have a ninepin bowling alley 🎳']

Name: Tbilisi
Summary: Georgian venue with wooden decor, serving chachapuri dumplings, lobiani bread & a choice of grappas.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['What a wonderful restaurant!  We were so impressed with the food and the service--the wait staff was so friendly.  We started with an order of Khatschapuri Spinatit to share and each of us ordered our own dishes as well.  We all thought the food was delicious.  Their Georgian wine is excellent as well.  The prices are definitely reasonable given the great service and quality of the food.', 'Came there for an impromptu dinner. The outside tables were full (or reserved) so we agreed to sit inside next to the window and move later but ended up staying inside. Good at the end, could observe all the traditional decorations and learn a bit about Georgian culture.

The staff was extremely nice and helpful.

We asked for katchapuri, khinkali with cheese (never seen this anywhere else), a beetroot salad (great for a starter) and a chicken in a sauce. It was a lot even for the 3 of us. Depends how hungry you are but 3 dishes to share for three people should be enough. It was very well made and we also got to show the Georgian cuisine for the first time to our friend, which he loved.', 'This place is simply marvelous and one of my favorite restaurants in Berlin. The cozy atmosphere, filled with nooks, crannies, and candlelight, creates a warm and inviting setting.  have been to Tbilisi multiple times, and I love the authentic Georgian dishes, especially the khinkali and katchapuri. Just remember to order them a day in advance since they take time to prepare. I have laughed here, celebrated, and savored every bite. While it is a bit pricey and the food takes time, the wonderful company makes it well worth the wait.']

Name: North Andes Coffee | Prenzlauer Berg
Summary: Snug, straightforward source for premium coffees made from Colombian beans roasted on-site.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews:
['One of the best coffee spots in Berlin! Every drink is made with two shots, so you get real coffee, not just a flavored drink. Definitely a new go-to for me!', 'The most excellent coffee in Berlin can be found at this café. Cappuccino and flat white are indeed coffee-based beverages with a robust flavor profile. After visiting this cafe, you will find it difficult to enjoy any other coffee in Berlin. Additionally, they offer pastel de natas with chocolate, which are both delicious and not excessively sweet. The baristas are polite, and the service is prompt. The prices are quite reasonable considering the exceptional quality provided (Cappuccino €3.50, flat white €3.60).', 'The coffee I had was flat white to go and I was perfect for my taste. Creamy delicious tonic for my sleepy body!

I had also one Columbian enpanada, that was with chicken filling. Was not properly warm or spiced enough for my taste, but otherwise fresh.

Service also was very friendly and there is enough space inside or on the outer table to sit and chill. That makes the place a gem find in a busy city area.']

Name: UNSER CAFÉ
Summary: Artisanal bread, salads, Portuguese pastel de nata tarts & breakfast at a cozy bakery/cafe.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['That’s just sad. We waited 1h20 (sic!) to get this. Ingredients from the menu were missing, bread and salad were not fresh, and the dishes were tasteless altogether.\nIt used to be a great place, but not anymore. It is our last visit.', 'Self service. Crowded place where you don’t get to eat in peace at your seat because all the guests are running around and have to pass by us and walk through the whole place when standing up to get their own food. We waited forever for our food and once we collected it we were deeply disappointed. The „plantain“ were the most horrible ones I’ve ever had and tasted like cardboard - I don’t even know how it’s possible to mess them up so badly. They forgot our bread but apologized. And I got served a croissant to go with my English breakfast - possibly another mistake?. The Pastel de nata were mediocre and the bill was certainly too high for what we got.', 'Very cute place with great food. Portuguese specialties and brunch classics like eggs Benedict, bowls, great baking goods and tasty coffee. Also big plus: gluten-free cake selection. Also vegan options of course. Very family friendly and also dogs allowed. We’ve been there on January but I could imagine it being nice during summer as well since they have outdoor seating as well. It’s self service and the staff was also friendly!']

Name: Restaurant Herr Rossi
Summary: Traditional Italian specialties presented in a mellow setting with a warm, intimate vibe.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Despite not having a reservation, my friends and I impulsively decided to go on a Friday night, but we were thankfully accommodated with seats! The staff were very kind and attentive. The atmosphere was serene, and it seemed like a popular spot for the couples. The food was very tasty, especially the fish which we particularly enjoyed. The accompanying vegetables were also great. Highly recommended restaurant!', 'Here Rossi holds a special place in my heart. It’s my go to, my local, great food amazing staff, it’s a perfect restaurant. The wine list is curated locally and hand selected so pretty much every single bottle you could order is delicious. The staff is top notch! Truly a wonderful restaurant….You should stop reading this review and go to Herr Rossi', "Evolution or consistency? The restaurant conundrum. You get famous and busy, and people keep coming. This place chose consistency. They've been here since Bowie, and not much has changed. The food is still professionally prepared, but Italian in principle, rather than origin. I doubt anyone leaves here disappointed. The prices are fair and the place has the vibe of the place spies go to blend in and trade secrets."]

Name: Osteria Tressanti
Summary: Homemade pasta, carpaccio, tiramisu & Italian wines offered in a bright, contemporary space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['It was delicious! Had an amazing first course with polpo on a cream of chickpeas *yammy* and Parmigiana di Melanzane as main dish. If they serve the pasta with truffle, you have to take it. Unfortunately we did not keep track of the time and as we had a date in the planetarium, we had to leave before enjoying the main course. Just hmmmm ', 'lovely and authentic Italian place! Food was amazing, you have to get truffle pasta and tiramisu! Also they served gluten-free pasta, big big plus 🙏🏼
We had white wine and aperitifs, also very tasty. a lot of Italian guests which speaks for itself, true Italian place 😍
My friend had her birthday and she got a tiramisu as a gift, so kind!
Thanks for the great experience :)', 'A cute place, very nice relaxed atmosphere with a detailed wine list with many natural wine varieties.

Pictured is the vegetarian Truffle Carbonara, Puttanesca, and Tiramisu. Everything was delicious. A very good tiramisu as well, maybe the best I’ve tried in Berlin.

I recommend a reservation as the restaurant gets pretty busy at dinner time.']

Name: Korean Food Stories - Restaurant
Summary: Creative takes on homestyle Korean rice bowls & BBQ grills, in a compact, minimalist space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, 6:30 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['As an Asian, I have never had a bulgogi like this. Also, they didn’t add sesame oil in the bowl, which is very basic ingredient of Korean bowl. It was purely spicy and sour. This maybe a fake Korean restaurant.', 'Quite honestly I never was a big fan of Korean food, but this little restaurant in my neighborhood totally changed my opinion :). Really fresh food, delicious taste and very reasonable prices. There are some tables inside and outside as well. Very clean, friendly staff, English speaking and quick food preparation. Recommended for a light healthy meal. Vegan options as well, take away, pay cash. Will go again!', 'Amazing place. Not only is the food tasty and filling, it also super healthy! You can tell it’s a family business for how they take care of their customers. I have been visiting them over the years and this place never disappoints. Thanks!']

Name: ABC - Allans Breakfast Club & Wine Bar
Summary: Popular brunches with eggs, bagels & craft coffee, plus German wines, at a trendy modern cafe/bar.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
["Lovely place and service. For a brunch it's the price, could be a bit bigger the portion, but overall it's good. By card it's only one payment, which means one person needs to pay for the whole table. This is annoying as later you need to pay for others and so...", 'I’ve likely found my favourite brunch place in Berlin. The food is exquisite, I was frankly, quite blown away by the ABC Tasting Plate.

Service, on the other hand, can be quite slow but I think that’s very common for brunch places anywhere in Berlin, especially on a weekend.

Make a reservation or go early!', "ABC had been on my brunch list for quite a while. The food was good but didn't exceed my expectations. The staff was friendly, though service was a bit slow, and unfortunately, they had run out of orange juice and other juice options that day. The shakshuka was a bit too spicy, which wasn't mentioned on the menu."]

Name: Cafe Neue Liebe
Summary: Waffles & croissants, plus vegan & vegetarian global fare, at a hip cafe with al-fresco seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
["The best vegan breakfast in Berlin!

I came back here for the waffles, but the breakfast dips platter pleasantly surprised me! It comes with a bread basket as well. Honestly I didn't expect to like the croissant as much as I did, would definitely recommend the croissants here!", 'After more than one week in Germany I FINALLY tried a franzbrötchen there (vegan of course), I took their cinnamon-apple one which was absolutely marvelous. I would definitely recommend it :)', 'It’s really pretty. The whipped cream as sensational, amazing, flawless, but the waffle was okay. The olive dip is also super good. The chai was really watery and a bit tasteless. The cappuccino doesn’t even resembles a real cappuccino, unfortunately.
The vibe is good, it’s a good place to go and chat with friends but overall I wouldn’t come back.']

Name: Miss Phuong Restaurant
Summary: Traditional Vietnamese dishes such as pho noodle soup presented in a quaint dining room.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Absolutely amazing
The food was delicious
The atmosphere was calming
The presentation was beautiful
The service was quick and kind', 'We were there alone. Therefore, we received our order super quickly. And it tasted well. Nicely setup with the interior.  There are also a couple of easy benches outside with rain protection, so I could imagine also eating there more often.', 'This was our first time eating Vietnamese food and wow wow wow it was delicious! The service was incredible, definitely the nicest and most patient people we’ve meet so far in Berlin. She read the menu to us in English helping find the perfect meal and she really did pick perfectly. Highly recommend for people who like Vietnamese food and especially for people looking to try it for the first time we had an amazing experience !']

Name: Masel Topf
Summary: Creative takes on Israeli meze plates & grills at an elegant spot with a terrace on a leafy street.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['This was certainly one of the culinary highlights of our trip to Berlin. Cosy terrace, lovely vintage interior and then the food…we just loved it! We had ladke mit lachs as a starter and then the famous Jeruzalem teller. Huge portions and excellent price/quality rate. Strongly recommended!', 'Wonderful breakfast at this cute lil place near the Wasserturm. Super-friendly service & delicious house-cured salmon.', 'Tender lamb, juicy fish, tasty humus! Nice place in the very heart of Prenzlauer Berg! Prices are quite high, but the meal worth it!']

Name: Bejte-Ethiopia
Summary: Cozy venue with Ethiopian artifacts for spicy meat & vegetable stews served with injera flatbread.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['We went for lunch and had mix platter of both vegetarian and non vegetarian options. They were delicious. The only thing was missing that the food was almost at room temperature where I was expecting it to be hot. The tej honey wine was great a bit sweet for my taste but enjoyable, again it was served at room temperature. I haven’t tried much of Ethiopian cuisine so exactly can’t say if it’s supposed to that way. But I can confirm the taste were great and filling. Outdoor seating was nice and they have cozy indoor. Clean Toilets available.', "The restaurant had a cozy, old-fashioned vibe and lots of people seemed to like it. We tried the vegan food, and it was really tasty. The owners and staff were always friendly, which made the place feel nice. It's smart to book ahead because it gets busy. If you're into Ethiopian food, this restaurant is a must-try!", 'I had dinner at Bejte-Ethiopia with a friend and we ordered a non-vegetarian combo for 2 people. This was my first time eating Ethiopian food so I cannot vouch for authenticity, but to me it tasted quite good, perhaps a way to describe the food would be that it’s somewhat similar to certain Indian curry dishes. Their special coffee was also very nice. I liked the decor, atmosphere and the friendly personnel. The 1-star reduction is due to the service being extremely slow, unfortunately. Luckily my friend and I weren’t in a rush so it was an overall positive dining experience. Quick note: you have to eat everything with your hands, so it can get a bit messy. This isn’t a criticism as it’s the traditional way to eat Ethiopian food, just be aware and wash your hands well prior.']

Name: Berkis
Summary: Traditional Greek meze & souvlaki in an understated, family-run restaurant with outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 1:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Very nice Greek restaurant.  Great food, great service, great location.  Very busy place.  Outdoor seating full.  Was able to get a window seat.  Had the Spanakopita and land chops with a nice glass of wine.  Food was delicious.  Chops cooked excellent.  Nice portions.  Definitely worth a visit!', 'First and last time. I paid 14,50 Euros for a grill meat plate and got less meat than what you would get in a pita. Not even a full pita bread and half of the plate was filled with fries. That is what i call stealing. About the taste, they could at least use some salt.', "Went here on a friend's recommendation, we were able to get a table without reservation but it was quite packed, so definitely make one! The food is really good and honestly very affordable for how much you get! Also whatever those fried dough balls in honey are called, get those for dessert if you have a sweet tooth, thank me later"]

Name: Saigon Com Nieu
Summary: Vietnamese soups, noodles & fragrant curries in a low-key space with lanterns & sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Average food : crispy duck was lack in crispiness and flavour, mango sauce was kind of too sweet and it did nit go well with the duck.
Could have added some spiciness to make it better.
Atmosphere looks good
Service was fine, could be improved and see how they reply to your review below , how rude! So taking 2 stars out of service.

Update: reply to the comments, it’s the item in the menu I am talking about, does it mean that only that noodle you mentioned is good there?
For that price we paying, you should make sure it have good quality and taste!
Where is your customer service???
So better remove other food item from your menu!!!', 'The food was quite authentic and we liked the choice in the menu! No westernised boring Asian “fusion” that you can find in any other average place. The Banh Xeo was fantastic 😊', 'Fast service, good prices and amazing, amazing food. Would highly recommend. I got the peanut satay with crispy duck and I loved it.']

Name: Restaurant Winterfeld
Summary: Italian mainstays like pizza & pasta, in an elegant room with floor-to-ceiling wine shelves.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Very good food and nice people. It’s in a quiet alley at Winterfeldt‘s.', 'A beautiful place with so much potential. My meal was regrettable and I just hope they redo their menu and replace the kitchen staff.  Candied walnuts in a pasta dish? Frozen inedible beef carpaccio?  The ratings are a ruse, this place needs to be avoided—many greater options for Italian food just around the corner.', "I dont know about this one... the staff seemed nice and attentive and the food was good. We were a group of 5 people, getting steak and pasta. It got served in a reasonable time but I ordered pizza and had to wait for ever until I got served. Everyone else was literally finishing off their plate, the moment the pizza was served. Very disappointing and an unpleasant experience. The food was good tho. I wouldn't come back and can't recommend this one."]

Name: April
Summary: Laid-back cafe/bar for breakfasts, salads & light meals, with an extensive selection of wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['The best breakfast I’ve ever had! The staff were great and the place itself was charming. 10/10', 'April is a charming breakfast café that delights with its cozy ambiance and welcoming atmosphere. The menu offers a wide array of breakfast options, from classic favorites like pancakes and eggs Benedict to creative, seasonal dishes that showcase fresh, local ingredients. The coffee is rich and expertly brewed, perfectly complementing the delicious food. The friendly staff make you feel right at home, providing attentive service with a smile. Whether you’re starting your day with a hearty breakfast or just grabbing a quick pastry, April is the perfect spot to enjoy a relaxing morning.', 'Small evening menu but still something for everyone. Not busy on a Monday night but enough tables to create an atmosphere. Intimate venue with almost a classic feel. Lovely friendly, attentive staff. Food was excellent and plenty there, worth the price. Would definitely visit again if I was in the area']

Name: Ristorante Cinque
Summary: Pasta, pizzas & tiramisu at a restaurant with traditional decor & an umbrella-shaded patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["This place is a hidden gem! If you're looking for authentic Italian food and atmosphere, then this is the place. The staff are very personable and the food is gorgeous. Our group ate here two nights in a row and had a wonderful experience both nights.

Make sure to budget plenty of time for dinner at this restaurant! The restaurant invites you to leisurely enjoy your evening in true Italian style, so don't plan on being in and out.", 'Very enjoyable dining at Cinque Berlin. We LOVED the antipasti - full of Italian flavours, olive oil, seafood, tomatoes and flavours.
The bread was not interesting though (make that better, please), but five stars for the service from our waiter Antonello - a very nice and attentive man doing everything to make our visit very enjoyable.
I loved the risotto, full of flavour and the dessert, which to our luck was very light - lemon sorbet with prosecco. Very very good!
We were there very early so not many people around,
but only trying to imagine the liveliness there when full of people. Niiiiice!
We will be bqck!', 'I visited here as a part of a hosted dinner reception by our conference team. The place is very nice and the set food menu had one vegetarian penne pasta that I had which was great. The dessert was amazing!  The servers were really nice too.']

Name: Nini e Pettirosso
Summary: Informal Italian eatery offering Neapolitan-style pizzas by the pie & slice, plus simple pastas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews: ['Can’t say how many times we were eating here, is our favorite pizza place in Berlin, so we go there quite often. Each time pizza is great and they have quick service, so you do not need to wait long. Their local is not big, but during summer there is a lot of tables outside.', 'Delicious pizza with a perfect crust—crispy outside, soft inside. Quality ingredients shine through in every bite. Lovely service and a cozy ambiance enhance the dining experience. A go-to spot for pizza enthusiasts!', 'Best pizza place in Berlin.\nNice atmosphere. Wheel chair friendly.\nFriendly staff']

Name: Milchmanns Kaffeehaus
Summary: A big breakfast menu, plus salads, pastries & nutritious cakes, at an airy, rustic-chic cafe.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['Nice place to catch up with friends / family and enjoy a  wholesome, tasty breakfast. The staff is extremely friendly. The place was pretty full (at least on Sunday when we went), so make sure to make a reservation in advance. Vegetarian options are also available.', "The year is 2023 and you cannot use a credit card in such a cafe.  I can understand if it's street food.  Price, service, cleanliness is fine. I hope they change this situation.", 'When I went, it was 11:50. They came to take my order at 12:05 and said that I could not order breakfast because it was past 12:00 breakfast time. 5 minutes had passed and I could not have my breakfast because they did not take care of me for 15 minutes.']

Name: Burger King
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Pretty small Burger King. If the store is packed you will have a hard time finding a seat. I was satisfied with my order. No items were missing and they accept coupons aswell. I had to wait 5 minutes before receiving my order. Male Toilet was not dirty. All in all I visited much worse Burger King stores', "I recently purchased two menus and two extra burgers from Burger King, but unfortunately, upon arriving home and inspecting the order, I found that they had once again made errors. This isn't the first time I've experienced such issues with their service.\n\nFirstly, instead of receiving the Chicken Clubhouse Burger as ordered, I was given a chicken nugget burger, which I personally dislike. Furthermore, none of the menus included the fries that were supposed to accompany them. Additionally, they provided random dips, none of which were the ones I had ordered.   I'm too tired to go back there, but I'll certainly never eat from there again.", 'Sold me undercooked burger. No apologies. No compensation.']

Name: Joseph-Roth-Diele
Summary: Classic schnitzel, dumplings & potato salad in an ornate, wood-lined venue with piano music.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Very good service and nice vibe, but the food is not that great. I had a Herring Sandwich and it was quite average. My wife had a schnitzel and it was too dry. Beer and cheesecake were great though.', "We had a brilliant dinner at the restaurant. The service from the waiters and bar staff was outstanding, the traditional German food was delicious and the restaurant's location and atmosphere is fantastic. Highly recommended and we will definitely visit again next time we are in Berlin!", 'You have to book to be sure of a table. it must be the "lonely planet write-up" effect. The decor is fascinating and the staff are very accommodating but sadly the food was OK but not up to the vibe that was promised. When we couldn\'t get a table the first night, we chanced on a place a little further down the road that had amazing food - Oh Panama!!!']

Name: Dalmacija Grill
Summary: Homestyle Croatian meat & seafood grills in a wood-paneled dining area or at sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Outstanding food and service. The dishes that were recommended to us turned out to be amazing dishes! It’s our first time to try Croatian food and an absolute must try in this restaurant!', 'Truly a pleasant surprise.\nJoseph was an amazing host. Very friendly and very helpful.\nThe food was excellent. Delicious and well seasoned.', 'I struggle eating this place. It is what it is and you get what you expect. Classic Croatian meat platters, skewers and steaks. It comes with real 80s charm. The decoration, the furniture as well as the drapes. But sometimes this is exactly what I‘m craving for. And among Croatian places across Berlin this is probably my favorite. The owner is super nice and funny, the portions are generous and prices are ok. And the atmosphere is what it is. Either you love it or you hate it. When I crave for Croatian in Berlin I also want this atmosphere. Exactly this atmosphere.']

Name: Kin Dee
Summary: Modern takes on classic Thai curries & noodle dishes, plus tropical cocktails, in a stylish space.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['A pleasant surprised for us to walk-in & able to find a nice table next to window (my favorite type of seating). It’s a three-courses meal. We enjoyed this boutique style of dining and specialty dishes. This style really elevated the Thai cuisine to the next level  — not only it was delicious but also skillful decorated & coordinated. The staff was knowledgeable & explaining the concept of chef & owners ideas.
The food was very delicious with some nice twists & gave it an upscale feel. Super friendly staff
& helpful with details of dishes. For us, it’s definitely worth a try & recommend for others to try out new ways / innovative of food. Happy dining !
Life is good 😊', 'A Micheline starred restaurant serving a set menu of thai food. The food was delicious and the staff was very attentive. A wholesome experience very much recommended!', 'I was really looking forward to experiencing this restaurant and while I feel like they are trying it we can’t ignore that it does have a Michelin star and I don’t feel that it’s currently at the level it needs to be.

The staff training and attention to detail is simply not there.

The food, while I enjoyed it, was very much overpriced and there are in my opinion better Thai options in Berlin right now in a lower price range.

I do however very much appreciate their ethos, and that they source local, sustainable and ethical ingredients.

I will try it again in a year or so when they have hopefully worked out their teething problems.']

Name: OH, PANAMA
Summary: Wine pairings & creative takes on regional dishes at a stylish venue with courtyard seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['The overall note would be between 3 and 4  because after having tried many Michelin-list restaurants "Oh Panama" doesnt feel like a 5 in terms of the variety and "explosion" of tastes, and the interior. The 4 courses dinner was nice but too pricey vs the relative simplicity of the meals on my opinion. The service was nice even though the staff was changing 4 times during the service which was a bit confusing. The atmosphere is nice but not more than this, it didn\'t feel as an exceptional design effort as it could be the case in some other places with a similar price for example. The food itself was good actually, but not at the level where I\'d expect it to be for a similar price. It\'s German cuisine and not knowing it that much, I\'d say it didn\'t leave any special memory compared to similar experiences with French or Japanese ones for a similar price.\nGenerally speaking, I\'d say it\'s a very nice place but too expensive (overpriced) versus it\'s taste experience.', 'We had a three course menu that was absolutely delicious. Clean and fresh flavors that were well balanced in a relaxed atmosphere added to the relaxed vibe. This is a place that does not compromise quality of food and executes it with the perfect balance.', 'Excellent food and great patio vibe. Also the wine pairing was top notch. Highly recommend!']
